description: Argentinian promo for Taco Cat Goat Cheese Pizza: the capybara.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Expansion for Base-game

name: Warhammer 40,000: Apocalypse
description:
Warhammer 40,000: Apocalypse is a game of massive battles set in the grim darkness of the far future. If you've ever wanted to field an entire Space Marine Battle Company or household of Imperial Knights (and more besides), then this is the game for you!

As with Battle-forged armies in Warhammer 40,000, your collections are organised into any of 10 different types of Detachment (and each led by a Commander) that move and fight together on the battlefield. Each Detachment also gains a Faction Ability, enabling you to theme your army by Detachment and include narrative-driven alliances within it.

The innovative rules for Apocalypse enable you to play massive battles to completion in a matter of hours. Alternating Detachment activations ensures that there is minimal downtime for players, maintaining the fast-paced and exciting action throughout. Damage is resolved in the final phase of each game turn, meaning that even units that are destroyed will still have a chance to make their mark on the battle before they succumb.

In each turn, players issue Advance, Aimed Fire or Assault orders in secret to each of their Detachments, giving them a chance to bluff, surprise and outmanoeuvre their opponents with their choices.

Each player constructs a deck of 30 Command Assets (from a choice of 300 included in the set), including a number of faction-specific cards, enabling them to pull off strategic power plays as the battle unfolds. These effects include devastating psychic powers, changes of orders and crucial re-rolls.

There are six Apocalypse missions to choose from, as well as a mission generator with which to create your own.

This set contains:
- 120-page Apocalypse Field Manual (including full game rules)
- 6 punchboard sheets of double-sided Apocalypse gameplay tokens
- 300 Command Asset cards
- 12 six-sided dice
- 12 twelve-sided dice
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Gong Fermer's Revenge
description:
The Year is 1349 AD. As Gong Fermer inspects his useless crop of rotten vegetables, he simmers with frustration. He’s quite aware that he’s the poorest, lowliest wretch in this god-forsaken village—and has the ripe, brown stains on his tattered shirt to prove it. But just to make sure he remembers, the villagers laugh and spit in his face every day, reveling in his misery. As if crappy crops weren’t enough!

The excitement begins when Gong decides that he’s taken enough crap for one lifetime. Even with the Black Plague killing peasants and noblemen at record speed, Gong decides to take the King’s justice into his own hands, with nothing but his battered pride, his trusty dung shovel, and a rusty bucket! The King’s battalion of armored knights, archers, and soldiers stand ever ready… an entire army of seasoned warriors. What chance does Gong have against such wealth and might? Nonetheless, a word festers in the back of Gong’s mind: revolt!

You and your friends will have a blast recreating medieval life by playing this fast pace, strategic and addicting card game where nothing is as it seems, nor as it should be. Instead of singing the praises of "Long live the King", you will joyfully cry out, "Down with the King, and may Gong Fermer reign!"

name: Oscar Robertson's Pro Basketball Strategy
description:
Part of a 5 game series of Rocky Graziano (Boxing), Vince Lombardi (Football), Gil Hodges (Baseball), Rod Gilbert (Hockey), and Oscar Robertson (Basketball).

Historical players are rated on 2 basic and 1 optional factors and advancement on court and shooting is dice and table driven. Results in high level treatment as players fall into broader groupings.
publishers: Research Games, Inc. / Athol / RGI / ARC

name: Legends of the Ancient World: The Dark Vale
description:
Word has reached the street of Redpoint that a lost artifact of great power lies to the southwest, in an obscure vale in the ancient Seawatch Mountains. It is the Blackstone, a relic of ancient power from a mythic age. There are only a few references to it in the tomes of history, all of them fearful and despairing. It has been the tool of several men of monstrous evil, finally disappearing in one of the wildest battles of the Mage War.

The potential for an era of unchecked evil abounds, unless you find the Blackstone first and destroy it.

The Dark Vale is a complete fantasy adventure for solitaire or group play. The game includes the adventure book, rules, pieces and game board; and is compatible with GURPS(R) and the Fantasy Trip(R) (a.k.a. Melee and Wizard ).
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Role Playing

name: Harpoon Naval Review 2009
description:
Contents:


Armada Española - An article on the current state of the Spanish fleet
A Question of Sovereignty - Spain vs. Morocco over the North African enclaves
El Golfo de Coquivacoa - Columbia vs. Venezuela in a historical scenario
Sueño Submarino De Hugo (Hugo’s Submarine Dream) - Venezuelan submarines against a U.S. blockade
Cauldron 2010 - France and the U.S. square off in four scenarios
The Outer Air Battle - Defending a U.S. carrier group in scenarios from the 1960s to today
Offensive Jamming in Harpoon4 - Updated jamming rules for use with The Outer Air Battle scenarios, a reprint from The Naval SITREP.
Pirates of Somalia - A joint naval force faces off against the Somali pirates
Sub vs. Convoy: A Harpoon4 Scenario Generator
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Nautical, Wargame

name: Schwerpunkt: Volume 12
description:
A collection of 12 ASL scenarios designed for tournament play by the Tampa ASL Group.

Expands:

Advanced Squad Leader


Contents:
Designer notes and articles. (24 pages)
12 scenarios SP133 - SP144

SP133 - Old Hickory's Path
East of Kirchhellen, Germany, 25 March 1945

SP134 - Barracuda!
Fontenay, Le Pesnel, France, 25 June 1944

SP135 - Tale of the Comet
Tecklenberg, Germany, 2 April 1945

SP136 - Orczy Square
Budapest, Hungary, 11 January 1945

SP137 - The Bozsoki Relay
Torda, Transylvannia (Romania), 22 September 1944

SP138 - Lacking Coordination
Syke, Germany, 9 April 1945

SP139 - Oder Dare
Gross Neuendorf, Germany 2 February 1945

SP140 - Red Valentines
Ssagopschin, USSR, 28 September 1942

SP141 - Broken Beek
Beek, Holland, 20 September 1944

SP142 - To No Avail
Stepanovka, USSR, 30 July 1943

SP143 - The Battle for St. Cloud
St. Cloud, Algeria, 8 November 1942

SP144 - One More Day of Freedom
Corregidor Island, The Philippines, 6 May 1942
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II

name: Columbiz
description: The players place their counters on the board by throwing certain combinations of numbers with the dice. They score points by forming rows with their own counters or by capturing an opponent’s counters. The player with the most points wins the game.

name: Incredible Courage at Austerlitz: Telnitz
description:
Incredible Courage at Austerlitz - Telnitz is GSI's first offering on Napoleonic warfare. The game focuses on tactical level combat and maneuver during the Battle of Austerlitz in December 1805.
The game features variable combat strengths. Turns are 10 minutes of time.   The rules are modeled around the seven battlefield operating systems which make them easily understood and easy to learn.  Unlike other games at this level the rules will not be massive.  Troop replacements are generated by returning stragglers to the battle.  A few features are variable combat strengths, elite units, and levels of order.  Units start with a certain amount of these and as they lose them their abilities are reduced.
Buxhowden came down off the Pratzen Heights to attack the French right since it was so weak.  Little did he know that while this was true at 0700 in the morning the Iron Marshall, Davout, would arrive shortly and provide the bulwark against which the defense would halt and then throw back the Coalition forces.

Similar to the Death Ride series this game is the first of many that wplayers will be able to build into a larger monster of the Austerlitz battle. Again critical thinking will allow the players to figure out the correct formations and deployment of their troops. Infantry units are modeled at the company level, cavalry at the squadron level, and artillery at the section level. The rules for this detailed game will surprise you with their clarity and brevity.

name: Black Forest
description:
It was a small village at the base of the Black Forest in Germany. Life was simple and peaceful in the village until a series of brutal murders. The horrific nature of the killings left no question that werewolves had infiltrated the village.

The villagers had little time to determine who the beasts were. The werewolves were cunning, and used the paranoia to help the village tear itself apart. Which side prevailed?

Black Forest is a cooperative board game for 3 to 5 players. Players win or lose together as members of the village. However, one player is secretly a werewolf, trying to defeat the other players. In order to win, the villagers must ascertain which player is the werewolf, and eliminate all of his or her villager tokens in the Court House.

The game is divided into two phases. In the Day Phase, players take turns placing their Villager tokens on village spaces (like the Fields, where they earn gold; the Market, where they can buy market cards; the Seer, where they can hire the Seer to have a vision on another player, and possibly gain clues about the player's role; or the Court House, where players vote to eliminate a Villager token belonging to one of the players).

In the Night Phase, players are dealt a hand of Night cards, and must choose one and pass the rest, until they have a card chosen for each player in the game. Cards are then assigned and revealed. The Night Phase is where the werewolf player tries to eliminate Villager tokens from the game, but also when the villagers try to fortify against werewolf attack.

After every other Night Phase, there is a Harvest, where the players must have enough gold to make it through. If enough Villager tokens have been eliminated that the Harvest cannot be successful, the werewolf player wins. Villagers can also win by upgrading all 12 Village tiles, but this involves spending gold that may be necessary for the Harvest.
mechanics: Open Drafting, Simultaneous Action Selection, Team-Based Game, Voting, Worker Placement

name: Quest: Zeit der Helden – Abenteuerband 3
description:
This is an expansion of Quest: Angriff der Orks and Quest: Wolfsjagd, not a basic game. To play this adventure, you will need both of these games.

The included adventure is meant as a prequel to the campaign in Quest: Wolfsjagd and needs both gaming material from Quest: Angriff der Orks and Quest: Wolfsjagd.
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Storytelling, Variable Player Powers

name: Star Fleet Battles: Module C6 – Lost Empires
description:
An expansion for Star Fleet Battles Captain’s Edition, Star Fleet Battles - Module C6: Lost Empires covers the extinct Paravian and Carnivon empires, presented as their ships and weapons would have been by the time of the General War (except for that annoying extinction thing).

Each empire is presented with two alternate histories, although players can ignore both and write their own if they wish.

The Carnivons might have existed as a major empire between the Lyrans and Kzintis, or they might have escaped to the WYN Cluster.

The Paravians might have survived Gorn attempts to destroy their empire and could have ended up allied to the Romulans (while the ISC became allies of the Gorns). Alternately, they could exist as edge-of-the-map raiders.

260 Pages, 280 die-cut counters
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Simulation, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Star Borders: Aliens
description:
Star Borders: Aliens from designer Lance McMillan and developer Alan Emrich is a complete, 2-player stand-alone game that introduces two new factions, the Rhame Swarm (a.k.a., the “Bugs”) and the C1B0R6 Collective (a.k.a., the “Bots”) that are fighting to establish control of a contested region of the galaxy in the Star Borders universe.

This game is completely mate-able with Star Borders: Humanity and introduces a few new wrinkles to the universe, including the first 3-engine ships, ships that morph, and other strange goodies. Of course, there are new maps, counters, and compatible cards that can be retrofitted to Humanity so the design-your-own-scenarios possibilities have been increased exponentially.

Star Borders: Aliens features 7 new scenarios exploring the very unexpected war between the Bugs and the Bots, and the inclusion of a bonus scenario to allow players to bring in the forces from Humanity. The tension between the asymmetrical abilities of these fleets creates a great player tension on the board that you will long enjoy!

Complexity: 4 on a 9 scale
Solitaire Suitability: 5 on a 9 scale
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement

name: Battle of Golems: The Algorithmic Card Game
description:
The first tabletop game that allows you to simply and easily learn programming and robotics without a computer (with conditions, loop, logic, subprogram etc), and to enjoy discovering exciting strategies! For 2 to 4 players, aged 8 years and older (but played from 5-6+ ages). Training of logic, memory, team interaction - all this in a simple, but deep in content, a board game. Play at home with children, in the company, at school and use it in STEM additional education.

Welcome to the Battle of Golems! Algorythmus archmage by Cybertania’s king’s order created Golems - clay robot warriors using coal as fuel. Due to the magic crystal in its head Golem can follow commands and perform short series of them called Programs. King also ordered to build a special field, which would be used for battles between warrior programmers and their Golems. You will take part in the tournament and prove that you’re the best robot engineer of Cybertania.

In 10 rounds each player set up the Program for his Robot-Golem from Action cards and executes it. The Damage tokens and Cards of Fortune will show you how many rounds and lives remain before the victory and whether you can apply Cycles, Conditions or other Bonuses when writing the Program.

You and your opponents in each round usually have four programming slots (depending on the type of Golem), so you need to take care of a short but effective algorithm. You can use both ready-made scenarios (more then 10+ including in Scenario book) and create your own rules, fields, and actions!

Equipment:

• 5 two-sided (summer-winter) board pieces: (4 3x3 sizes and 1 4x4 size) (Print&Play includes only 1 4x4 size)
• 4 Golems figures
• 6 two-sided golem cards
• 76 action cards
• 12 Damage tokens for 4 players
• 22 two-sided obstacle (barriers) tokens + 8 logic tokens
• 40 fortune cards
• 3 Bots program cards
• Scenery book.
• Game rules.
mechanics: Action Queue, Grid Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Sovrano
description:
The game of Sovrano is a straight-forward and easy to learn game of strategy and cunning. However, beneath the relative simplicity lies a depth of complexity that will keep the game interesting and re-playable.

Assemble your guards and prepare to lead your emperor to the throne and absolute power!

Sovrano is a game for two players that typically lasts between 15 to 30 minutes. Each player has 11 pieces (1 Emperor, 8 Guards, 2 Archers). The center space of the board is the Throne, while on opposite ends of the center row lie the Tower-spaces.

The objective of the game is to be the player who scores the most points by capturing the Tower-spaces (1 point granted per space held at the start of each turn).

The second objective of Sovrano is to be the first player to move their Emperor onto the center space (the Throne-space) and hold it until the start of his or her next turn. This grants that player 3 points and ends the game.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Grid Movement, Player Elimination

name: Frostgrave: Arcane Locations
description:
From the publisher:

Arcane Locations features scenarios focused on some of the more infamous ruins to be found in the Frozen City, such as Brycho’s Celestium, Walenton Manor, and the Arena Without Walls. Also included are new options for developing a wizard’s base in the ruins of Frostgrave.
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Role Playing, Variable Player Powers

name: Alien vs Predator: Unleashed
description:
Description from the publisher:

Based on the Wargame Adaptive Ruleset (WAR), AVP: Unleashed is a fast-paced, tactical game that pits the forces of two or more players against each other. From small skirmish fights of a squad or two to large-scale battles, AVP: Unleashed can be played in an endless number of ways.

This book includes:

132 pages of full color rules and background material on each unit.
Tournament-ready missions and countless ways to play them.
Escalation rules for campaigns
3 full factions' Army Lists: The brave forces of the USCM, the elite Predators, and the overwhelming Aliens
categories: Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Magic: The Gathering – Zendikar
description:
It’s a world of adventure and reward … for those with enough courage to brave its perils. Here, mana works in ways never before experienced. Learn the value of allies, complete quests, face a new Planeswalker, and take advantage of mechanics like Landfall and Traps.

Zendikar, a new world for Magic: The Gathering, is the first set in the Zendikar block. It features 249 black-bordered cards, including randomly inserted premium versions of all cards in the set.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting

name: Street Masters: Rise of the Kingdom – x BattleCON
description:
From the publisher:

A mishap in time sends 3 warriors from another universe into the world of Street Masters. Allies or Rivals? You decide. The warriors are:

Clinhyde Eight - A techno-ninja who fights with a pair of stun rods and wears a body suit that injects him with various stimpacks, heightening reflexes and even providing clairvoyant powers. He can sneak around quickly, run along walls, and interfere with enemies senses.

Khadath Ahemusei - A dimensional ranger, and one of the cover characters for BattleCON: War. He uses a short sword and creates gravity wells which can slow down enemies, ether preventing their escape or preventing their advance.

Star Knight Iri - A magical-girl with a transforming weapon that can take any shape she wishes. She shifts between three forms for high power, high defense, and range. Her true form is a monstrous alien made of pure energy.

This expansion contains 3 characters from the BattleCON universe board game to be used in the Street Masters game.

Each of the three characters comes with one miniature and 1 Ally/Rival card.
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures, Puzzle, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Open Drafting

name: Among the Stars: Lost and Found Promo Card
description:
Part of Artipia's A Fair, a Robbery and a Promo Pack Kickstarter Campaign.

A new location card.

Choose up to 3 cards from the discard pile and set them aside. Once per game, you may swap a card in your hand with one of the set aside cards.
categories: Card Game, City Building, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction
mechanics: Open Drafting, Simultaneous Action Selection, Tile Placement, Variable Player Powers

name: Voll Verwackelt
description:
Tim Löwe and his friends have found the tastiest coconuts imaginable, but unfortunately these coveted fruits are growing on a palm tree that stands in the middle of a shaky rock.

In Voll Verwackelt, players must balance the animals constantly as they move them gently across this unstable rock because only if the balance is kept do you receive coconuts as a reward. Collect the most coconuts by the end of the game, and you win!

name: Killer Bunnies Conquest Adventure
description: Killer Bunnies Quest Conquest Adventure can be played on its own, but it is compatible with the KB Quest Blue Starter (and Boosters). The Conquest Adventure includes all cards and components from the Blue, Yellow, Red, and Violet Conquest Decks, with more cards, more dice (metallic dice too!), more mechanics, more carrots, more small cards, more bunnies, and much more!

name: Battlestar Galactica: Starship Battles – Raptor (SAR/ECM)
description:
The Raptor is designed to play multiple roles, ranging from reconnaissance and scouting, to supporting missions with electronic countermeasures and deploying additional firepower. It is slower and less maneuverable than a Viper, but it is capable of short-range FTL jumps and can be armed to fight back Cylons.

The Raptor SAR/ECM is an excellent tactical craft for search-and-rescue operations, as well as for transport of military forces and technicians. It can also be equipped for short and medium range scans of spacecraft signatures and planet surfaces.

Contents:
1 Raptor
1 Gaming Base
1 Ship Card
1 Maneuver Deck
Set of pilot Cards
categories: Aviation / Flight, Bluffing, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Simulation, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: Magic: The Gathering – Challenger Deck: United Assault
description:
Pre-made deck for Magic the Gathering, intended as a starting point for players who want to play Standard and/or Friday Night Magic. Part of the 2019 Challenger Decks set. Similarly to other pre-made decks, it includes 60 cards. Differently from other pre-made decks, Challenger Decks also include a side board made of 15 cards.
The United Assault deck includes only white energy. It was designed as a cohesive deck that could resist the pressures of the metagame. A reliable deck, that even a beginner could use with confidence.
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting

name: Warhammer 40,000 Dice Masters: Grombrindal's Fury Promo
description:
Promo card included in White Dwarf magazine.

Adds a copy of Grombrindal's Fury Basic Action Card to your Dice Masters Game. Grombrindal's Fury deals 2 damage to target character die. You may then preroll this die. If it is an action face, you may repeat this effect.
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Science Fiction
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Join the Partisans
description:
Postani partizan (Join the Partisans) is a WW2 board game with historical background, where players join Slovenian partisans in liberating their country. Fighting against the Axis, players use dice to win in battles, answer quiz questions about WW2 and preform various tasks including singing, drawing or even bringing food for the comrades at the table.

Each player starts with a set:

one partisan figure
one white guard tower
one colored guard tower (red, orange, blue, green)


Players start the game by putting their partisan figures on a game board which represents Slovenia occupied by Axis. They choose from 130 towns and places. After they done so, they have to put white guard tower anywhere on the map. When white guard towers are set, players draft their first mission card from general headquarters beginning in 1941. The card tells them where to put their colored guard tower and what is the mission. Players have to go through 5 years of war (1941-1945). There are 5 stacks of cards - one per year (250 missions).

Now the game begins. Players throw special dice (D3) and move towards their objective. Other players guard towers represent obstacles and can not be attacked. When a player reaches his objective from General Headquarters card, he must fulfil his/her mission. The player takes 5 battle dice. He has 3 throws to hit the best combination (scale goes from: one pair, two pairs, three of a kind,..., five of the same). After throwing his combination, the player on his right takes a role of "enemy" and tries to throw a combination with bigger value. If player fails in achieving his mission, he must wait for another turn and try again. If he wins, he receive a card from Partisan school.

The Partisan School has quiz questions about WW2. These cards bring points. After fulfilling his orders from General Headquarters players, move their white guard tower. After a successful attack (again with battle dice), a player receives a "Special Mission" card. These also bring points. Now, after both guard towers are eliminated, the player is ready to step into the next year. He again places his white guard tower on the map, and than drafts the card from year 1942 which tells him where to put his colored guard tower and what his the mission in 1942.

The player who gathers most points from Partisan School and Special Missions is the winner.
And yes.. you can get a medal!

—description from the designer
categories: Educational, Party Game, Political, Territory Building, Trivia, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Munchkin: Tails of the Season
description:
Your newest furry Munchkin friends are back for the holidays! With festive art by Katie Cook, Munchkin Tails of the Season is the purrfect addition to Munchkin Tails (or any other Munchkin game that needs a dose of Christmas magic)!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: Oathmark: Battlesworn
description:
Oathmark: Battlesworn is a supplement for Oathmark: Battles of the Lost Age, giving players rules for creating elite units of warriors known as "battlesworn" and charting their progress from battle-to-battle.

In the horror and chaos of battle, the outcome can often hang on the briefest of moments. It is at these times that the actions of one unit can make the difference between victory and defeat. Wise kings know this and realize that it is often prudent to hold back their best units until they can make the greatest difference. These elite units, called the "battlesworn", are more than just powerful combatants, they are symbols of the glory and honor of a kingdom. All young warriors hope to one day join their ranks and add their oathmarks beside those legendary fighters.

This supplement for Oathmark: Battles of the Lost Age contains rules for adding elite units to your armies and charting their progress from battle to battle. Will they grow even more powerful as they gain renown, or be broken in the face of tremendous odds, perhaps someday to be reformed when their kingdom needs them most? Also included are rules for rivers and boats as well as campaigns, featuring all-new scenarios that will give your battlesworn the chance to lead their kingdom to new heights of power and prestige.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame

name: La fabrique à sucre
description:
In this game, you are cooks trying to impress the chef. You participate in 3 different challenges to advance on the winning track. These chalenges use memory and logic. The first one to reach the end of the track win the game.

Le Grand Chef de la fabrique à sucre cherche un nouvel apprenti pour l’aider dans la préparation de friandises. Prenez part aux différents défis (décoration de petits gâteaux, fabrication de brochettes et duel de cônes) et démontrez votre talent de confiseur pour être celui qui obtiendra le tablier d’or et deviendra apprenti chef!

name: War For Chicken Island: Dragon Mama
description:
Dragon Mama is a mini with Leader Card for War For Chicken Island, and comes with two Dragon Hatchling minis and unit cards.

Suggested by backers, created by Draco Studios & Detestable Games.

name: Det bästa ur Drakborgen Återväckt
description:
This is a reissue of a selection of new cards and rules taken from "Drakborgen Återväckt", a 2010 fan expansion to the original Drakborgen (1985).

Drakborgen Återväckt is a popular game variant of Drakborgen created by Simon Lundström and Erik Zetterberg. We are releasing an adaptation of the best from Drakborgen Resurrected as a separate rule and card supplement for pledge level HERO and up.
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy

name: Novi 1799
description:
This game depicts the bloody and furious battle of the 2nd Coalition war that (temporarily) resulted in the loss of french dominion in northern Italy.

Each game box includes:
 One game-map,
2 sheets of counters and markers,
3 Player Aid Cards,
a rule booklet,
an historical commentary.

The scale is 1 hour per turn, about 500 m. per hex,
Each strength point (SP) stands for  50-150 men for infantry
and cavalry (basing on their efficiency rating), and 3-5 guns.
Designer: Enrico Acerbi
Complexity: 3/5
Solitaire suitability: 4/5
mechanics: Chit-Pull System, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Simulation

name: Fluffy Frontier
description:
The animals on Earth are not what they seem. Actually they are different alien types, secretly running the space agencies right under the humans’ noses. In Fluffy Frontier you play as these animals, going on what officially appears to be a man made space mission to Halley’s comet in 2061, looking for life and gathering samples for the humans’ tests. You have collaboratively traveled to the comet in a spaceship that is now parked in close orbit above it.

But there is more. You need to keep the great secret secret, not letting the humans realize that the Petsonauts are actually in charge of it all. While that charade is going on you’re trying to reach your own secret mission of retrieving certain alien supplies that your fellow aliens have sent to you using the interstellar transport system that comets actually are. Plan your strategy to find the needed supplies, smuggle these back to the ship, trade your finds with fellow animals, complete the necessary lab experiments, hurriedly competing to reach your goals before anyone else in the fluffy crew. And do it quickly, because the comet is heating up as it gets closer to the sun, increasingly releasing gas into space until it becomes impossible to operate on the surface. You have 5 weeks, make the best of it. May the fluff be with you!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Queue, Programmed Movement, Set Collection, Trading, Variable Player Powers

name: Hilferuf einer Elfe
description:
A crime with fatal consequences overtakes the magic world. Luckily, the elf of the main suspects turns to the order, which passes her concerns on to you.
Can you solve the mystery of the dark witches and wizards?

name: Trailblazer: The John Muir Trail – Hiking Card Pack
description: 14 Trail Cards with a different mechanism than all other Trail Cards.
categories: Adventure, American West, Animals, Educational, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Travel
mechanics: End Game Bonuses, Hand Management, Point to Point Movement, Set Collection, Variable Set-up, Worker Placement

name: 16 Candies
description:
16 Candies is a fast-paced and sweet family game for 3-4 players. In each round, players draw and discard cards featuring different types of candy, trying to form the best hand they can with their 3 cards.

When a player thinks they have the best hand, they can shout "I GOT CANDY!" Opposing players will have 1 final turn to optimize their hand before the round ends, at which point all players will reveal their hands. The player with the worst hand must remove a penalty amount of candy from their starting supply of 16 cardboard candies (or real candy, if you choose to play with it).

The game ends when only one player has candy left in their supply, and that player is the winner. With quick turns and a fun theme, 16 Candies is a tasty treat for game nights with family and friends.

-description from designer

name: Corps of Discovery: A Game Set in the World of Manifest Destiny
description:
Lewis and Clark are tasked not only with exploring America, but with ridding the land of numerous invasive monsters that have appeared.

Corps of Discovery: A Game Set in the World of Manifest Destiny is a co-operative deduction game in which players each take the role of one of the crew on the expedition and set out to explore the land. The game board allows for different maps to be inserted into it, so you have many adventures ahead of you.

In addition to finding and killing monsters, you must also complete numerous daily challenges that require specific resources that you can find on the board. You have to use logic and deduction to reason out where the resources you need are located. Ally yourselves with Sacajawea and the indigenous people of the area to help you on your quest.

The game comes with two chapters: Fauna and Flora. Each has new mechanisms, a different goal, and new components to give each chapter a different feel.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Area Movement, Cooperative Game, Deduction, Multiple Maps, Pattern Recognition, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Ravnica: Clue Edition
description:
Wizards of the Coast joined with Cluedo to celebrate their 75th anniversary. Reimagined versions of the infamous cast are incorporated in a brand new "Whodunnit"-experience, combining the evidence-gathering sleuth gameplay of Cluedo with Magic: The Gathering's strategic depth and the Ravnica setting.

This is not a reskin of the boardgame, but it is a new way of playing Magic designed by R&D that weaves the core concept of Clue with the playing of Magic.
mechanics: Deduction, Hand Management, Income, Induction, Interrupts, Player Elimination

name: UMATAKA
description:
UMATAKA is a board game themed around the Jomon period in Niigata Prefecture, Japan, a region known for its distinctive "flame pottery" artifacts. Players take on the roles of family leaders among the Jomon people, competing through the four seasons—spring, summer, autumn, and winter—to earn points by crafting pottery, hunting, and cooking nuts. The region's historical trade value of jade also plays a crucial role, as players must also gather this precious material.

UMATAKA utilizes a worker placement system where players use human and dog pieces as workers, placing between one and four workers in designated spaces. Dogs, which are relatively easier to acquire during the game, must work alongside humans due to several restrictions. After placing workers and taking actions, the number of workers influences the advancement of a piece on the "Exploration Track." The action located at the space where this explorer piece stops is also executed. This mechanism forces players to think strategically about the number of workers they deploy, and sometimes strategically placing extra workers can provide an advantage in the game.
mechanics: Contracts, Hidden Victory Points, Set Collection, Tech Trees / Tech Tracks, Turn Order: Claim Action, Variable Set-up, Worker Placement, Worker Placement, Different Worker Types

name: Dungeons & Dragons: Attack Wing – Drow Elf Ranger Drizzt Expansion Pack
description: Dungeons & Dragons: Attack Wing – Drow Elf Ranger Drizzt Expansion Pack includes one pre-painted miniature and numerous upgrade cards and tokens, and includes Campaign Adventure #7.1: Close Quarters.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Quest for the Open Tavern
description: In Quest for the Open Tavern players engage in a competitive blind bid character placement game that embraces DIRECT player interaction. This ain’t your dad’s Euro! One player takes the role of the “Wayfarers of Devastation” — a party of Adventurers that recently slew a Great Red Wyrm (or so they claim) and want to celebrate with random acts of drunkenness and senseless vandalism. But they’ve come to the wrong town! The other player takes the role of Governor Xaggy of Hommlette — he's heard about this band of ne’er-do-wells and he’s ready for them — he will stop at nothing to keep the town safe. Complicating the issue is the land is under siege from Zombies, Demons, Drunken Wizards, and a well organized Thieves’ Guild, any of which can force the Wayfarers and Governor Xaggy to become uneasy allies.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Betting and Bluffing, Worker Placement

name: Henchmania: Sanctuary
description: Sbires: Le Sanctuaire is an expansion for the Sbires base game that consists of 26 new cards for nine new effects that might assist you in becoming the next Senechal of Montfleury! Will you meet the Sauvageonne to lose points of prestige to your opponents? Will you use the Bourrel to discard cards to your opponents?
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Medieval
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Events, Worker Placement

name: Cascadia: Rolling Hills
description:
Cascadia: Rolling is a series of puzzly flip-and-roll-and-write games featuring the habitats and wildlife of the Pacific Northwest! Simultaneously roll dice, collect wildlife, and complete habitat cards to fill in different environments in Cascadia. Use special actions to manipulate your dice, and dynamic completion cards to unlock powerful combos!

There are two versions of Cascadia: Rolling. Each version features the following unique content - get both versions to play 1-8 players on 8 different maps!:

A unique Central Special Die that changes the way each round plays out.

4 unique Environment Sheets, based on a different region of Cascadia, each with its own special gameplay elements.

30 Unique Habitat Cards with breathtaking art by Beth Sobel.

8 Unique Advanced Completion cards for unique ways to combo discounts and bonuses each round!

A unique mini-expansion that introduces completely new gameplay elements like end game scoring bonuses and competitive objectives to ramp up the competition!

Roll your dice, collect wildlife and Nature Tokens, complete Habitat Cards, and fill in the puzzle on your personal Environment Sheet to create the most harmonious ecosystem in Cascadia! Although the core rules are simple, each unique Environment Sheet has its own twist so no two games of Cascadia: Rolling will play out the same!

Cascadia: Rolling Hills features unique content specific to the prairie environments of Cascadia!

—description from the publisher
categories: Abstract Strategy, American West, Animals, Dice, Environmental, Puzzle, Territory Building
mechanics: Contracts, Dice Rolling, End Game Bonuses, Hexagon Grid, Line Drawing, Market, Multiple Maps, Paper-and-Pencil, Set Collection, Solo / Solitaire Game, Variable Set-up
publishers: Alderac Entertainment Group, Flatout Games, Lucky Duck Games, White Goblin Games

name: Oceans: 5-6 Player Expansion
description:
Want more people to play in the Oceans with you? This expansion allows up to 6 to play.

Includes:
40 fish tokens
10 species boards
2 bonus tokens
2 player screens

Please Note:
If you have the Limited Edition of Oceans, you already have this.

—description from the publisher
categories: Animals, Card Game, Educational, Environmental, Expansion for Base-game, Prehistoric
mechanics: Hand Management, Hidden Victory Points, Open Drafting, Take That, Victory Points as a Resource

name: Spookies extension 2: Spooky Ghost
description:
During game setup, the Spooky Ghost is placed in the room next to “>= 9.”

During gameplay, if the Spooky Ghost is on the same storey as any other playing piece, the Ghost “steals” one die from the active player. This means the player has a maximum of only three dice for that throw of their turn. After that throw is resolved, the player must move the Spooky Ghost one storey up or down.

This extension was on the back of the catalogue of family Games from Haba.

name: Barbaria: Race to Valhalla
description:
Nov 2016: On this page, you find a Print and Play prototype version of my barbarian card game. I recently found a publisher, signed a license agreement, the game will be published at some point in 2017. There'll be changes in artworks, rules and layout, so you're not looking at the "final version" here.

From the designer:

Grab some friends and compete on an epic quest for glory.
With 108 cards and 6 dice, Barbaria fits in every pocket and provides a wonderful beer and pretzel experience.

It is my take on the dungeon crawler genre: I stripped off all complicated and redundant components, like game boards, miniatures, long rulebooks, hundreds of markers.
It is designed to be a quick, easy and fun game, while still mainstaining the core: you control a hero, get stronger, fight monsters and find treasure, and you roll a lot of dice.

All 100+ illustrations are hand drawn and colored in aquarel.
I'd appreciate feedback! :)
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Dice, Fantasy, Print & Play
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck

name: Unfold Kids: Lollipop Inc.
description:
Alex and Alice, kids with superpowers, notice that their friends have become unbearable and are acting oddly. And that’s right after the superpopular amusement park “Lollipop Inc.” opened in their city. So, when their secret agent parents are given the task to infiltrate the park, the kids are certain to catch the opportunity of conducting their own investigation…

Lollipop Inc. is an exciting tabletop quest created especially for kids. Open new locations and complete the mission by solving original puzzles, sometimes by completely unconventional means. Find the villain and uncover his evil plans in this standalone Unfold Kids game.

—description from the publisher
publishers: Lifestyle Boardgames Ltd, Red Cat Games

name: Phoenix: Dawn Command
description:
The Dread began three years ago with the rise of the bone legions in the south. Since then it has spread across the known world, a waking nightmare that takes hundreds of horrible forms. Ghosts howl in the night. Skinchangers lurk in the wilds. Fallen soldiers rise to slaughter the living. Entire cities fall to a Chant that turns all who hear it into mindless killers. We don’t know why this is happening. We don’t know how to stop it. All that we know with certainty is that we are fighting a war and we are losing. Over a third of the Empire has been lost to the Dread, and each day brings new horrors. In this dark time we have one hope: Phoenixes are returning. Every citizen knows tales of the Phoenixes, champions who can face death and return stronger than before. In the centuries following our brutal civil war the Phoenixes have become legends… and now you are one of them.

Phoenix: Dawn Command is a card-based roleplaying game with a unique approach to character death. In Phoenix, players assume the role of supernaturally empowered champions bound together to defend a fantasy world under attack by threats that no mortal could withstand. These heroes face harsh odds every mission, and many won’t survive. But death isn’t the end of your character’s story; it’s the start of the next chapter.
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Role Playing

name: Exodus: The Trading Card Game
description:
The Exodus TCG is an extremely fast-paced card game, designed to play in an average of 5-10 minutes suitable for all ages and skill levels. It's the first trading card game in the world to feature mechanics that affect card rarity! There's no banlist, no rotation, and no reprints from set-to-set. Expansions offer new and interesting mechanics and themes without relying on power-creep.

A mass Exodus to the newborn planet Eeventide is occurring. As you venture from Earth to Eeventide, you become a Drifter, gaining the ability to fly and drift across a new world. Forge a special deck of cards from stardust, and battle other Drifters by summoning massive creatures to fight for you! Your very existence is bound to the planet by a mysterious contraption that glows with an ethereal light. You can join a faction or fight solo as you pave a path.

The first three guilds have risen, Dragonis, Skyborn & the Order, each fighting over a planet that requires constant conflict in order to remain stable.


Players begin the game with 10 Life Points, which represent their will to battle. Each player takes turns playing by following the 5 Phases of a Turn:

Draw Phase: Draw 3 cards from your Energy Deck and 3 cards from your Main Deck
Energy Phase: Play your energy onto the field by stacking them into piles in any arrangement you'd like (maximum 3-energy per pile by default)
Creature Phase: Summon as many creatures from your hand as you'd like by placing them on blank piles of energy
Attack Phase: Attack your opponent's creatures using your own, or attack their Life Points directly if they have no creatures
End Phase: Pass the turn to your opponent



Players win the game by using their creatures to attack their opponent's Life Points directly. Each energy behind a creature counts as 1 point of damage in a direct attack. Players can attack with as many creatures as they want during their turn, and use instant-speed Symmetry cards to make their creatures stronger or to drastically change circumstances during a duel. Symmetry cards are like quick-play instants that can be played literally at any time to interrupt gameplay (they can be used on your turn or your opponent's turn, on any phase)!

Energy cards are universal in function, so players can use any combination of cards. Decks can be constructed by following the one simple rule of limiting 2 copies of a card per deck (excluding energy).


(Set 1) Birth of Creation Harmonized Dragonis & Skyborn Starter Decks (Unlimited Edition) are now available, Premiere Edition is sold out,
(Set 2) Galaxy Tides (First Edition) Boosters are now available,
(Set 3) Crystal Forge Treeforge & Shardveil Competitive Decks (First Edition) are now available, released August 2017,
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Open Drafting

name: The Lakes Card Game
description:
In this two player game of strategy collect Lake District landmarks & locations to score victory points. Use Backpack cards to stop opponents and help you win. Complete secret Lake District missions to help boost your score.

Who will climb the mountain victorious and who will take a hike?

A must play game for any lover of the Lake District.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Contracts, Interrupts, Set Collection, Take That

name: Die Abenteuer des Robin Hood: Die Tochter des Ketzers
description:
In this stand alone adventure, Adventurers help Marian search for her father, who has gone into hiding after being found guilty of heresy.

With this adventure booklet you can experience another exciting adventure of Robin Hood and his companions. It plays around the same time as Chapter 4, so you should have played at least until Chapter 4 of the base game. All outlaws already have their special skills.

This item was originally made available as a PDF, and later printed as part of Die Abenteuer des Robin Hood - Die Abenteuer Erweiterung.

name: Ordeal of the Magic Tower: An Adventure for Four Against Darkness
description:
Four young wizards-in-training. One impossibly difficult task: move through the six ever-changing levels of the Magic Tower in Sphilix’s Sorcery School, master your cantrips, and craft your magic wand! Will you become a full fledged mage, or succumb to the dangers that the Archmages have in store for you? There is only one way to know… accept the challenge, and survive the Ordeal of the Magic Tower! This is a procedural adventure for apprentices. It contains rules for 12 Cantrips (zero level spells).

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Book, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Print & Play

name: The Big Score: Crack the Safe
description:
Crack the Safe, an expansion for The Big Score, adds 2 new Job cards and 20 Safe cards. Players that successfully rob these new locations get to draw from the Safe deck to see what reward awaits inside the safe!

This expansion also includes an upgrade pack with 2 new Bosses and matching Assignment Tiles as well as clay poker chips to replace the cardboard Jack of All Trades tokens that come with the base game.

name: Form Line of Battle
description:
Form Line of Battle
A Naval Entertainment

A set of simple instructions for fleet engagements in the age of sail.

From the Introduction section (page 2)"This game contains a number of novel mechanisms designed to capture the flavor of naval conflict in the great age of sail. We freely admit that they contain a touch or two of "Hollywood," but they should give you plenty of excitement, some doubts, uncertainties, stress and confusion. Record keeping is minimal and a fairly large fleet action can be fought in two or three hours."

Players are advised to furnish the following:
A handful of six-sided dice, some 'broadside fired' markers made of white cotton and some 'on fire' markers made of colored cotton. Three red and three black cards from an ordinary pack of playing cards. Finally, two fleets of 1/1200 or 1/3000 scale model ships.

The 16 page rule book contains the following sections:
1) Introduction
2) The Playing Area (on a table top)
3) The Sequence of Play (control, moving and firing randomized by draw of the six cards for either the 'red' or 'black' player.
4) Wind Direction
5) Sailing Attitudes
6) Movement (1 to 5 D6 based on attitude to wind and class of ship)
- Turning
- Tacking
- Anchoring
- Shoals and Shallow Water
- Re-floating after Running Aground
- Falling Masts
- Cutting Free a Fallen Mast
- Collisions
- Grappling
- Cutting Grapples
- Captured Vessels
- Boarding
7) Firing
- Broadside Firing Results Table (rolling 2 D6)
- Fire (i.e. ship catches fire)
- Damaged Steering
- Command and Control
8) Wind Direction Spinner
9) Point of Sailing Indicator (player aid)
10) Broadside Indicator (arch of fire player aid)
11) Fallen Mast Indicator (player aid)

name: Autoduel America
description:
From the package:

"Looking for adventure? Trouble? A route across the bandit-ravaged countryside of America, 2039? Or just a safe truck stop?

Autoduel America puts the world of 2039 right at your fingertips. Two beautiful 23" x 35" full-color maps detail the North American continent, including road conditions for the major interstate, U.S., and state highways; nuclear zones; truck stops; cities; fortress towns; ruins; military bases; national forests and parks; state and national capitals; no dueling zones and lawless areas. Use them as posters or as game aids for Car Wars or GURPS Autoduel campaigns."

name: Hexen Hexen
description: 16 magic objects are arranged visible on the board. 16 corresponding cards are mixed and build a hidden deck. Now card for card is laid open and the players try to reach the corresponding card as first. Therefore he gets the card. At the end, the player with the most cards has won.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Pattern Recognition, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Second World War at Sea: Orange Waters
description:
This is an expansion for the SWWAS series that adds 15 scenarios using the hypothetical Dutch Fleet from Spice Islands in the North Atlantic and North Sea.

From the APL website... "In the 17th century, Dutch leaders put their faith in their powerful navy and skilled admirals, winning repeated victories as their spread their commercial empire around the world. But by the 1930s, the Netherlands trusted the League of Nations to defend world peace, and did not begin to rebuild their fleet until it was much too late. Spice Islands presented the fleet the Dutch admirals hoped to build, adding it to the Second World War at Sea series with scenarios taking place in the East Indies.

Orange Waters is a supplement for the Second World War at Sea series, with 15 scenarios looking at how this fleet might have been used in the waters of the North Atlantic. This module is not playable by itself, but requires use of the Bismarck boxed game and Spice Islands supplement. No other games or supplements are needed to enjoy all 15 scenarios."
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Nautical, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Hexagon Grid, Paper-and-Pencil, Secret Unit Deployment, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Quick Quest
description:
Quick Quest distills dungeon delving into its basic elements: killing monsters and looting treasure. Level up you heroes, equip your items, and venture deeper into the dungeon. Can your party survive to level 10? If they do there's a nasty boss and evil minions waiting there for you.

Designed for solo play but easily adapted to multiplayer, Quick Quest is a fast-paced fantasy card and dice game that only takes about 30 minutes to play.

You might not always have time enough for an RPG but there's always time for a Quick Quest.

Includes:
Hero Cards Deck (8 cards)
Treasure Deck (43 cards)
Quest Treasure Deck (17 cards)
Monster Deck (68 cards)
Quick Quest Rules Document
1 D12 (17mm) - Random Color
2 D6 (16mm) - Black
2 D6 (16mm) - Blue
2 D6 (16mm) - Red
3 D6 (16mm) - White
2 D6 (16mm) - Yellow
25 Poker Chips (22mm) - Red
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Deathfear
description:
Deathfear is a board game in which each player takes the role of an adventurer trapped in a demon's tomb. The object of the game is to collect the parts of that demon and use them to eliminate the other players.

Movement is determined by dice rolling, and combat takes place by simply landing on a square occupied by an opponent.

The demon parts are represented by cards placed in four locations within the tomb. Each card grants unique abilities such as ranged attacks or teleportation. After six or more of these cards have been collected, the player may opt to transform into the demon for a limited time. If that player eliminates all of their opponents within that time, they win the game... if not, they die.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Roll / Spin and Move, Variable Player Powers

name: Inconfidentes
description:
In the year of 1787, Brazil was still a colony of Portugal.

The Portuguese empire imposed high taxes (called "Derrama") upon the wealthy ones, trying to get as much gold as possible. Under pressure, influential Brazilians gather to organize a liberty movement by writing articles, poems and manifests, spreading freedom ideas taken from USA's recent act of independence and from the French Revolution.

A group of conspirators, called Inconfidentes, gathered on the state of Minas Gerais, a place that concentrated a lot of gold and valuable gems.

There are six characters on the game, five of them are Inconfidentes: the poet, the farmer, the bachelor, the soldier and the priest, each of them with a unique power. The last one is an imperial guard.

On each round, players choose and move the Inconfidentes, however more than one play may select the same character. Whenever this happens, they must blind bid to decide who will be the leader of that character.

Players vie to spread the ideas through publishing texts (tiles) and hide them around the city, Ouro Preto, formerly named as Vila Rica, and get the population's approval, supporting the struggle to make Minas Gerais free from Portugal. These conspirators also made part of Freemasonry's secret association, and they try to build the first Freemasonry's secret house to support their fight.

When they publish their own texts and get the texts from the others, players make "inconfidência" points (victory points). Furthermore, a character may become a Freemason. If a player manages to get to the 33rd. degree of Freemasonry (all five characters become Freemasons), he becomes a Master Freemason. This gives an alternative ending to the game by finishing the game earlier, and changes Brazilian history! setting Minas Gerais free from Portugal.

If no one gets to be a Master Freemason until 1789, the year of the ninth and last round, everyone goes to jail.
The player with more points (tiles) from texts published by other players, gold retrieved and Freemasonry degrees is the "inconfidência" martyr and the winner.

Not to forget that the historic martyr, Tiradentes, became widely famous afterwords, although was unfortunately killed, hanged for treason by Portugal.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Modular Board, Open Drafting, Set Collection, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Race to Tokyo
description:
Issue game in Command Magazine Japan #102

Covering the planned landing in Kanto area, Japan (Operation Coronet) at the end of WW2.
Using the same system as Battle for Germany by SPI.

One player controls the U.S. 1st army landing along Kujuukuri-beach and the Japanese western force.
The other player leads the U.S. 8th army landing along Sagami-bay and the Japanese eastern force.
Each player gains victory points by conquering towns and cities.
Each hex represents 6km.
The game ends at the end of 8th turn. And each turn is 1 week.
publishers: Kokusai-Tsushin Co., Ltd. (国際通信社), War Drum Games

name: Quest: Zeit der Helden – Abenteuerband 2
description:
Were your heroes able to fight off the attack of the orcs and even halt the machinations of the dark cult? Then this adventure book you brings you a brand new challenge: the adventure of hunting dragons. (This is the demo adventure of Essen 2011 called Drachenjagd.)

This is an expansion of Quest: Angriff der Orks and Quest: Der dunkle Kult, not a basic game. To play this adventure, you will need both of these games.
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Storytelling, Variable Player Powers

name: Tide of Iron Promo Cards
description:
According to publisher 1A Games, promotional cards for Tide of Iron are meant to "add some spice to existing scenarios without twisting the game beyond recognition". With that goal in mind, each promotional card is "an Operations card that adds a small advantage or additional goal for both sides".

Supply Depot, for example, gives each player two command before the game starts, which therefore allows them to use Strategy cards during the first Action Phase of the game.

Patched Up gives each player a chance to acquire a new squad of infantry with the Unarmed restriction token. Restrictions – introduced in the Tide of Iron: Stalingrad expansion – place a limitation on a squad until the owner takes an action to remove it. In this case, the squad can't perform any kind of fire action until it's able to take weapons from an empty squad base.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II

name: Dicey Curves: Deluxe Edition
description:
Dicey Curves Deluxe Edition, available from TheGameCrafter.com, includes the base game (with new track cards) plus the DANGER! Expansion (with new on-track obstacle bits).

From the back of the box:
Dicey Curves is a party-style car racing game that is fun for the whole family! The track is built during the game from a deck of track cards, giving a different race every time. Roll dice and form combos to move your cars down the track, and use control chips to make adjustments when the dice aren't cooperating. Start your engines and get ready to roll!

Includes DANGER! Expansion. The DANGER! Expansion amps up the party game into a dash of take-that, dangers and damage.

name: Athletics
description:
Athletics is a simulation game of athletics (track & field)

The players pick up a country and start play all the events an athletics meeting or games has (100 meters, 200 meters, High Jump, Triple Jump, Shot Put etc). The players are collecting medals (gold, silver, bronze) and the player with the most medals wins. Also the game have records for all the events which are close to reality. All the events are played with dice.

name: Fire Emblem 0 (Cipher)
description:
ファイアエムブレム０（サイファー） ("Fire Emblem 0 (Cipher)") is a collectible card game based on the Fire Emblem video games. Currently, it is being released in Japan.

Both players choose one main character at the start of the game. All the cards in the game are character cards. Each character has a base attack strenght, as well as support strength (in addition to certain other powers and abilities). Each player has five 'orbs' ('life' represented by cards'), which the other player tries to get down to zero by attacking the main character.

There's five phases in a game.
1) Starting Phase
Untapping tapped characters, and drawing 1 card.
2) The Bond Phase
Playing 1 card into the ´bond´ area. Each card has a value (top left). The value of cards in the 'bond' area determines the value of the characters you can put into play.
3) The Sortie Phase
Play characters, or level up certain characters. The characters you can play depends on their card value and the value of cards in your ´bond´ area.
4) The Action Phase
Move your characters into the opponent's area; attack your opponent's characters; or use a skll.
5) The Final Phase
Skills that say 'during this turn' end, and the turn goes to the opposing player.

The goal of the game is to defeat your opponent's main character by destroying his 'orbs.'

name: Table Air Combat: B-17F Flying Fortress
description:
Table Air Combat is a fast, simple air combat game that can be played on any flat surface.
Each player has a flight of fighters, represented by two-sided counters. Aircraft counters move by means of curved “performance rulers” that represent the aircraft’s historical cornering ability and maximum speed.
Each performance ruler is unique to each aircraft, and contains all the speed, cornering, and weapon information needed.
TAC is designed for portability. The entire game can fit in a plastic bag. Even the largest battles can take place on a fast-food restaurant table.

This set contains the B-17F, the four-engined bomber that was the backbone of the industrial war against Germany.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Print & Play, World War II

name: Blood Bowl (2016 Edition): Glart Smashrip – Star Player
description:
Description from the publisher:

An impressively obese Smashrip attends the tryouts for the Warpfire Wanderers, but is laughed out of the line-up. His chances aren’t improved when he eats the team’s assistant coach to prove a point, but news travels fast, and it isn’t long before the Skavenblight Scramblers scout him out and offer him a place on their roster. Eventually, after some unpleasantness including a lifetime ban for eating a referee (which was eventually overturned) he became a free agent, bombarded with offers...

Field the gloriously portly Glart Smashrip as a Star Player in your Skaven or Underworld Denizens Blood Bowl teams by picking up this resin kit. The first thing you’ll notice about Glart is his size – there’s no hiding that this is a Skaven of impressive girth, who barely fits into the ramshackle armour that has been attached to his bulk with creaking straps. He isn’t bothering with head protection as there aren’t any helmets that would fit and, honestly, they just get in the way of eating stuff. Luckily, someone has found a swathe of cloth large enough to hide most of his unmentionables, and he features the usual spiky bits on his shoulders and knee pads.

The resin kit comes as 8 components with a 32mm round Blood Bowl base.

name: Battleground Fantasy Warfare: Monsters & Mercenaries – Ancient Blue Dragon
description:
Originally offered through Dice Tower's Season 13 Indiegogo campaign

Not playable on their own as you need two starter decks to play the game.

Battleground Fantasy Warfare is a point-based tabletop tactical wargame in which units are represented by cards.

Ancient Blue Dragon - 868 points - Elite
Colossal. Terrifying
Flying: 10.5"

Ancient Blue Dragon may breathe lightning three times during a battle. Mark off a lightning icon to give it a ranged attack of (3) 7/7 this turn. This attack is unaffected by Command Cards from either player and nothing can affect the number of attack dice (3) in this attack

To play a Command Card on Ancient Blue Dragon you must first discard two other Command Cards
categories: Card Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Wargame

name: Pixel Glory: Light & Shadow – Heroic Dungeon
description:
An co-op expansion for Pixel Glory: Light and Shadow that pits you against every monster from the base game and Light and Shadow in 2 stages. Some monsters have the keyword "Loot" which gives you an item to help you and your friends survive.

Comes with:
51 foiled monster cards
5 foiled loot cards
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Humor
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Open Drafting, Take That

name: The Red Dragon Inn 7: The Tavern Crew Collector's Edition
description:
The Collector’s Edition includes content not found in the standard Kickstarter edition:


8 Promo Drinks Cards (includes 2 new Kickstarter Promos that will be in all backer rewards. The Collector’s Edition will also include 2 new Promo Drinks that will be released later on in 2019 or thereafter for other promotions plus an additional 4 reprints that were never offered on Kickstarter before):


- Ettinbrau
- The Good Stuff! (*)
- Half-Ogre Brew (+)
- Iron Guts Lager
- Ozrik’s Powerale (+)
- Purified Potent Pixie Power Punch
- Wizgille’s Phenomenale
- Ye Olde Drink ’n’ Dice (*)


4 Bonus Red Dragon Inn Drink Coasters
Enamel Inlay Dragon’s Breath Ale Turn Marker
Collector’s Edition Box (or not, if the Eco-Collector’s Edition)


(*) Also in the Kickstarter Edition.
(+) Previously released.
categories: Card Game, Fantasy, Humor, Party Game
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Hand Management, Player Elimination, Variable Player Powers

name: Grifters: Informants and Specialist Promo Cards
description:
Included originally with KS copies of Grifters, these promos have been made available separately by Indie.

4 copies of the Informant card are included:

Informants are a new ringleader (every player starts with one of each of the ringleaders) that add an element of bluff and deception to the game.

With Informants in play, you can play any card face down and take the Informant action. Any other player may challenge the Informant. When challenged, the active player reveals the card that was played. If that card is the Informant, the challenger must give the active player 2M ISK. If that card is not the Informant, no payments are due from any player to the active player, the challenger steals 2M ISK from the active player and gets to take the action on the card that was played.

Also, the following Specialists are included:
3 x The Security Specialist promo
3 x Crooked Warden promo
3 x Veteran promo
3 x Underboss promo
3 x Negotiator promo
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Mafia
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Set Collection, Take That

name: Magic: The Gathering – War of the Spark
description: War of the Spark is the 81st Magic expansion. It was released on May 3, 2019.Officially, it is not part of a block. However, it is part of a series of three consecutive sets on the same world, unofficially referred to as the Guilds of Ravnica block.It covers the event of the same name.
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Fantasy, Fighting

name: Dixit: Chilean Way
description: Set of ten promo cards released for the 10th anniversary of Dixit, showing Chilean motifs.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Party Game

name: Blade Rondo: Grim Garden
description:
This work is a stand-alone expansion set for the "Blade Rondo" battle card game for 1 to 2 people who build and fight with only 7 cards.

One set contains all the cards for Grim Garden to play with two people.

New elements in Grim Garden are “gold coins” and “devils.”

Attack, voltage, and defence are your main stats and have significant impact on your action economy, strength, and life.

In solo mode, a set of idea cards becomes your opponent and there are new, powerful adversaries to face.

name: Rights a.k.a. Startups
description:
The cancelled Spring Game Market 2020, was going to be the 10th Game Market that Oink Games had an exhibit at. So the founder, Mr. Sasaki, was thinking to have a booth by himself, just like the first exhibit, separate from Oink Games and to make and sell games that would be difficult for Oink Games itself to handle. One of those games is Rights a.k.a. Startups.

This game is Startups made by touching up Rights. Made by Mr. Sasaki as a hobby for events, we took "Startups" and gave it the look and feel of "Rights". But since the rules for both "Startups" and "Rights" are included, we think it is a nice package for people that like both games.

No rules changes, there are 2 separate instruction manuals, one for each game. Both utilize the same components with only slight variation between them.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Commodity Speculation, Open Drafting, Set Collection

name: Sblocca La Porta Deluxe
description:
You are locked in a room and you must work together to find the way out, solving puzzles of logic, observation and mathematics. Use the objects you find in the room, observe the smallest details and do not be rushed: if you correctly solve all puzzles, you will leave the room!

The box includes 4 adventures: The Mistery of Orient Express,
The Treasure Island, The villa of Mr. Gold and the haunted house.

name: Frogmouth Fan Pack (fan expansion for Wingspan)
description: A mini expansion created by a fan focused on different species of frogmouth. The expansion includes 14 new birds and 1 new bonus card. As a curiosity all cards have a black background.
categories: Animals, Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Set Collection

name: Marvel: Crisis Protocol – Captain America & War Machine
description:
After the super-soldier serum wore off, Steve Rogers was restored to his natural age. Unable to battle any longer, he retired from the role of Captain America. Rogers chose Sam Wilson, one of his closest and most trusted allies, to take up the shield in his place. Wilson had already proved his commitment to protecting justice as the Avenger Falcon and continues to protect the vulnerable as Captain America.

Lieutenant Colonel James “Rhodey” Rhodes is War Machine, an armored Avenger and walking arsenal. As Tony Stark’s personal pilot and closest friend, Rhodes wears the Variable Threat Response Battle Suit, a suit of armor equipped with a variety of armaments including shoulder-mounted cannons, missile launchers, particle beams, repulsors, and more. War Machine combines his many years of experience as a Marine pilot with Tony Stark’s cutting-edge designs as an Avenger and symbol of mechanized might.

—description from the publisher
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Movement Template, Variable Player Powers

name: Sentinels of the Multiverse: Dr. Medico, Malpractice Promo Card
description:
A promo card for the game Sentinels of the of the Multiverse.

HP: 27

Power - Red Right Hand: Until the end of your next turn, whenever a Hero Target would regain HP, Dr. Medico instead deals 1 Target that amount of Energy Damage instead.
categories: Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: MIRU: An Analog Adventure Game
description: MIRU is a solo-first hexcrawling adventure game. Set in a solarpunk future, a century from now, you play a character whose brother is killed by a robot. The next day, you pack your bag with a few supplies and foolishly head off into the uncharted wilderness to go kill the God responsible.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Narrative Choice / Paragraph, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Kao the Kangaroo
description:
Kao the Kangaroo is an adventure board game for the whole family. Take on the role of the jumping Kao the Kangaroo and traverse abstract worlds familiar to fans of the video game.

Build the board by adding new tiles and move your Kangaroo collecting precious coins, treasures and cards. Jump on them and collect valuable coins, treasures in chests and cards. The player who collected most coins and oponent cards will be the winner.

Be careful! Opponents can cross your plans, so be sure bravely and cleverly overcome any diversity. You can use Challenge Cards to slow down other players and jump after jump get closer to victory!

A modular game board consisting of 37 tiles from places known from the video game!
Dynamic gameplay that shows you to take action during another player’s turn!
The simple mechanics of the platform game will provide hours of entertainment for the whole family!

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Children's Game, Exploration, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Area Movement, Map Addition, Modular Board, Tile Placement

name: Extraliga All-Stars 1993-2023: Karetní hra
description:
The card game Extraliga All-Stars 1993-2023 is for all hockey fans! It features players from all the teams of the Extraliga and other teams that have won the title in the last 30 years! From these you have to properly draft a team with which you then go to battle against opponents. The matches themselves are influenced by events and dice rolls. Can you lead your team to the coveted league title? On the player cards you will find many legends of Czech hockey since the creation of the independent league, the game is licensed by Legendary Cards. Czech authors Michal Ekrt and Petr Bělík are behind the game.

The Czech Ice Hockey Extraliga celebrated its thirtieth anniversary in the 2022/2023 season. During that time, we could watch hundreds of players. Some have fallen into oblivion, others have donned the national jersey or made their name in the NHL. The exceptional ones have become club legends.

The Extraliga All-Stars card game allows you to build your own dream team and play matches against both live opponents and "virtual" opponents. The game features all the teams from the 2022/2023 season and, as a bonus, teams that have won the Extraliga title in its 30-year history. Each team is represented by six hockey players from the entire independent extraliga history, who were selected in cooperation with the individual hockey clubs. The game also features the greatest personalities of Czechoslovak hockey in the form of legend cards without club affiliation. It's up to you to decide what your team will look like and whether you can lead it to the title.
mechanics: Closed Drafting, Dice Rolling, Open Drafting
publishers: ADC Blackfire Entertainment, GameRock Studio s.r.o.

name: Despistados en la granja
description:
The farm animals love to share their things with others, but since they are always in the clouds, they never remember where or who they left them with. Fortunately, they have Enola's sense of smell and she is always willing to lend a helping paw.

Despistados is a game of observation and visual speed in which you will have to keep track of the lost object through the memories cards and quickly vote for which animal you think the object has on the last card to be the person with the most clouds at the end of the game.

—description from the publisher

name: Counter Spy
description:
In CounterSpy, you will have 15 cards.

Randomly choose 1 face down to become the Spy (hidden card)
Reveal 1 card (sharing information)

Then deal 7 cards to the 1st player, and 6 cards to the 2nd player.

On your turn, you decide to
(a) Exchange information or
(b) Reveal the spy

To exchange information: choose a card from your hand to give to the opponent then provide information that relates to the given card

The given information can be in 1 of 3 formats below

The given card belongs to a pair/trio/quartet of the same color
The given card belongs to a pair/trio/quartet of the same number
The given card belongs to a 3/4/5/6/7 in a row


The information must be True and Sufficient (meaning it is the full information)
The information includes every card in the player's hand and in front of them (which are given by the opponent)

On your turn, if you cannot or don't want to exchange information you must Guess the Spy card by stating its number and color.

if you guess correctly, you receive 2 points. If incorrectly, the opponent receives 1 point.

Whoever has 3 points first wins the game.
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Deduction, Spies/Secret Agents

name: OrganATTACK!: TEAMS Expansion Pack
description:
Organ harvesting just got more intense! With OrganATTACK TEAMS Expansion Pack, you form a team with another player and take on other teams, to ultimately, take them out. This expansion pack lets you Concur with your partner to launch a coordinated attack, administer CPR to bring a flatlined partner back into play, or Quarantine the other team to take them out of play. Assemble your Team and take on your opposers. The team with one organ "standing" is the winner.

The TEAMS Expansion Pack comes with 27 new team play cards and 1 team play rules card. Must have the main OrganATTACK game to incorporate this pack

name: Chronopia: Land of Two Rivers
description:
Land of two rivers is the first Chronopia game supplement. It describes the return of the Stygian, an ancient race of serpent-men who ruled Chronopia millenias ago.

The 96 pages rulebook features:
- detailed description of the Stygian awakening, their society and how the other races try to deal with this new threat;
- Stygian army list;
- new units for all other races, most of them suited for desert fighting;
- some new rules and spells.

Expands:

Chronopia
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame

name: The Plot Thickens: Sci-Fi Edition
description:
The Plot Thickens is a storytelling game for quick-thinking, imaginative folks just like you and your friends. The object is to take your hand of story cards, (people, places and things) and lay out the tale of your character, and their fate! You’ll earn plot points for every card you use to build your story, and every time you interweave with other’s narratives.
The storyteller with the most points gets to craft the ending as main character, while the person who connected the most to their cards gets to name the epic as the Author. What will your story be?

In the Sci-Fi edition you'll explore strange place, meet weird aliens and blast your way through asteroids!

The different genres of The Plot Thickens can be combined to increase the player count and give you more story options.

name: Vengeance: Director's Cut Expansion
description:
As you dodge, roll and reverse-blade your way into the room where the boss is hiding you lock eyes with Donna Immacolata, your life-long nemesis and…

-“CUTTTTTT!!! No, this won’t work. This scene needs to be more snappy. Swap that scrawny grunt for a tougher guy. The hero needs to earn his final show-down!”

The Director’s Cut Expansion adds a layer of direct player interaction as players alternate in taking the role of a vengeance movie director.
