The mercenary card counts as a standard unit card in your army.
That’s it!


Each player may choose up to one mercenary unit to add to their army.

The downside of using mercenaries is that everyone knows they are there – that’s the price you pay for their added flexibility! The card backs say ‘Mercenary’ on them, so your opponent will always know if you hold a mercenary card in your hand or if it is the next card in the draw deck. However, they will not know which mercenary unit you have chosen until you use it for the first time.
categories: Ancient, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Wargame
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Secret Unit Deployment

name: iina
description:
iiná is a solitaire 18-card in-hand game that places the player in control of a Navajo tribe in the 1600’s, as they fight to survive and preserve their culture during the Spanish invasion of the North American continent.

This game was developed as an entry in the 2022 In Hand Game Design Contest and was placed as follows:











—description from the designer
categories: American Indian Wars, Card Game, Civilization, Print & Play
mechanics: Action/Event, Events, Solo / Solitaire Game, Variable Set-up

name: Rolling Freight: Texas Map
description: The Texas Map for the Rolling Freight game was made available as an exclusive item to people that pledged to support the Rolling Freight project on Kickstarter. This map was designed to be an apegames.com download, but was instead printed copies for each copy of the game that we ship for Kickstarter backers. It was printed on thick paper and quarter-fold it so that it fits nicely into the Rolling Freight box. This map is designed as a quick 2-3 player map which can be played in about an hour.
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Pick-up and Deliver, Simulation

name: Colonnade
description:
Colonnade is a column building game that uses just a standard deck of cards and 6 dice.

Players add cards to a 6 column Colonnade according to the dice they roll. You gain control of a column by placing more cards on it than your opponent.
And you can push your luck for better dice combos that will give a greater choice of ways to play your cards.

The player who controls the majority of columns at the end of the game wins.

The rules are on just one sheet of paper and include examples of play.

Colonnade was an entry in the 2017 Two-Player Print and Play Game Design Contest

name: Fisherman vs Diver
description:
"Fisherman vs Diver" is a Dice Draft mechanic game; each player represents a person who lives from the extraction of fish and seafood, where he tries to get more victory points than his opponents, to win the game.

Through the actions you will be able to draw fish or seafood, for this you will need to get resources like bait, oxygen, or energy and in order to fulfill “Purchase Orders” to get victory points.

The game consists on a number of rounds depending on the number of players. During each round, all players choose one die from the available ones and perform the corresponding or optional action. When all the players have played the same number of turns and there is one die left, the round is over.

In the last round, a final count of points is made and the winner of this fisherman vs. diver is revealed.

-description from publisher

name: Pocket Landship: No Man's Land
description:
Scott Czysz, the designer of Pocket Landship, has not been idle since the initial design of the game and has spent the last couple of years developing a 2 player competitive play version of the game. In this you are both tasked with beating the enemy Mech and the 'Big Bad' Enemy Base, but who will garner the most honour in the victory?

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Semi-Cooperative Game, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Colour MY Kritters
description:
Collect Kritters with splotches in three primary colours Cyan, Magenta and Yellow, and get hold of mixing bowls and paintbrushes to fill them with life. Use magic wands to change colours as needed to buy more Kritters, and add to your collection with bonus Kritters in secondary colours Red, Blue and Green.

Colour MY Kritters is a classic deck builder card game designed for younger players. You start with a few cards, and every round you have the chance to buy another card from the table. Cards have colour splotches (in three different primary colours, plus a wild card "colour"), and you use these to buy new cards. In the end you score the number of cards in each colour, but only for the colors you can supplement with a mixing bowl and/or a paintbrush. In addition comes bonus points on cards with Kritters in secondary colours.

—description from the publisher

Tabletopia: Play Colour MY Kritters for free on Tabletopia - you can try the game yourself and see how you like it :-) Find it there or on the official website (link below).

Print-and-play: A free PnP file can be downloaded from the official website (link below).

Kickstarter: A campaign for the printed edition of Colour MY Kritters was successfully funded on Kickstarter in December 2020 (link below). Late pledges will soon open so you can get your own copy even if you missed the Kickstarter.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Fantasy, Print & Play
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Delayed Purchase, Lose a Turn, Set Collection, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Rally Point Volume 6: Advanced Squad Leader Starter Kit Special Study II
description:
Rally Point Volume 6: Starter Kit Special Study II is an ASL/ASL Starter Kit Compatible scenario pack that uses the components of Starter Kits 1-3, Starter Kit Expansion Pack #1 and Starter Kit Bonus Pack #1. Each scenario is fully compatible with full ASL rules and ASL Starter Kit Rules. These 10 scenarios were playtested with consideration for both rules sets and are presented in the Schwerpunkt easy-to-read format on high-quality cardstock.

RPT51 Arrivederci Nembo: Delianuona, Italy, 7 September 1943: Elements of the Italian Nembo Parachute Division found Lieutenant Colonel Bogert’s lead platoons of the West Novas resting along the road. This determined group of paratroopers had refused to surrender with Italian coastal units and were attempting to join up with the retreating 29th Panzer Division. Heavy small arms fire erupted and a sharp fight developed in the gathering dawn. This scenario uses board q.Game Length: 5.5 turns.

RPT52 Death Rattle: RAHDEN, Germany, 4 April 1945: The 11th Armoured Division swiftly advanced northeast from Osnabrück. Lieutenant Colonel Max Robinson’s 4th Battalion, King’s Shropshire Light Infantry and their supporting A-34 Comet tanks from the 3rd Royal Tank Regiment attacked the village of Rahden. The shattered remnants of the 15th Panzer Grenadier Division offered a surprisingly spirited, yet futile defense of this small village. This scenario uses board s. Game Length: 5.5 turns.

RPT53 Tiger Blood: Matzen, Germany, 26 February 1945: B Company, 37th Tank Battalion was ordered to link up with the 51st Armored Infantry Battalion and support its attack toward Erdorf. B and C Companies of the 51st ran into intense German small arms and machine gun fire coming from the high ground northwest of Matzen, while a lone Tiger tank knocked out three of the 37th Tank Battalion’s Shermans. The armored infantrymen were pinned down until the 37th’s Shermans laid a smoke screen. This scenario uses boards q, r, s, and v. Game Length: 5.5 turns.

RPT54 An Italian Civil War: Ibarra Palace, Brihega, Spain, 12 March 1937: The Garibaldi Battalion and the Black Arrows Division encountered one another on the Toija-Brihuega road. The ebb and flow of the battle had centered around a country estate known as Ibarra Palace. On the 12th, the Garibaldi Battalion of the XII International Brigade made a final counter-attack to take Ibarra Palace from Black Arrows. This scenario uses boards q and s. Game length of 5.5 turns.

RPT55 Coudehard Cache: Coudehard, France, 20 August 1944: The Poles of the 1st Armoured Division settled north of Chambois at Montormel, a hill overlooking the Vimoutiers road. The Poles saw long German columns progressing westward, trying to break out. The situation of the Poles worsened when a regiment of the 2nd SS Panzer-Division counter-attacked. For three days, the Poles fought without re-supply and faced waves of desperate German soldiers. This scenario uses board t and v. Game Length 4.5 turns.

RPT56 Failure to Assimilate: LaVarde, France, 19 July 1944: The 331st Infantry’s assault battalion attacked by going straight down the paved highway. Aided by artillery, the troops encountered light enemy fire and managed to cross the river, establishing a foothold in town. A lucky enemy shell destroyed the bridge into town, thereby denying the U.S. soldiers any tank support. Although outnumbering the defenders, the American assault on the town stalled, and a small German counterattack in the afternoon forced them to retire. This scenario uses board p. Game length is 6 turns.

RPT57 Easy Riders: Luzk, U.S.S.R. 27 June 1941: Kradschhützen-Battaillon 43 was conducting a reconnaissance when Russians ambushed them with direct artillery fire from a tree line. After the initial fire from the tree line, Russian tanks appeared. The Russian tanks were driven back. The motorcycle infantry faced the task of slowing down or breaking the Russian infantry attack until German reinforcements could arrive. Hugh Downing designed scenario that scenario uses board y. Game Length: 4.5 turns.

RPT58 Sikh Defiance: Onerferno, Italy, 12 September 1944: The 7th Indian Infantry Brigade attacked the small village of Onferno. The 2nd Royal Battalion of the 11th Sikh Regiment was the first to enter the village. The 2/11 Sikhs were immediately met with stiff resistance from the German 98th Infantry Division and panzers from the 26th Panzer Division. The Sikh advance was halted and they prepared for the certain counter attack. Hugh Downing designed this scenario that scenario uses board w. Game Length: 5.5 turns.

RPT59 Hungarian Hopscotch: Hajdudurgog, Hungary, 24 October 1944: The Russian 2nd Ukrainian Front moved to cut off and encircle the retreating German 8th Army. The initial assault into Hajdudurgog was ripped to shreds, leaving the 30th Cavalry Division susceptible to counterattack. The 126th Panzergrenadier Regiment (supported by self propelled guns) delivered that blow. Pete Shelling designed this 5.5 turn scenario set on board z.

RPT60 Cat Chow: Gorodok, Russia, 13 January 1943: The 2nd Shock Army attempted to cut the German noose and break out to Siniavino. Establishing a bridgehead across the Neva, the 102nd and 123rd Rifle Brigades attacked the strongpoint at Gorodok. German 88mm guns and Tiger tanks were brought forward to stabilize the lines of the 170th Infanterie Division and push the attackers back. This Pete Shelling scenario uses boards s, u, and v. Game Length: 7.5 turns.

name: Kingdom Death: Monster – Survivor Candy & Cola Challenge Scenario
description:
Survivor Candy & Cola is based on Soda Pop Miniature's Candy & Cola and she appears in both of their two games. (Super Dungeon Explore and Relic Knights).

She was only available through the Kickstarter and in the future will be available in a limited fashion for various promotions. She was suppose to come with:


A KD:M one shot challenge scenario
Promo soda bottle lantern gear card
Promo rules for use with Soda Pop Miniatures Relic Knights game


Candy & Cola were shipped in Wave 1 of Kickstarter fulfillment, but the game content mentioned in the campaign was not included. Game creator Adam Poots mentioned that the content would be printed and released on their website eventually. For now, it is available in PDF format on the Kingdom Death website.
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Horror, Mature / Adult, Miniatures
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Paper-and-Pencil, Role Playing

name: Silent Death Races: Night Brood First Contact
description:
From the back cover:

FIRST CONTACT
'Alright, people, settle down. We haven't got a clue about what we're up against here. What we believe to be advance elements of their main fleet encountered one of our patrols yesterday morning. Friendly contact was lost, but not before we got an N-sweep of the aggressor vessels," the Ops Commander took a deep breath. "Configuration, unknown. Composition, unknown. Armaments, unknown. Occupants, unknown. Good tech, eh? What a surprise. What we do know is that they waxed our guys, and Deep Scan says more intruders are on the way. Plenty more, and soon. Questions?"
-Briefing segment

First Contact shows the initial confrontation with the Grubs, a bellicose alien race intent on the destruction of mankind. They swarm through deep space ravaging planet after planet. Night Brood: First Contact is a revision of the 1992 Night Brood Release.

Night Brood: First Contact includes:

• Rules for using Grub ships and weapons
• Night Brood scenarios
• Brood campaign guidelines
• 188 counters for Brood ships, Drones, Wormholes, and special equipment.
• Displays for 10 Brood ships
- Muskellunge
- Squidge
- Manta
- Dragonfly
- Shaggai
- Larva
- Lamprey
- Remora
- Tigermoth
- Thistle
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Catacombs & Castles: Serangan Promo
description:
This promo hero was included in purchases from elzra.com in late 2017 and 2018.

This provides a hero and stat card for a Castles & Catacomb warrior disc. This uses one of the warrior discs included in the Castles & Catacombs game to represent it on the game board.

This hero can be used in both Catacombs Third Edition and Castles & Catacombs.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Player Elimination, Role Playing, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Shogun no Katana: Wandering Character Geisha
description:
The Character
The Geisha is one of the Characters that can be placed on the board at the beginning of the game. She comes with a set of 15 Geisha tokens (3 per type of 5 types).

Each token represents one of the arts she has mastered. Randomly place 3 of them on her tile and leave the others in a pile nearby. When you encounter her, take one of the 3 tokens from her tile, then replace it with a random one from the pile.
At the end of the game, score the points shown on her tile for each set of different tokens you have collected (based on the number of tokens in each set).

Content
1 Miniature
1 Character tile
15 Geisha tokens

name: Gloire: Swashbuckling Adventure in the Age of Kings
description:
Gloire is a new and complete adventure miniatures game based on the proven mechanics of the .45 Adventures pulp-style rules. Gloire is swashbuckling adventure, like the stories of the Three Musketeers, Dr. Syn and the Scarecrow, and Scaramouche. Players can control master swordsmen, nobles of the court, highwaymen, military heroes, spies... in all more than two dozen character profiles are included in the rules.
The game takes care to capture the elegant artistry of the sword fight, while retaining fast play that keeps players involved. But the game is more than combat! The emphasis on scenarios and encounters found in .45 Adventure is retained in Gloire, making games stories of their own rather than mere brawls. Special rules for dueling provide players with an opportunity to satisfy their honor with worthy foes during the course of a game.

The Gloire scenario The Waylaid Messenger won a coveted Battle Streamer at Historicon 2006, and is included in the rulebook, along with two other scenarios designed to get players involved in the game right away.

Home Page: http://rattrap-productions.com/Gloire/Index.html

Expanded by:

Under the Black Flag: Swashbuckling Action on the High Seas
Thrilling Expeditions: Valley of the Thunder Lizard
Among the War Parties: Adventures in the Early Americas
categories: Adventure, Miniatures, Pike and Shot, Pirates, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Role Playing, Storytelling, Variable Player Powers

name: Fantastiqa: Fantastiqal Landscapes Expansion
description:
Three new interlocking expansions for Fantastiqa, by Alf Seegert. See FILES below for a recommended designer variant!

This expansion is compatible with both the Enchanted Edition and the Rucksack Edition of Fantastiqa. You must have one of these versions in order to play.

I. CLOUD CRYSTALS and GEM BAGS
You’ve overheard a secret at a tea party of talkative fairies! If you combine three Gems of identical color, they will magically transform into a valuable Cloud Crystal!


A Gem Bag is used to keep Gem colors secret when drawing them at random. (Your Dog is smart: he will dig up a Gem in any color you request!)
Trade in 3 identically colored Gems to collect a Cloud Crystal. Cloud Crystals are large bluish crystals worth 5 Gems (!) in purchasing power -- but they only count as one single Gem in the eyes of the Mischievous Raven! Cloud Crystals are thus a great way to increase your wealth.... safely.
Cloud Crystals are also the only way to gain admission to the illustrious Castle in the Air.....!


II. THE CASTLE IN THE AIR
The Castle in the Air is an exotic, exclusive, and largely inaccessible Region of Fantastiqa, filled with all conceivable Artifacts, Beasts and works of fine art. A special Flying Carpet service is eager to convey you to its cloudy abode.... if you have the Cloud Crystals to pay for admission!


The Castle in the Air is a beautiful new Region tile eagerly awaiting your visiting, deep-pocketed Adventurers.
The admission fee is 2 Cloud Crystals (or only one if you bring your own Flying Carpet or broomstick as transportation!)
At the Castle in the Air, instead of only drawing three Artifact or Beast cards at a time, you gain full access to these decks!
At the Castle in the Air you can also fulfill a valuable Epic Quest to exhibit prestigious landscape paintings created by your very own Dragon Artistes!


III. DRAGON ARTISTES and FANTASTIQAL LANDSCAPES
Four of Fantastiqa’s Peaceful Dragons have just returned from Art School at Academie Fantastiqa, eager to paint the landscapes of Fantastiqa and exhibit their work at the Castle in the Air! (In exchange for a nominal payment from their patron, of course.) Begin your new Quest as Fantastiqa’s patron of the arts!


Whenever your Dragon Artiste appears in your hand, you may pay him 1 Gem to paint your current landscape. Collect the beautiful Fantastiqal Landscape card for this Region.
Exhibit paintings of all six Regions at the Castle in the Air to fulfill the Exhibit Quest and earn 6 points!
categories: Adventure, Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Point to Point Movement, Rock-Paper-Scissors, Set Collection, Team-Based Game

name: Ultimate Dinosaur Fighting
description:
Corporations begin setting up special zoos across the world, but the cost for security spiraled out of control and the zoos began to keep the dinosaurs tranquilized. Demand quickly waned and underground fight clubs of excess dinosaurs became popular and began producing huge dividends. Larger and larger dinosaurs were pitted against each other until today we have Ultimate Dinosaur Fighting. With millions of dollars involved, special training schools appeared, and soon Dinosaur Pit Fighting was the most popular sport in the world.

Ultimate Dinosaur Fighting is a Tactical Battle board game. Players win by wounding other dinosaurs to attain victory points and staying alive. When the first dinosaur in the pit dies the game ends on the following turn.

Players choose between 8 different dinosaurs to fight with and place their miniature on the board. Each dinosaur has a different number of life points and different custom abilities and tactics needed to win. Each turn is a combination of movement based on speed and simultaneous action declarations.

You can play one-off fights or use the campaign rules to control a pen of dinosaurs and give them Training, Mutations and Tech upgrades to improve your dinosaurs and make them unique in the world of Ultimate Dinosaur Fighting.

Brought to you by Dark Cult Games
mechanics: Action Queue, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: Flamme Rouge: Vätternrundan
description: A promotional track card for Flamme Rouge. The card depicts the setup for a new track that can be played in Flamme Rouge.

name: Wreck Raiders: The Relic Hunter
description: A Kickstarter exclusive mini-expansion for the game Wreck Raiders. Each player is dealt a secret mission card at the start of the game. Points are received for competing the cards objective.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Set Collection, Worker Placement

name: Death Roads: All Stars – Expansion 3: Power Up!
description: The third bonus expansion created with the community during the Death Roads: All Stars Kickstarter campaign was an exclusive for those who supported the original campaign within the first 24 hours, or who signed up for the newsletter before the Kickstarter campaign launched.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Miniatures, Racing, Science Fiction, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Action Points, Deck Construction, Events, Hand Management, Player Elimination, Turn Order: Stat-Based, Variable Player Powers

name: Baltic Arena: Scenarios for World War II Naval Warfare in the Baltic Theatre – An Expansion for Command at Sea (Volume VI)
description: Subtitled 'Scenarios for WWII Naval Warfare in the Baltic Theater'. 13 scenarios and 11 articles. New rules for mine warfare. Data for most Russian, German and Finnish ships.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Nautical, Wargame, World War II

name: TOKAN
description:
A tactical skill game for two players.

Each side has a team of lions, jackals and mice. The animals meet randomly and, as the game field changes, they must win through thanks to their tactical abilities. Winning relies not on taking away but covering a piece. The top piece reveals the owner of a stack; all the rest underneath are “gobbled up”.
It’s unlikely in the wild, but possible in TOKAN: the mouse can also eat the lion!

Only the smartest creatures will survive...

—description from the publisher

name: Silent Death Campaign Supplement: Renegades – the Espan Rebellion
description:
Fron the back cover:

Laser blasts flashed past the Mistress's prow as Donner spun the ship through a series of evasive maneuvers while dashing away from Las Hermosas. If he could just make it to the edge of the planet's gravity well, he could kick in the Crescent's hyper-drive and leave those [span cops chasing space dust. The Mistress had already lost its escort, and Donner was not going to let those pilots' sacrifice be in vain. Over the headset he heard his gunner scream, and his heart fell into his stomach...

Renegades chronicles the Espan Civil War from the first days after its failed coup to the climactic battle high above the Espan capital of Esperanza. Don't waste another moment-the Renegades need you!

Renegades includes:
• Nineteen quick-play scenarios
• A full campaign system that allows for repeat play
• Six new starcraft designs:
Bloodhawk (SMAC)
Crescent (TMAC)
Conestoga (Gunboat)
Eagle (Gunboat)'
Saucer Shuttle (SMAC)
Scorpion (Gunboat)
• Two new weapon types: Salvage Claws and Tractor Beams
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Frederick the Great: A Dangerous Time
description:
This is a sequel game of Nobunaga: A Dangerous Time from the same designer, Tetsuya Nakamura.

The game covers the whole period of seven years war in Europe.
One turn is 2 months. Map is a point to point type from Nancy to Konigsburg.

200 counters, 32 cards for 2 players.
mechanics: Action Points, Chit-Pull System, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Simulation

name: Excavation Earth: Junk Tiles Promo Pack
description: The Junk Tiles add a new type of rare artifact into the game that allows players to sell items with greater ease and flexibility.

name: Age of Steam Expansion: Las Vegas and Korea (N&S)
description:
Age of Steam: Las Vegas and Korea (N&S) is another pair of expansions for the Age of Steam board game, with new maps and new rules for each setting.

In Las Vegas, players visit the famed gambling town, trying to build their network as usual while also paying attention to the money on the board.

In Korea (N&S), the cost to build track varies depending on which side of Korea players build upon – but in the wealthy South, there are more cubes to deliver than in the poor North. Delivery between North and South becomes more and more difficult as the game progresses.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Network and Route Building, Pick-up and Deliver

name: Mysterium Park: Release Promo Card
description: This promo was released alongside Mysterium Park and provided to retailers with the first printing of the game. It depicts a circus fly being watched by a menacing spider.
categories: Deduction, Expansion for Base-game, Murder/Mystery, Party Game
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deduction, Pattern Recognition, Roles with Asymmetric Information, Storytelling

name: Call of Cthulhu: The Card Game – The Breathing Jungle  Asylum Pack
description:
Game description from the publisher:

The Great Old Ones and those who would oppose them continue to hunt powerful relics in The Breathing Jungle. With this third Asylum Pack in the "Ancient Relics" cycle for Call of Cthulhu: The Card Game, players will discover the power of new items that disappear and resurface throughout human history. This expansion cycle is based on the theme of the global influence of the Ancient Ones and their cults and moves the action from H.P. Lovecraft's dread-filled New England to the wider world.

While the Great Ones strengthen their global reach, investigators, criminals, and cultists wield ancient artifacts and invoke powerful curses. This sixty-card Asylum Pack (three copies each of 20 cards) takes your game out of New England to the rainforests of Mesoamerica. Find hidden cultists and forbidden sacrifices as the story shifts to eons old locales in The Breathing Jungle.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Horror, Novel-based

name: 最後の巫女 (The Last Kannagi)
description:
A shrine maiden who protects the last land of endangered humans by "dirt". They have different beliefs.
At the same time as the final battle to protect humanity, it is also a faction battle of the shrine maidens.

It is a victory point system game that is played 24 hours x 5 days in-game time, focusing on human defense and belief rating.
The board is a hexagonal hex map, and it starts with "dirt" placed on almost the entire surface.

In addition to movement, the actions performed by the player include erection, blessing, prayer, dedication, and shrine maiden-like options.

The resource used for the main action is the "time" in the game, and the higher the level of the action, the faster the "time track" will advance. And the "person with the slowest progress of the time track" is the active player.
In addition, the collected and purified "Dirty", "Protection", and "Revelation" cards will help you in the process.

Collecting resources by collecting impurities, strengthening the company that supports it, and the unique ability of the shrine maiden in charge ... These are intricately intertwined, and the battle of humankind at the end is depicted.

-Google translation of publisher's website

『穢れ』により絶滅寸前の人間たちの最後の地を守る、巫女。彼女らはそれぞれ違う信仰を持っている。
人類を守る最後の戦いであるのと同時に、それは巫女たちの派閥争いでもある。

ゲーム内時間で24時間×5日間で行う、人類防衛と信仰の格付けをメインとした、勝利点制のゲームです。
盤面は六角ヘクスマップで、ほぼ全面に『穢れ』が置かれている状態で始まります。

プレイヤーの行うアクションは移動のほか、建立・加護・祈祷・奉納と巫女さんらしい選択肢。
メインとなるアクションに使うリソースは、ゲーム内の『時間』であり、アクションのレベルを上げるほど『時間トラック』が早く進みます。そして、一番『時間トラックの進みが遅い人』が手番プレイヤーとなります。
他にも、回収・浄化した『穢れ』や『加護』『啓示』のカードが進行を手助けしてくれます。

穢れを回収することによるリソースの収集と、支援をしてくれる社の強化、そして担当巫女の固有能力……これらが複雑に絡まりあい、終末の人類の戦いが描かれます。
mechanics: Action Points, Area Majority / Influence, Grid Movement, Role Playing, Turn Order: Time Track, Variable Player Powers

name: Tobruk Expansion Pack 5A: Kasserine & Beyond
description:
Expansion pack for Advanced Tobruk covering the desert war with the entry of the US forces. Twelve scenarios, counters for the US forces, comes in a ziploc bag.

Expands:

Advanced Tobruk: Tank Battles in North Africa 1940-43
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Hexagon Grid, Simulation, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: African Queen
description:
A very rare and interesting abstract strategy game by Alex Randolph.
This game is part of the Abacus wood box series.

name: Filipinas 1896-1898: Fin de un Imperio
description:
Filipinas: 1896-1898. Fin de un Imperio ("Philippines: 1896-1898. End of an Empire") is a simulation for two players, one leads the Spanish forces trying to hold the Philippines, the other leads the Filipino rebels fighting for their independence and the United States Army if the American intervention occurs.

The game represents the main military operations that were carried out. Players must make key strategic decisions to achieve their goals, balancing their resources and preventing their opponent from doing the same.

There are more than 60 cards of help and events to play for both players representing diseases, ambushes, assassinations, the reaction of the American press and government etc ...

Like the Spaniard, can you keep control of the colony, keep the economy going, and keep America's clutches at bay? Or, like the Filipino rebels, can you take control of the Philippines and defend its independence in the face of US annexation plans? Play the Philippines: 1896-1898. End of an Empire and find out!

—description from the publisher (translated)

Filipinas: 1896-1898. Fin de un Imperio es una simulación para dos jugadores, uno dirige las fuerzas españolas tratando de mantener Filipinas, el otro dirige a los rebeldes Filipinos luchando por su independencia y al ejército de Estados Unidos si ocurre la intervención estadounidense.

El juego representa las principales operaciones militares que se llevaron a cabo. Los jugadores deben tomar decisiones estratégicas clave para lograr sus objetivos, equilibrando sus recursos e impidiendo que su oponente haga lo mismo.

Hay más de 60 cartas de ayuda y eventos que jugar para ambos jugadores representando enfermedades, emboscadas, asesinatos, la reacción de la prensa y el gobierno norteamericanos etc…

Como el español, ¿puedes mantener el control de la colonia, mantener la economía en marcha, y mantener las garras de Estados Unidos alejadas? O, como los rebeldes Filipinos ¿puedes tomar el control de Filipinas y defender su independencia frente a los planes anexionistas de Estados Unidos? ¡Juega a Filipinas: 1896-1898. Fin de un Imperio y descubrelo!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Simulation

name: Hellboy: The Board Game – Pandemonium
description: In Pandemonium some all-new bosses are here to try and end the world. This expansion includes The Flood Case File, Enemy cards, Unexpected Threat Hammerhead card, Encounter cards and Boss Behaviour Cards.
mechanics: Area Movement, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Solo / Solitaire Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Zombie 15': 12 Extra Search Cards Promo
description:
This is a set of 12 extra Search Cards for Zombie 15'.

The cards were first made available to Kickstarter backers of Zombie 15'.
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Growling Tigers under Siege: Defense of Changde 1943
description:
Growling Tigers Under Siege: Defense of Changde 1943（圍城虎嘯:常德保衛戰1943） is a two-player board wargame that simulates the defense of Changde in the end of the Battle of Changde, November 18 to December 3, 1943.
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battle_of_Changde

Each turn represents two days and each hex is about 1 km across. One player commands the Imperial Japanese Army（大日本帝國陸軍） and the other player commands the National Revolutionary Army（國民革命軍）.
mechanics: Chit-Pull System, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid

name: Avichrom
description:
Mother Nature has unpacked her complete colour palette in the world of birds, so that a native bird species can be found for eleven colours by name. In Avichrom, you cleverly play colourful feather cards to attract the magnificent birds.

A player may play one to two feather cards per turn. Matching feather colours are placed under each other to form rows. As an alternative to playing cards, a player may also attract birds. A bird flies into the row with the most feathers of its colour. Some of the birds have effects that can be used immediately.

When the "End of the Day" card is turned over, each player has one more turn with two actions. After that, the scoring will take place. Points are awarded for the number of feathers of the same colour in each row and for the birds attracted. The player with the most points wins.

name: Sky Team: CDG Paris-Charles de Gaulle Extension
description:
An additional airport for Sky Team : Paris-Charles de Gaulle

Contain one postcard with two additionals missions (Yellow and red)

name: Alpha Centauri: A New Hope (fan expansion for Age of Steam)
description: Age of Steam: Alpha Centauri - A New Hope is a map specifically designed for two players. The map was designed by David Turner and is downloadable from BGG.
categories: Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Print & Play, Trains

name: First Strike '62
description:
The Cuban missile crisis spins out of control in this new version of Bruce's acclaimed nuclear war fighting game system.
Using historically accurate strategic (ie Nuclear) force structures the players will be responsible for fighting the war on a global scale when the diplomats fail.

Rather than concern themselves with the operations of Army Corps and Naval Task Forces, players will be directing the B-52 bomber wings of SAC or the Strategic Rocket Forces new SS-7 “Saddler” ICBM’s.

Of course the new Soviet missile complexes on Cuba still retain their importance as a dagger aimed at the heart of the USA and will have to be factored into both sides plans. The surprise potential of these weapons are accounted for in the radar rules.

First Strike '62 is a hex-and-counter wargame. Units have movement points and move across a global map. Players select Operating Programs/Warplans to determine targets for their bomber, submarine and missile assets. Then they attempt to have those units reach their targets while avoiding opposing interceptors, ASW and anti-missiles. The "winner" is the player who scores the most victory points, based on strategic targets hit, surviving assets, and collateral damage received.

name: Splendor: Dice Con 2019 Promo cards – Zhang Qian and Xiang Fei
description:
Two new nobles tiles to be used for Splendor.

Artwork included one male and female noble---Chinese official and diplomat Zhang Qian (张骞) and the Fragrant Concubine Xiang Fei (香妃).

The bottom right hand corner of each tile is marked with a “p” to indicate that it is a promotional noble.

Exclusive promo for Dice Con 2019 event.
categories: Card Game, Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Renaissance

name: Tales from the Loop: The Board Game – The Runaway
description:
Expand your Tales from the Loop - The Boardgame experience with this runaway Machine! For the past week black vans and agents in suits have been seen in the area around the Loop. Rumors have it that they are searching for a spy...

This expansion contains a masterfully designed miniature of the Runaway Machine as depicted in the art of Simon Stålenhag, as well as completely new Scenario featuring it, and all the cards an sheets needed to bring it into our game.

name: Ze Horror Attack: Le retour de la revanche des héros londoniens! – Vol.1 Cauchemars victoriens
description:
The streets of London are not very safe tonight. A night war is brewing. Will Arsène Lupine, Sherlock Holmes or Van Helsing overcome the Mummy, Frankenstein's creature or even Count Dracula?

Join your faction, recover and play special skills to bring light ... or darkness to London!

Each player randomly receives a faction card that they keep hidden. They also receive three cards, which they can, during their turn, either play or draw (within the limit of three cards in hand).

If he plays a card he keeps it in front of himself and applies its effect.

The winner is the one who scores the most points at the end of the game, the hero cards causing the heroes to score points and lose to the villains and vice versa.

—description from publisher
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Variable Player Powers
publishers: Don't Panic Games, Pendragon Game Studio

name: Paperback: 10th Anniversary Edition
description:
We've applied a fresh coat of paint to this deckbuilding word game, including brand new novel covers from a variety of artists.
New starting decks add more decision making and variety to the first few turns of the game.

The brand new Genre mode gives players unique tech trees that open up novel ways to play.

A quick-paced Deadline variant adds drafting to Paperback and allows for zippy simultaneous play.

Typos let you nab that card that's just out of reach, but you'll pay for it later with a hard-to-use letter.

Want to play solo? The new Spy mode pits you against an automata enemy spy who creates problems you need to address until your deck is strong enough to end the game.

Unlockable cards that continue to expand the card pool and introduce new abilities..

A classic variant pack so that you can still play Paperback the classic way.

—description from the designer

name: Valeria: Card Kingdoms – Fire Temple Monsters
description:
Contains:

Hell Wasp
Sigbin
Gagambah
Lava Elemental
publishers: Daily Magic Games, Lucky Duck Games, Schwerkraft-Verlag

name: Skylands: Queenie 2
description: Skylands: Queenie 2 is a mini-expansion for Skylands that adds four special island tiles with one shot effects and four special island tiles with ongoing effects to the game.

name: Die Fürsten von Catan: Sonderkarte Frühjahr 2012 – Catan Mobil
description:
Catan Mobil is the 2012 special card for "The Rivals for Catan".

Ability of the card:
"Wird die Zahl einer angrenzenden Landschaft gewürfelt, erhalten Sie dort einen weiteren Rohstoff. Legen Sie das Catan Mobil danach auf einen anderen Bauplatz, ggf. auch auf einen des Mitspielers. Gibt es keinen, legen Sie es auf die (eigene) Ablage."

In a free translation:
"In case a number of a neighbouring territory came in the dice roll, you receive one extra material from this territory. Place the Catan-mobil in another construction field after that, even in a rival construction field. If there are no free construction fields, place it in your discard pile."
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Territory Building
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Trading

name: The Rivals for Catan: Johannes the Advocate
description:
Johannes,der Advokat is the 2011 special card for "The Rivals for Catan".

This card was given out by Klaus Teuber at the SPIEL11 in Essen (and can also be bought in the Catan Shop).

Text of the card:

Verlieren Sie durch eine Aktionskarte Ihres Mitspielers Rohstoffe, dürfen Sie 1 Gold zahlen und würfeln. 1-3: Fordern Sie 1 Rohstoff von ihm; führt er, dürfen Sie 1 weiteren von ihm fordern. 4,5: Sie erhalten Ihr Gold zurück.

If you lose resources as a result of an action card played by your opponent, you may pay 1 gold and roll the die. 1-3: Demand 1 resource from your opponent; if he leads, you may demand another 1 from him. 4,5: You get your gold back.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Territory Building
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Trading

name: Vikings of Dragonia
description:
As the leader of your Viking clan, your goal is to earn the most honor in all of Dragonia. But beware, wild dragons and rival clans will engage you in battle, stealing your honor and preventing you from collecting treasures.

Vikings of Dragonia is a 2-5 player game of strategy, risk, and reward. Your goal is to become the next ruler of Dragonia by being the first to have the most honor of all. On a modular board and deck of power cards, players choose from a wide selection of options on their turn to expand their territory, increase their honor, or engage in battles with rival clans.

Will you be the next ruler of Dragonia?
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Hand Management, Modular Board

name: Quizcarraldo's Pub Quiz: (Fast) unlösbare Bilderrätsel
description:
Puzzle together, or in teams against each other, and find out which title is hidden behind the illustrated picture.
The 200 picture puzzles cover the four categories: Movies & Series, Music artists, Songs & Albums, Book, Stage & Stories.

The more difficult the puzzle, the more points you can get - but don't get too excited, because the puzzles are quite challenging. Thinking around the corner is absolutely desired and necessary! If you need help (and this will happen sooner than you think), you'll find hints on the back of the card and of course the correct solution. Good luck with the ultimate puzzle challenge!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deduction, Semi-Cooperative Game, Solo / Solitaire Game, Team-Based Game

name: Unlock! Epic Adventures: Die siebte Vorstellung
description:
Unlock! is a co-operative card game inspired by escape rooms that uses a simple system which allows you to search scenes, combine objects, and solve riddles. Play Unlock! to embark on great adventures, while seated at a table using only cards and a companion app that can provide clues, check codes, monitor time remaining, etc.

Grab your popcorn! Tonight, the horror movie "The Werewolf's Final Night" premiers. Will you get through unharmed?

Schnappt euch Popcorn, macht es euch im Kino gemütlich und erlebt den neuen Horrorstreifen "Die letzte Nacht des Werwolfs". Gänsehaut garantiert.
categories: Card Game, Exploration, Horror, Puzzle, Real-time

name: Star Trek Deck Building Game: Worf Promo
description:
Name: Worf
Cost: 6
Type: Character
Characteristics: Federation | Klingon | Male | Sheriff
Effect: You may discard a card from your hand. If you discard a Character, this card gets +3 Attack. If you discarded a Maneuver, this card gets +2 Speed.
Stats: +2 | +3 | - | - |

Currently available through BoardGameGeek's Promo Store (in a 3-card set with Star Trek Deck Building Game: Data Promo and Star Trek Deck Building Game: Holodeck Promo.)
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction

name: Star Trek Deck Building Game: Data Promo
description:
Name: Data
Cost: 6
Type: Character
Characteristics: Federation | Android | Male | Outlaw
Effect: You may reveal a card from your hand. If you do, each opponent discards 1 card from their hand unless they reveal a card from their hand with the same cost as the card you revealed.
Stats: +2 | +2 | - | - |

Currently available through BoardGameGeek's Promo Store (in a 3-card set with Star Trek Deck Building Game: Worf Promo and Star Trek Deck Building Game: Holodeck Promo.)
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction

name: La Juguetería
description:
Each player receives a "wish list" card that they will keep in secret. In every round four “toy” cards will be revealed and all players can try to buy them using whatever money they have available. When several players want to buy the same toy, they must fight in a dice competition to decide who gets it (winning dice result appears in each card). Those players who don't buy anything in a round will win a coin.

The first player to complete their wish list wins the game.

There are 4 ways to play plus a solo rules as well.

Includes an expansion for the game "La Caza de la Calabaza" called La Caza de la Calabaza: Strawberry-Go-Round.

—description from publisher
categories: Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Dice, Economic, Educational, Math, Memory, Party Game
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Market, Open Drafting, Push Your Luck, Set Collection, Solo / Solitaire Game, Turn Order: Auction, Turn Order: Claim Action

name: Escape: The Curse of the Temple – Queenie 16: New Traps
description:
Escape: New Traps - Quicksand, Beast and Lava chambers



The Quicksand chamber (Trap)When this trap is revealed, the player's adventurer is placed in the middle of the quicksand. They now only have a limited number of rolls to try and free themselves from impending doom. They can roll a maximum of 4 times and try to collect 4 torches to escape the quicksand. If they fail, they are stuck and cannot roll their dice again, until other players enter the chamber and roll the 4 torches to help them escape.



The Beast chamber (Trap)You screech to a halt as you enter the room, trying to will your heart to beat more quietly, for in the corner, peacefully sleeping, lies a terrible beast.

To Escape the Beast Chamber, you will need to do something unique to the game—move slowly. You must roll only one die at a time, progressing your adventurer to the next symbol on the path as you roll it. If you roll a Black Mask symbol, set the die aside and use another one. If all your dice ever show Black Mask's, discard one die back to the game box and exit the chamber. Otherwise, when you roll the final symbol, you may exit the chamber and continue back on your frantic journey.



The Lava chamber (Trap)The Lava Chamber presents a double challenge! When a player discovers the lava chamber, their adventurer is immediately placed in the pillar in the middle of the crater of lava. In order to Escape, they will have to roll 4 keys, with other players being able to help by contributing gold masks only. In addition, a gate token is placed across each entrance of the starting chamber, which must be removed by rolling the indicated symbols before players can use that entrance again.
categories: Adventure, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Real-time
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Tile Placement

name: City of Iron: Second Edition – Contracts
description:
A mini-expansion comprising 8 square cards that were included in each Kickstarter copy of City of Iron: Second Edition.

When playing with this variant, each player chooses one of two random cards at the start of the game. If a player owns the specified goods, coins, and science at the end of the game, they receive extra influence.
categories: City Building, Civilization, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Industry / Manufacturing, Territory Building
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management

name: The Grimm Forest: Midsummer Festival Promo Card
description:
The English version of this promo card was given out during Gen Con 2018.

Card text:

End of Gather Phase: For each other player at your Location choose one: Gain 1 resource of your choice, Draw a Fable card, Gain 1 Build Phase action.
mechanics: Set Collection, Simultaneous Action Selection, Take That
publishers: Druid City Games, Last Level, Lucky Duck Games, Mirakulus

name: Soundbytes
description: The Soundbytes device takes what you say, mixes it up, and plays it back. Then everyone tries to guess what in the world you were talking about.

name: Belly Bumper
description: For this game, two people place the 24 inch high, inflatable "Belly Bumper" between their bellies. There are 2 balls inside the blow up enclosure with 3 levels. The goal is to get your ball through all 3 levels before your opponent.

name: Mock My Words
description:
"...it's not what you say... ... it's what you hear!" (TM)

This game is the precursor to Mad Gab. The basic premise is that you are given a string of words that are meaningless, but sound like another phrase or title. "Ache Leans Late" = "A Clean Slate".

In this version, 2 to 4 teams compete to collect cards while advancing toward the center of a board. On a team's turn, one player gives clues for the words in a puzzle (e.g. "What you do when you're sore -- ache"). That player's partners guess the words, and then try to figure out the puzzle. If the timer runs out before they've solved it, then the other team(s) can steal the card. Each card is worth from 3 to 7 points.

When one team is in the middle, they can play for double points on their turn; however, if they lose the card, they're sent back a few squares, and the team that gets the puzzle gets the double points.

The game ends when all teams are in the middle. Whoever has scored the most points wins.

name: Pusan Perimeter
description:
This is an operational level 2 player game of the events in Southern Korea from early August to mid September, 1950. One player represents the North Korean People's Army (NKPA) and the other player the United Nations (UN).

This is the North Koreans last chance to unify Korea under their communist rule. A defeat for the US dominated UN force, before MacArthur conducts his Inchon operation, will spell the end of the UN and probably a loss of the Cold War.

COMPONENTS

11x17 inch map representing the region around the Perimeter in southern Korea.
120 double sided counters show the forces available to both players.
One Player's Aid sheet shows the charts and tables required during play.
One rulebook.

name: JED
description: JED = Just Employed Dimwit. Card game of climbing the corporate ladder. Cards are business card-sized of fictional companies. Players take on different roles, and income denotes which role you play. Your income can change based on how well you do each round, so you can be CEO one turn and eventually fall to JED if you're not careful.
mechanics: Set Collection, Trick-taking, Variable Player Powers

name: Squares
description:
Squares is played on a 8x8 board. Players take turns marking one space with their symbol, trying to form squares. A square of any size can be formed at any angle. A square is worth as many points as the number of rows and columns it covers.

There used to be an online version called Metasquares which had somewhat different scoring rules.

name: Writersports
description:
Writersports was created to encourage, promote and inspire the art of literacy.

The modern decathlon of the mind

name: Go Bark Card Game
description:
Go Bark™ is the matching card game that has it all: 4-color pictures of dog breeds, special strategy and lots of barking out loud. Use cards for traditional "Go Fish" play or the more advanced "Go Bark™" play. Special "Bark Cards™" will get you woofing and yapping to throw players off your scent. 54 premium playing cards plus instructions included. 48 Dog breed cards, 6 Bark Cards™ plus instruction card included. Teachers love Go Bark for educational play!
www.gobark.com
categories: Animals, Bluffing, Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Memory, Party Game

name: Euro Jump
description: An abstract logical game made of a board with 12 stars put in a circle like in the European flag. One player puts his pieces clockwise and the other one in the opposite direction. The objective of the game is to try to form a stones position over which a player would jump creating an infinite loop. Interesting and original mechanics, and very nice materials. The game is made by a small circular bag, that, when empty, becomes the board itself.

name: Terning-skak
description:
This suitcase contains a chess board and 51 dice and one giant die.

The most obvious game is a sort of chess with dice. The pieces are not ordinary chess pieces but are dice: D4, D6, D8, D10, D12 and D20.

There are however more dice, some in different colors, and rules supplied so it's possible to play four other games - three of them for up to four players.

name: Chinese Tiles
description:
[from the rules intro...]
This fascinating game, which combines features of a centuries old Chinese game with modern ideas, provides keen entertainment and the exercise of considerable skill. It is fast, sporty, and not complicated. Standard equipment: 52 tiles, 2 racks, 1 set of rules.

---

The game is a lavishly packaged Gin Rummy. The only difference is that there is a bonus for a hand of entirely one suit (10 points) and for a hand that is one continuous sequence (20 points). The cards are replaced by tiles with suits of lanterns, junks, bamboo and daggers, and the court cards are called Jong, Quong and Kong!

Published in Melbourne, Australia in the 1940's.

name: Surigao Strait
description: "This game is a stylized rendition of the Battle of Surigao Strait. This battle, which was part of the Battle of Leyte Gulf, took place in Phillipine waters during the night of 24-25 October 1944. It is considered to be the last great naval battle of history."
categories: Card Game, Nautical, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Memory, Paper-and-Pencil, Secret Unit Deployment, Tile Placement, Variable Set-up

name: Time Tunnels
description:
Taken verbatim from the back cover:

"Time Tunnels is a game involving tremendous speeds and a lot of action. Fleets of ships may be built one minute, and possibly destroyed the next. The goal of every Supreme Commander is having control over all of the planetary systems."

"Time Tunnels is an unusual game involving the use of black holes, space mines, and time tunnels. Energy crystal production is also an important asset to this game. Time tunnels are created, invisible gateways between planetary systems."

"Time Tunnels uses a unique hidden movement system. With this system, a player's opponents can not actually see the movement strategy taking place. It is a 2-4 player tactical game. Each player is the Supreme Commander of his own alien race."

"The advance game classifies ships into 11 types. It also introduces the usage of the main bridge and the specialist bridge, and the robots and men that operate them."
mechanics: Alliances, Dice Rolling, Events, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Movement Points, Paper-and-Pencil, Secret Unit Deployment, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Dominator
description:
A chess-like science fiction themed game. The game board represents the planet Elkos and is broken up into a series of hexes with four different types of terrain: Flatlands, Rough, High plateaus, and bunkers.

There are four different types of pieces corresponding to the four Elkosian "races" of the planet. The Etons move in a straight line and are blocked by anything but flat terrain. The Artilla Squads also move in a straight line, but may traverse flatlands and rocky terrain. The winged Ariel Bombers may traverse any terrain, but fly short distances - they also carry bombs to bombard the opponents. Finally, the Dominator Lord (one per side) moves up to three hexes but may not ascend plateaus. Its special ability however is to convert any opposing piece to its side by moving next to it.

An interesting twist to the game is that the game board may be altered through the use of bombs. When a bomb is dropped, the owning player may use one of 14 "tri-hexes" to alter the landscape, thereby making previously impassable terrain passable.

The game ends when either the opposing Dominator Lord is killed, one side no longer has pieces other than the Dominator Lord to move, or a stalemate is reached.

Game components are mostly card stock, three color printing on the board.

name: Egghead or Chicken
description:
Rare EduPLAYtional 3M game. In this game players draw question cards, answer a question on the card, and then dial in the answer's code on either the magical egghead or chicken dial to see if they are right. One then moves if their answer is correct. And so forth. As boardgame geeks, you've got to love the egghead dial.

According to Guenther Rosenbaum's 3M Website, there were also two 88 card expansion sets made for Egghead or Chicken as well, although these, if extant, must be extremely scarce.

name: Hostile Aircraft
description:
Tactical (plane to plane) miniature wargaming rules for World War I, including the Italian, Near Eastern, and Russian Fronts. As the rules cover the period of 1915-1920, they also encompass the Russian Revolutions and the Polish-Russian War of 1920. Statistics are given for hundreds of aircraft.

The game is designed for 1/285 scale aircraft. Adjustable stands are used to show the altitude and attitude of the aircraft.

The second edition by Goblintooth was the 1996 Origins Award winner for Best Historical Miniatures Rules.

All rights sold to MSD Games in 2016 - all publications and miniatures are currently available at www.msdgames.com or www.hostileaircraft.com.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Miniatures, Wargame, World War I

name: Dogfight Over Flanders: WWI Aerial Combat Rules
description:
A tactical, plane to plane game of World War I air combat. Designed for use with 1:144 scale models mounted on aircraft stands.

"These rules consist of two sets really; the first as an introductory simple quick play set primarily for the beginner or large groups of people - they are fast and definitely deadly . . . The second (and main body of the rules) are for the more game experienced players and are more detailed in their outcome. Certain aspects of this set can easily be incorporated into the first."
categories: Aviation / Flight, Miniatures, Wargame, World War I
mechanics: Measurement Movement, Movement Template, Paper-and-Pencil, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation

name: Making It
description:
A game designed to give young adults an overview of the corporate world of climbing the ladder of success through blue-collar jobs up through white-collar jobs to CEO of the top corporation through the use of query cards with multiple answers to choose from, the correct answer advancing the player, the wrong answer sending you on an alternate path and trying again.
Game lends itself to building moral character and leadership skills. A good family game but not a game involving skill or strategy.

name: Jogo do Hulk
description: Brazilian game marketed as "Hulk official movie merchandise". Each player has a Hulk figure, which is moved around to fight the U.S.Army. This is represented by men, tanks, helicopters and nuclear weapons, and each type of unit is worth a different number of points. When Hulk is hit, he gets bigger and stronger. Game ends when last Army unit is defeated.
categories: Adventure, Children's Game, Fighting, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: POP Score
description:
A trivia game about pop music. Each turn a player rolls the dice and moves his pawn. The square on which he lands determines the category of the question he has to answer.
The person who has to ask the question has three question cards. He selects one of those and asks the question. If the question is answered correctly, the player gets points (depending on the difficulty of the question). The game ends when a player has reached the end of the track. The player with most points is the winner.

name: Conversation Pieces: Sports Stories
description:
From the instructions:

The object of the game is for players to get to know each other better and build lasting relationships through telling stories. Players will enjoy hours of entertainment, sharing and having fun with the game.


Each player gets a Pass card. Then the first player takes a question card from the deck of 100. The start player then tells a story based on the question on the card. It can be any type of story, true, fictional, whatever the teller wants. Or the player can use his Pass card and pass both it and the question card to any other player, who then has to answer it with a story. Once a story is told, the next player draws a card and the process begins again. The game ends whenever the participants decide to end it.

name: Memoland
description:
Quite nice Memory variant...

Players place cards on 6 different desert locations. Placement of the next card is depended on the card placed before. Cards show 1-3 of 4 different desert inhabitants. After each location contains one card or one location contains 3 cards, 3 question cards are drawn. Players have to guess either how many desert inhabitants of a certain kind are in play or how many of each of them are on a certain location.

Although this sounds quite simple it is pretty tough. No luck involved - just good memory helps.

name: Punta
description:
As can be read on the Ravensburger homepage, the history of Punta is connected to Memory: In 1957, Carlit, the publisher of Punta, refused an offer from Heinrich and Josephine Hurter to issue their "Memory-Game" by referring to a "similar" game already in their program, Punta!

Today's Punta rules contain 3 possible ways to play Punta, but I don't know, if the first editions had only the version, which is indeed similar to Memory.

Common to all 3 sub-games is, that all 60 cards are evenly dealt to the players, which lay them on the table. The player who can turn all his cards first, is the winner.

As in Memory, players can choose 2 cards to look at, but they can only choose their own cards and the revealed cards must match with the throw of the 2-4 dice (1-2 normal dice and 1-2 colour dice depending on the selected sub-game).

name: Wizardry: Tiltowait Card Game
description:
Uno with more special cards and a fantasy (Wizardry) theme to it.

Plays exactly like Uno, down to having to say a special word when you're down to one card. The only differences is the nice artwork on the cards, and the magic spells.

However, most of the magic spells work the same as the special Uno cards (Draw Two, Draw Four, Skip, and so on); but there are a few more of them, including 'counter spells'. Easy to play without Japanese knowledge as long as each player has a translated spell list (there's 10 spells).

name: Madworld
description: From the back: MADWORLD is a game of simplistic rules and intense strategy. You maneuver your armies, each with individual abilities and powers along an ever changing landscape, hoping to vanquish your opponent. Watch out, though, for not everything is as it seems.

name: Battle of Two Empires
description:
Included with FGU's Wargaming Magazine Issue #2.

Battle of Two Empires is based on the history of FGU's boxed game 'Lords & Wizards'. 1-sided, 2-color counters must be cut out and preferably mounted before play.

(9) pages of rules
(1) 11x17" B&W printed map
(1) Card stock counter sheet which includes the CRT (Combat Results Table)
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Movement Points, Ratio / Combat Results Table, Simulation, Zone of Control

name: Jogo do Conan
description:
Conan the Barbarian must destroy a magical talisman and kill the monster on the mountain, going across a forest and avoiding fireballs, before the night falls.

It is really a two-player game, but the rules state it can be played by more players as two teams.
categories: Adventure, Children's Game, Comic Book / Strip, Fantasy, Fighting, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Tramway
description: Simple transportation game issued by the public transportation company in Milan (Italy) sponsored by a local bank. Players move destination by destination on the complex urban transportation network. Winner is who collect more km spending less money in single tickets and/or monthly subscription.

name: Pinocchio Game
description: Pinocchio wants to be a real boy. You can make his wish come true by helping him on his way around the 3-D gameboard in this color-matching adventure. Beware of Stromboli, the greedy puppet master. He lurks ahead, ready to put Pinocchio on stage or in a cage. Watch out for Pleasure Island, too. It's where naughty boys become donkeys. Only Jimmy Cricket, Pinocchio's faithful friend, can save him with Official Conscience cards. But even Jimmy can't save him if he tells a fib. Be the first to get past Monstro the Whale, and you'll win the game.
categories: Children's Game, Fantasy, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Novel-based
mechanics: Pattern Recognition, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Great Shakes, Charlie Brown!
description:
Shake, roll then match the lovable characters on the dice to those found on the game cards. A special wipe-off surface lets you erase and use the cards again and again.

Match & Count (Side 1)
Roll all of the dice and set aside the character that appears the most. You have two more chances to re-roll the other dice to try to roll more of that character. You score points for how many of that character you rolled. After the first 6 rows are filled, players move to the bottom two rows, attempting to match the characters as shown, and score 5 points if they succeed.

Match Race (Side 2)
Each player gets one die (two if two people are playing). Choose a row or column on the card, and all players, at the same time, roll their die/dice and race to match all of the characters in that row/column, placing an X on that square as it is rolled.

Roll a Row (Side 2)
Roll all 5 dice, trying to match a sequence in any row or column on the grid. You have 2 chances to re-roll, and if you succeed, you may circle that row or column. The winner is the player with 5 rows/columns circled (they may overlap).
categories: Children's Game, Comic Book / Strip, Dice, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Match-Ability
description: The exciting group game where people write their quick reactions to words as they hear them and try to match other players. Make the most matches and be first to use all of your make a match point chips.

name: Like It or Lump It
description: All the players are dealt 5-8 cards, depending on the number of people playing. Each card lists a thing to which a person is likely to have some emotional response. The cards have things as varied as "hip hop," "the smell of oranges," "Brad Pitt," "scoring the winning point," and "breakfast in bed." One player is the Lumper. The other players must give the Lumper a card from their hand that they think he/she will like a lot. The Lumper then arranges the cards on a board, which has spaces for Like It (10 points), Thumbs Up (7 points) A-OK (5 points), Not Bad (3 points), So So (2 points), Whatever (1 point), and Lump It (negative 5 points). The players earn (or lose) points depending on where their card was placed. The role of Lumper moves to the left, and when everyone has been a Lumper a prescribed number of times, the game ends. The highest score wins.

name: Bazar der edlen Steine
description:
In Bazar der edlen Steine, each player opens several shops in desirable locations and tries to lure as many customers as possible to them. Storytellers lure customers away, complicating strategy. Experience the bazaar with its close lanes and colourful goods.

This game is an expensively produced update to MarraCash, featuring 111 semi-precious gemstones and 4.5 kg of wood. Auctions and money have been removed, but new features have been added. The game is also known as Agadir (the site of a major gem bazaar located near Marrakesh).

name: Ferry Command
description:
Ferry Command is a game in which each player is an airplane pilot ferrying mighty Flying Fortresses to ports near the war front in various parts of the world, which are indicated on the playing board.

As the Fortresses carry all the cargo possible to the fighting front, their progress outward bound is advanced by the throw of only one die; but the pilot’s return flight is made in a fast flying plane, traveling light, and its speed is accelerated over the route by the throw of two dice instead of one.

When one player has completed five round trip flights the game is ended. The players count up their totals of the numbers on the Cargo Cards they have drawn, and the one having highest total wins the game.
mechanics: Pick-up and Deliver, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Dotto
description: The object of the game is to create horizontal, vertical, or diagonal rows of three or more dots of the same color to score the highest possible points.

name: Länderbahnen Expansion Set
description:
The Länderbahnen Expansion Set adds 10 railways and 3 map sections to Länderbahnen, allows for 3 more scenarios and allows the game to scale from 2-8.

The expansion set was originally produced in a limited edition of 60 and was packaged in its own box. The second "Combined" version of the base game came with the Expansion material included.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Crayon Rail System, Stock Holding

name: Al Parlamento
description:
This is an election game in two stages, with each player representing one party.

First, you have the election, in which you allocate points to a number of issues; seats are then allocated based on the "importance" of the issues you allocated points to. Each seat is tied to an issue.

Once the election is over, parliament sits; here a number of bills are proposed, and players bid on each issue. There are several conflicting needs here. The reigning party (most seats?) earns points if they cast their votes on the winning side of a vote. Other parties earn points for successfully opposing the government. There are two catches; firstly, voting against the interest of your supporters will cause you to lose seats, and secondly, you have a limited number of vote cards (yes/no/abstain), so you may be forced to vote contrary to your interests!

name: Watch Out: Discworld Board Game
description:
From the advertising...

Watch Out

Our new, and we think rather clever, DISCWORLD BOARD GAME

Where those jolly scamps of Thieves try to slip past the brave lads of the Watch in the merry streets of old Ankh-Morpork.

A game devised by the Genius of Trevor Truran, who, after consultation with Terry Pratchett, allowed The Cunning Artificer, Bernard Pearson, to make the ruddy thing.

You get:
8 cunningly sculpted members of the City Watch.
8 of the Thieves Guild.
Plus 48 engraved tiles representing buildings found in and around The Shades.
Plus instructions and all in a Thieves Guild Bag.
The whole lot, made here by old Vincent himself.

name: Orri's Storm: The Battle of Stamford Bridge 1066
description: This sister game to Senlac Hill covers King Harold's great victory over the Vikings in York at Stamford Bridge, before his great defeat by the Normans in southern England a little over a week later. Includes rules for Berserk Vikings and uses "untried units" in the Viking setup so that neither player knows their combat value until they fight. This represents the fact that Harold's forced march across England so surprised the Vikings that many of them had left their armor behind at their base. The title refers to Eystein Orri leading Viking reinforcements into the battle. One 11.5x16.5 inch game map, 140 counters that have to be mounted and cut-out.

name: Escape from Dinosaur Island!
description:
The second (and last) of Fractal Dimensions' line of "Gamelets" - comic-book sized games inspired by the microgames of the 1980s. Escape From Dinosaur Island! involves U.S. Marines in the South Pacific, circa 1944, who find themselves on an island filled with prehistoric beasts.

The game uses two mapsheets. One is a hex-grid encounter map showing an overview of the island. This is used to track the movement of the Marines. The other mapsheet is a square-grid tactical map where the Marines fight battles against the deadly creatures inhabiting the island.

This is primarily a solitaire game, although it includes one cooperative two-player scenario. In the standard scenario, the Marines attempt to escape the island alive. Other scenarios include a mission to rescue a general and a "sole survivor" challenge played entirely on the tactical map.

The basic situation is spiced up by a variety of "events" that may occur during a game. Some of the events involve potential allies who will fight alongside the Marines (such as "friendly" dinosaurs, a "missing link" neanderthal, and a samurai sword wielding Japanese officer). Additional events involve the Marines finding abandoned Japanese weapons and other items that may prove useful.

The health, equipment, and ammo for each Marine is tracked individually using a sheet of status charts. Counters represent Marines, equipment, dinosaurs, and other encounters.
categories: Print & Play, Science Fiction, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Critical Hits and Failures, Dice Rolling, Events, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Minimap Resolution, Movement Points, Paper-and-Pencil, Pick-up and Deliver, Ratio / Combat Results Table, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation, Solo / Solitaire Game, Square Grid

name: Divin' Dolphins
description:
This is a kids game similar to Hungry Hungry Hippos. The game comes with a hubcap size tray that is round on the bottom so that it tilts and spins. The tray has 4 colored cups spaced evenly around the rim, and 20 marbles (5 each of four different colors matching the cups) are placed in the tray. Each player takes a dolphin grabber that has the same color handle as the cup in front of him. The grabber has a dolphin head on its end that closes its mouth when you pull the trigger on the handle.

At the count of three, all players use their dolphins to grab marbles from the tray that match their cups color. The first player to put all five of his marbles in his cup wins.

name: Face the Facts
description: Based on the short-lived 1961 game show, the players each begin with 500 points and wager on the outcome of actual court cases (of which the game contains 101).

name: Kansojen Kisat
description:
From game box:

'Kansojen Kisat is an exciting game of athletics, where results are comparable to real ones.
Players move their tokens by spinning a wheel and comparing result to event specific table.

Similar to: Stadion: yleisurheilupeli

name: NWS: Naval Warfare – World War 2
description:
Review Statement: PaperWars issue #50, reviewer Pat Collins, Page 35 - "If I had to provide an executive summary of this review it'd be: Buy this game; you get a lot for your $39. You can't really consider yourself a serious naval gamer without it."

NWS: Naval Warfare - World War 2 is a NWS Team designed next generation comprehensive naval wargame covering the major naval battles of WW2 with the ability to create unlimited custom scenarios. Carriers, battleships, cruisers, destroyers, convoys, transports, submarines, aircraft squadrons, coastal batteries, merchants, ports, airfields, airbases, airstrips, and various other units are included. Battles include tactical surface combat, strategic carrier combat, convoy battles, amphibious invasions, campaigns and much more!

Features:

All game components below are presented in standard PDF format.
Forces included: United States, Great Britain, Germany, Japan, Italy, Russia, Australia, Denmark, and Netherlands.
Detailed yet streamlined and easy to follow combat mechanics including basic, advanced, optional, and solitaire rules.
Campaigns covering the Pacific and Atlantic Oceans, and the Mediterranean Sea.
Tactical and strategic battles covering carriers, surface combat, convoys, submarines, aircraft, amphibious operations, etc..
744 professional-quality grayscale unit data cards representing 200+ ship classes, 90+ aircraft types, 30+ submarine types, land units, coastal batteries, merchants, raiders, transports.
Over 200+ ordnance and marker cards.
Requires two standard six-sided dice.
Any common Red/Orange/Yellow game markers may be used.
204 1/2" full color counter sheet.
50 page Rules Manual with 24 historical and hypothetical scenarios.
2 combat matrix, 2 search matrix, 2 play sequence charts, and 4 reference charts.
Combat examples included for easy understanding of how the rules work during game play as well as quick reference modifier charts.
10 tactical and strategic color hex maps included representing various hot spots of WW2 naval combat and hypothetical battles.
Very flexible design that can be played as a board game, card game, or with miniatures.
Planned free for download add-ons that will include even more scenarios, maps, units, updated and/or expanded rules, etc...
categories: Miniatures, Nautical, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Hexagon Grid

name: Batman Returns Card Game
description:
This is actually three card games in one...

The Batman Match game: Each player is dealt 5 cards and another five are placed face up on the table. On your turn you draw a card and, if you can match one of the cards on the table, take the pair and place it in front of you. If you can't make a match, you add a card from your hand to the center. When all the players have played all their cards, the player with the most matches wins.

The Batman Battle Game: This is simply the card game "War" using the numbers on the cards. The main difference is that if you play an Umbrella card, you may look at the next two cards in your stack and choose the one you wish to play. The winner is the player with the most cards when the first opponent is eliminated.

The Penguin Panic Game: This is simply the card game "Slap Jack". All the cards are dealt out to the players. On your turn you turn over your top card and toss it on the growing pile in the center of the table. If the card turned over is The Penguin, all players try to be the first to slap their hand down on it. The player who slaps it first wins all the cards and adds them to his stack. The winner is the player with the most cards when the first opponent runs out of cards to play.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Comic Book / Strip, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Hand Management, Set Collection, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Zodiac
description: A game originating in ancient Persia. The seven players each have a marker representing one of seven solar bodies that move around the board in their own concentric circles. Each player starts with seven counters. Counters are won or lost based on the position of the solar bodies, which is determined by die roll. The winner is the first player to collect all of the counters from the other players.

name: Charlie's Year
description:
From the Publisher:

As the title indicates, Charlie's Year covers the events of the last real threat to the Georgian regime of Great Britain and to the social, economic, and philosophical gains of the Glorious Revolution. From 1741 to 1748, the War of the Austrian Succession raged on the continent of Europe. From 1743 on, Britain and France were formally at war. In late August of 1745, Charles Edward Stuart, better known as Bonnie Prince Charlie, landed at Loch nam Uamh with seven men, raised the Standard of the outcast Stuart kings at Glenfinnan, and gathered to himself an army to challenge the might of King George II's realm. Composed of wild Highlanders, Lowland peasants, discontented gentlemen and diehard Jacobite nobles, the Pretender's army defeated the local garrison forces and laid all Scotland at his feet. A descent on England should now have given the Prince's reluctant French allies the diversion they needed to invade. Marching on London however, the Jacobites lost their nerve after reaching Derby and retreated, pursued now by the best regiments of the British Army. The French, working with information a couple of weeks out of date, were still not ready to aid them.

Confronting each other at the battle of Falkirk in the winter of 1745, neither side appeared to prevail, and both withdrew to lick their wounds.
