categories: Card Game, Dice, Medieval, Print & Play

name: Art of Tactic
description:
This is a collectible board game. Which publishing with the magazine about World War II. First issue was at 16 of April 2010. Last will be at 24 of December 2010. 18 parts at all. Each issue contains one Soviet Union and one German unit and cards for them. Some magazines will be contains parts of game board, dices.
Art of Tactics helps to recreate historic battles of World War II. It's designed for 2 players.
In Art of Tactics you'll receive some 7x4 hex mapsheets that can be connected on any side. Each part contains hexes of fields, forests, rivers and etc. The collection also presents the infantries, planes, tanks, combat vehicles, cannons. Each unit is provided a card with the combat characteristics, such as attack, defense, movement, maneuvers and special abilities.
Each player moves his units, depending on their speed. Than they can attack by rolling d6 dices. Than applies result excluding or adding bonuses of the fields and unit's abilities. The goal is to destroy the enemy.

---

Издательский дом «Эгмонт Россия» совместно с ООО «Звезда» в апреле запускает уникальное коллекционное издание «Великие победы», которое включает в себя познавательный журнал, настольную игру и комплект фигурок-солдатиков советской и немецкой армий времен Великой Отечественной войны М:1/72, а также военной техники. В коллекции также представлены самолёты, танки, боевые машины, оружие. Издание богато иллюстрировано с помощью красочных схем, рисованных изображений, фотографий, карт, а также содержит уникальную информацию об основных сражениях. Журнал ориентирован на учащихся младших и средних классов школы, а также коллекционеров. Каждый номер включает в себя цельный и самостоятельный набор для игры, а собрав все выпуски вместе, читатель станет обладателем целой армии. Игру можно начинать уже с самого первого выпуска – сначала эту будет простая игра, но с каждым последующим номером количество солдат и техники будет расти, увеличится и игровое поле, появятся дополнительные правила. Игровое поле настольной игры помогает воссоздать ход битв времён Великой Отечественной. Благодаря продуманной игровой системе, бросая кубик, игроки позволяют различным родам войск сражаться друг с другом. Журнал будет выходить раз в 2 недели - до конца 2010 года всех читателей ожидает 18 выпусков журнала с коллекционными вложениями – миниатюрами производства «Звезда».
Первый номер в продаже с 16 апреля 2010 года.
categories: Collectible Components, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Modular Board

name: Seeds of War
description:
Seeds of War is a tabletop miniatures wargame which allows you to play out battles between massive sci-fi armies. The rules cover the movement, morale, and combat of infantry, armor, artillery, aircraft, as well as giant warmachines. The rules can be used with any 6mm sci-fi miniatures but are designed to be used with Dark Realm Miniatures which feature several armies each possessing a unique play-style based on the force's strengths and weaknesses.

The Seeds of War rule-set as well as army lists for the various armies can be downloaded for free at Dark Realm Miniatures website.

name: 5150: First Contact
description:
From publisher's website:

First Contact is a supplement to 5150, the original set of sci-fi rules from Two Hour Wargames. First Contact revolves around a rebellion on a small planet where the colonists have decided to break away from their home world. It documents the war between Earth and her first colony, Mars.
But what starts out as a local conflict erupts into something larger as the rebels, known as the Sahadeen, receive help from an unexpected source, the ever-expanding empire of Gaea Prime.

First Contact incorporates the Earth Force and Sahadeen into 5150. We've documented the three stages of the conflict and have provided six linked scenarios into a mini-campaign. First Contact can be played solo against the game mechanics (or against the machine as we like to call it), cooperatively where all players are on the same side against the machine or competitively against your friends. And it can be played from either side.
Ideal for use with the 15mm range of Sci Fi figures from Rebel Minis, First Contact can be used with any figures you may already have.

5150: First Contact is not a stand alone game. You must have 5150 to play.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Flames of War: River of Heroes
description:
River Of Heroes follows Hammer and Sickle and focuses on the Soviet units carrying out the final phase of Operation Bagration, the final assaults across the Vistula River led by the tank spearheads racing towards Warsaw along with the specialised assault engineers and supporting self-propelled artillery regiments.

With the lead tank spearheads finally meeting stiff German opposition the advancing Soviet Armies made their final Operation Bagration assaults to secure bridgeheads over the Vistula River.

What Soviet forces are inside?

River Of Heroes introduces the specialised Soviet Assault Engineers along with Independent Self-propelled Artillery Regiments designed to attack, secure, and hold key bridgeheads needed to continue the advance towards Germany.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, World War II

name: Earthling Abductor
description:
From back of box:

"You are a Space Alien and you need Earthlings for a sinister and mysterious goal known only to you.

Use your alien mind-control powers to manipulate Earthlings into doing your bidding and use your ship to blast your foes in this action packed game of deception and intergalactic mayhem"

Earthling Abductor is a quick, simple card game with a strong memory element. Players assume the role of alien species competing to abduct and control Earthlings. Cards represent Earthlings (human and otherwise). Cards in a player's hand are Earthlings that have been previously abducted, and can now be activated by their alien overlords to do nefarious tasks - most frequently abducting more Earthlings. Cards face-down at various locations on the table represent Earthlings to be abducted. The face-down stacks at each location are built up by players during the course of the game; thus each player potentially has some knowledge about what types of Earthlings are at each location, which is where memory becomes involved.

Players move their spaceship tokens from location to location, abducting Earthlings (moving some of the face-down cards away from the location), and then fly back to their homeworlds to score them. Some Earthlings cause trouble when they are abducted (damaging the spaceship), while other may offer benefits while they are aboard. Players can also directly and indirectly attack other players' spaceships, to either prevent them from completing their abduction goals or sometimes to steal dangerous Earthlings without suffering the consequences.

Players win by successfully abducting 10 Earthlings and returning them to their homeworld. Each player also has a secret objective which allows them to win with a smaller number of Earthlings, such as six of the same species or 7 of the same gender.

Earthling Abductor: Deluxe Edition contains 68 Earthling cards, 7 Alien races, and 6 plastic space-ships. It supports 2-4 players.

Earthling Abductor also comes in a non-Deluxe edition, in a smaller box containing 44 Earthling cards, 4 Alien races, and 4 plastic space-ships. It supports 2 players. The two versions are otherwise identical.
mechanics: Memory, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Goldrush!
description: In Goldrush! the players start deep down in a cave filled with gold. The goal is to get out of the cave with as much gold as posible. Every now and then the cave collapses and the players might be caught in the falling masses of stone. The players are able to influence on whether the cave will collapse or not but they can never be certain. To help them they have a Amulet which warns them just as they cave is about to collapse but it can only be used once. It takes guts to stay and pick up gold with the risk of the cave collapsing. The player who gets out with the most gold wins!
mechanics: Modular Board, Open Drafting, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Göttinger Ploppfrosch
description:
The game consists of a metal frog which is put into a water basin (an empty fish tank, a bucket, whatever) and covered with water. The frog contains a hinge so the top part (the "mouth") can open. Each player receives a long straw.

The players now take turns blowing air under the frog's head. The aim is to be the last person to blow without the frog opening its mouth (thus releasing the air). When the frog opens its mouth, the last player to blow before the current player receives a point. The game is played until a certain number of points is reached by a player.
When the first player to blow makes the frog open its mouth, all other players receive a point.

The frogs were handmade as art objects by Reinhold Wittig from scrap metal (small copies with soup ladles, larger ones with drinking troughs), and there are also some unique designs.

name: Equilibloc Color
description:
Aim of the game: To be the last player to move a block of wood without collapsing the tower.

How to play: Build the tower, mixing the colored wood blocks. Throw the dice and remove one piece with the same color on the dice from the tower and position it on the top. The player who make the tower fall down loses the game

name: Grand Melée
description:
Grand Melée, the first expansion for Battles of Napoleon, contains additional game boards, in addition to more than 200 French and British figures that will allow players to reproduce and fight new and especially larger battles, as the boards are modular.

Also Grand Melée will include an alternative set of bases with different colors to create a greater number of unit groups.

The scenarios included are from the Peninsular campaign, the Waterloo campaign, and one from Egypt, with some interesting variations created by "zooming" in and out from the level used in the core set, and a Peninsular War scenario (Vimeiro/Ventosa) which can be played as two separate battles or one larger battle (even if historically the two battles were spaced a few hours apart, it's a reasonable "what-if" that they could influence each other more).

Source: Nexus spring 2010 catalog, and thread/539499/arrived-at-last

name: NBL Challenge
description:
The game is broken down into two phases: the pre-season and the season itself. In the pre-season, players move around the game board, buying players and collecting sponsors. Once the teams have filled their roster, the regular season begins. Games are played by simulating the results with the games spinner, with your players effecting the outcome, while other in season events, such as player trades, occurring between games. Once every game from the regular season has been simulated, the playoffs begin, and the NBL Champion is determined.

The game comes with over 100 player cards from the 1994 NBL season.

From the game box:

Whether you're in to Basketball or a budding entrepreneur, NBL CHALLENGE is the game for you.

Take the reins of your favourite club and through clever and daring team management take them all the way to the top. Build the team of your dreams, see how they perform, analyse game statistics and make those tough decisions to win you the Mitsubishi Challenge Trophy.

It takes skill, strategy and not a little luck to keep a professional basketball team viable. You'll need to keep an eye on the club's bank balance as well as ensuring your players are kept trained and happy. Go after those lucrative sponsorship deals, win games and don't forget your coach - he might just get a better offer from another team! Above all else, keep an eye on the rival teams - there can only be one winner in NBL CHALLENGE.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Hand Management, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Warheads Medieval Tales
description:
Warheads: Medieval Tales is tabletop miniatures wargame with some role-playing elements, set in a comical and mythical medieval England.

As well as new scenarios and characters each edition of the Warheads Magazine delivers large sections of narrative and high quality artwork.

Players control one of two heroes and their followers. Every character in the game has their own statistics, skills and narrative which makes them unique. Over the course of the series characters and parties grow and evolve based on the decisions that players make as well as an experience and equipment based system for customization.

Rules are introduced a little at a time in a tutorial style, with just enough presented initially to play the first scenario. Depth is added by each subsequent scenario with range and cover rules presented in the second scenario of issue one before rules for magic are introduced for the third and final scenario of the first book. The game uses a dice based system for determining events such as combat.

The Warheads: Medieval Tales saga is to be delivered over 6 magazine installments, each magazine launched with two accompanying miniature box sets containing between 4-8 unpainted 28mm metal miniatures.

From publishers Website:

Warheads: Medieval Tales is a fast and fun two player tabletop game for players of all ages and abilities. Every two months we'll release a full-colour, lavishly illustrated magazine in which you get to tell the story of Hugo of Deangard and his bitter rival Gui le Batard, as they gather followers to fight each other and go on amazing quests. Over the course of six issues the story unfolds with you in charge of the characters' destinies and development.

Each magazine contains all the rules you need to play the battles and characters contained in it and is accompanied by two boxed sets of uniquely-styled Warheads gaming miniatures.

The rules are fast and easy to learn, and they build over the lifetime of the game, so you don't have to learn everything before you start. Warheads: Medieval Tales blends the best of story driven role-playing and tabletop wargaming
categories: Adventure, Book, Fantasy, Fighting, Humor, Medieval, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Role Playing, Storytelling, Variable Player Powers

name: Flintloque (Third Edition): Death in the Snow
description:
Death in the Snow game book is a complete 28mm miniatures rules system, but also can be used to expand any of the other Flintloque 3rd edition game books.

Death in the Snow is a Napolonic Fantasy skirmish wargame which you only need under a dozen miniatures for each side and a number of D10s to start playing.

Death in Snow takes the histrocal background of Napoleon’s invasion of Russian and places it into the Flintloque fantasy background of the Elven Emperor Mordred invasion of The Mysterious Witchlands.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Napoleonic, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Role Playing, Variable Phase Order

name: Palavra Final
description:
Palavra Final is an exciting game, on every word, and every card. You spin the wheel, play, and start to create you sentence, from the first word. Everybody starts the game with 10 cards and the objective to achieve the victory is to discard all your cards, but to do this you have to keep an eye on the sequence: It has to be logical.
Each turn every player spin the wheel and do whats it's written.
It could be to drop a card, drop a closed card, give two of your cards to another opponent, challenge another player if the sequence makes sense, without the risk of taking all cards to you, change two cards, put a card between others that are already on a sentence, or the most excite option, put a card on any blank space, but when the sentence gets there it has to be logical. And if you don't agree with your opponent you can challenge him to explain the sentence. You can conjugate the verb in diferent ways to make sense, but if the other players don't agree you take all the cards from the board, but if you can explain to them and they accept the opponent that challenges you take all the cards. The first one to discard the last card wins the game.
mechanics: Open Drafting, Roll / Spin and Move

name: ColorMonsters
description: The game is played by 2-4 players on the board consisting of 24 hexes. Players start the game creating little ColorMonsters made of 3 segments, each segment having one mouth. Each round, the stones (meteorites) are placed on the board. From them, ColorMonsters harvest gems (and Action cards)—as many as the number of their mouths face the stone. Players trade gems with each other and sell them to the bank for Galaxy money, using them to buy Gold, and Action Cards from the bank. Each round, the ColorMonster can grow up one two-mouth segment, up to 7 segments. ColorMonsters can move on the board to make more gems and hinder other ColorMonsters in making gems. To win the player(s) needs to collect 7 Golds.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Trading
publishers: Art of Life Plus, SMP Game Laboratory

name: Genitri
description:
Genitri is a two player board game. It's very easy to learn, but exciting to play. No game is like the previous one.
Goal of the game is to put more tiles on the board than the opponent, by skillfully arranging the pathes.
The tiles are placed alternately.If one of the two players can't play his own tiles, then the opponent must play his remaining applicable tiles.
To win you have to use your strategic tiles intelligently, because you only have 3 start tiles, 3 blocking tiles and 6 arborization tiles.
Its up to you to find out the right placement strategy.

name: Brushfire
description:
A miniatures wargame set in a version of Earth with animal-based countries. From Napoleonic France populated by burrowing mammals, to an Ottoman Empire founded by reptilian nomads, Brushfire continues to follow our Legendary Realms roleplaying mentality with an indepth hero and army development system, as well as a complex Campaign design. (Publisher Blurb)

The game features a unique and interesting system using 10 sided dice instead of the classic 6 sided. This creates new dynamics as well as new odds to master. In addition, the game has three different kinds of points by which to buy your army. This creates a very different feel than most war games, as an army feels like an army, not all heroes or all infantry. Finally, the game uses and RPG-like style of hero creation, where a player is given so many hero levels, which can be used to buy skills on a skill tree. Overall this makes for an original and fascinating game.

name: Dungeon Twister: Bonus Objects
description:
In this Goodies 2007: Bonus Objects

You will find,

2 Cursed trunks
1 Ring
1 Ring of weakness
1 Ring of repulsion
1 Teleportation ring
1 Anti-magic ring
1 Jade mask
In gold color!
4 Elven Bows (B/Y/R/G color)!

The rules ares in Dungeon Twister site (.org).
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Fighting, Maze
mechanics: Action Points, Hand Management, Modular Board, Secret Unit Deployment, Variable Player Powers

name: Quarterback King
description:
Quarterback King is a board game which unites the sport of football and the game of chess into a fun, strategic game for two players. The game pieces are set-up in a traditional football formation, on a twenty-four square by ten square checkered football field board. The object of the game, like football, is to outscore the opponent. One player manages the offensive game pieces, trying to maneuver the quarterback towards the opponent’s end zone for a score (touchdown or field goal). The other player manages the defensive game pieces, trying to capture the quarterback or prevent its advancement toward the goal line.

Pieces are moved one at a time, similar to chess, beginning with the offensive team, then alternating to the defensive team. Each game piece is assigned a specific directional pattern of movement. Once a piece is captured it is removed from the game board. If the quarterback is captured, players switch roles, with the defensive team becoming the offensive team at the point of capture and vice versa. All pieces are returned to the board and play resumes.

Scoring: A touchdown is seven points; a field goal is three points; a safety is two points.

Game Timing: The game is played in two halves or four fifteen minute quarters. Each coach is allowed three timeouts per half.

Play timing: The offensive coach has thirty seconds to move a piece. The defensive coach has fifteen seconds to make a responding move, which makes for a fast-paced and pressure packed game of strategic fun.

This description is attributed to Cort Hubbard, the game designer.

name: Murray River
description:
"Murray River" is a tactical level wargame, for two players, of the battle that took place near the Murray River, Western Australia (WA), in October 1834. Governor Stirling led a British Force comprising troopers and soldiers of the 21st Regiment on a punitive expedition against a local Aboriginal community in an attempt to stem the rising tide of attacks by Natives that resided near the Murray River, against the white settlers in the region. Players control the various British and Native forces which took part in this battle.
Units range from individuals to small groups. Map scale is 33 metres per hex and each turns represents about 4 minutes. Murray River comes with a full colour map in 2 A3 sections, 256 mounted color counters, rule book and charts in a ziplock bag.

name: Lindenstraße
description:
This is a TV tie-in with the popular eponymous German TV series.

Players move around the board trying to collect 1 chip from each of the 6 houses on the street. To collect a chip, a player has to answer a question concerning the show correctly. After collecting all 6 chips, the player needs to answer a master question correctly to win.

There are several inbuilt variants for more or less competitive/cut-throat play.

name: Třináctá komnata
description:
Thirteenth chamber (from the game cover):
Joint talking, laughing, that get together, we can learn a lot about myself as well as others. The way the game players pass through issues, tasks and rewards seven colors of the houses. Winner is the one who went through them all. The game can also be defined in time. We recommended to play Thirteenth chamber for more evenings.

Game description:
Players traveling the plan by rolling the dice and attend multi-colored houses. Each one represents one area of personal development. Upon arrival at the designated location, the player must accomplish the task associated with the sites and areas in which he moves. Once the task is finished, player gets a color card as proof of mastery of the area. Who gets the trophies from all seven regions first is the game winner.
Fields: Purpose, self-acceptance / concentration / center of personality, intuition / inner voice / spirit world, the mass / money / home, emotions / relationships / partnership / sexuality, love and security, self-expression / self-actualization

---

Z popisu na obalu:
Společným povídáním, smíchem, který sbližuje, se můžeme dozvědět hodně o sobě i o druhých. Cestu po herní růžici projdou hráči pomocí otázek, úkolů a odměn sedm barev domečků. Vyhrává ten, kdo je prošel všechny. Hra může být vymezena i časově. Doporučujeme Třináctou komnatu hrát dlouhodobě více večerů.

Popis hry:
Hráč dle hodu kostkou cestuje po plánu a navštěvuje různobarevné domy. Každý z nich představuje jednu oblast osobního rozvoje. Po příchodu na určené místo musí hráč splnit úkol, spojený s daným místem a oblastí, ve které se právě pohybuje. Po splnění úkolu získá barevnou kartu jako důkaz ovládnutí dané oblasti. První, kdo získá trofeje ze všech sedmi oblastí se stává vítězem hry.
Oblasti: Cíl, sebepřijetí/koncentrace/centrum osobnosti, intuice/vnitřní hlas/duchovní svět, hmota/peníze/domov, emoce/ vztahy/partnerství/sexualita, láska a bezpečí, sebevyjádření/seberealizace

name: Shifters
description:
From the Rules:

In Shifters, each player is a mystical shape changer competing against the other players in a series of trials to be named the next master shape-shifter. Trials entail a battle of wits that will require bluffing, deduction, and careful timing to win. Players earn trial tokens by having animal "morph" cards in play with attributes that best match the requirements of the current trial. Players will also cast a variety of spell and obstacle cards to hinder their competitors or propel themselves to victory. But be careful! Cards are selected in a hidden fashion with all players revealing their moves simultaneously. When shape-shifting is involved, you will need to be cunning to stay ahead. When all the trials are completed, the player with the most trial tokens wins!

............
Playtesting Request

Shifter's is currently in the second prototype phase, and needs playtesting! If you would like to playtest Shifters, please send Mezmorki a PM.
mechanics: Hand Management, Simultaneous Action Selection, Take That

name: Fist of the North Star
description:
This is man to man combat card game base of "Fist of the North Star", is Japanese manga/anime.
Each player control one character from story. A battle is done by the card play in battle royal form.
Various techniques of the battle styles that it appeared with a combination of the card and the dice can be used.
The player who survived to the game end is a winner.
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Ragnarok: Legend of the Galactic Heroes
description:
This game is operational level wargame based on univers of the Legend of the Galactic Heroes, is Japanese science fiction novel/animation. This game represent invasion Free Planets Alliance by Galactic Empire called "Operation Ragnarok".

Two players move the ｓｔａｒ fleets on the map which covers whole territory of the Free Planets Alliance. The purpose of the Galactic Empire player is the conquest of the alliance. The purpose of the Free planets alliance player is to crush the intention of the Empire.

As a story was so, the ability of the Admiral of Star Fleets influences a movement and a battle. A battle is resolved with the tactics chit choice and the Fire Power CRT. Various fleet tactics in the story are represent by the tactics chit choice.

Scale: 1 turn: 10 days, 1 hex: unknown, 1 unit: about 2000 space ships
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Novel-based, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid

name: Yonin Shogi
description:
Yonin Shogi or Four-handed Shogi is a four-player variant of shogi invented in 1993 but published in its current form in 1995.

The game is played using two subsets of standard shogi pieces and a standard 9x9 shogi board. Each of the four players gets one king, one rook, two gold generals, two silver generals, and three pawns.

The players sit around the board, one at each of the four sides. At start, each player's pieces are arranged in three rows forming a triangular pattern centered along the respective edge of board:

The objective of the game is to capture your opponents' kings. Individual play as well as team play is possible. Movement and capture are identical to standard shogi, except for check and checkmate.

name: Olympic handball
description:
Peculiar statistical replay game on a minor sport game, handball, dedicated to all the editions of this sport in the olympic games.
Basic system is really simple, as each team is rated for goal made and allowed, plus a killer instinct capacity (the ability to win point to point games) and a random modifier based on historical performance in the competition. Opposing teams compares values, then a die is rolled for each team to determine the final score (after a few possible modifications).
Very simple and very fast to replay an entire tournament in a very short time

name: RAID: Random Adventures In Dungeons
description:
RAID - Random Adventures in Dungeons is a fast-paced, easy to learn, action/adventure RPG from Double Aye Games.

Enter an ever-changing world where no two games will ever be the same. Battle monsters while seeking untold riches and the way out of the dungeon. Work with your friends, or leave them to be eaten by the monsters while you take off with the loot!

Choose from 7 customizable character types:
Wizard, Warrior, Archer, Monk, Paladin, Thief, or Cleric.

Equip your character with weapons and armor you gain from your battles. Watch out for traps! There is a new surprise around every corner and no two dungeons are ever the same.
categories: Card Game, Educational, Fantasy, Medieval, Miniatures, Renaissance
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Role Playing, Tile Placement, Variable Player Powers

name: Hopperdame
description:
From Hopperdame website ( http://mlwi.magix.net/bg/hopperdame.htm )

HopperDame (or simply Hoppers) is a new invention. In HopperDame with promotion rule you win by capturing all the opponent's pieces. Pieces move forwards and sideways, orthogonally or diagonally, by shifting to an adjacent square, or by jumping over an adjacent friendly piece (also termed 'hopper'). Jumps must only occur over a piece of the same colour. It's not allowable to step or jump backwards. The exception to this is the "king", which can jump over any piece, and step in all directions.

To promote to king one must conquer the "castles", that is, the corner squares behind the enemy position, by holding both these positions with a piece, so called "double-promotion". If a piece steps or jumps into the enemy corner then it is promoted to king only if the other enemy corner is already occupied by a friendly piece. Also, a piece which steps into the corner square may later be promoted if the other corner has subsequently become occupied by a friendly piece. The promotion is then done by dropping the piece on the same square. But this costs a move.

HopperDame employs the rule of exchange-capture: the counter jumps over a friendly counter. If the square where it lands is occupied by an enemy counter, then this is captured. It is only when leaping that the counter can make captures. A leaping counter may continue to leap over friendly counters until there are no more to leap over or the player decides to stop. It's not allowable to jump back to the square you just came from.

Note that capture is only made when jumping. Thus, a single piece cannot make a capture by itself. The exception to this is the king, which has an additional capture method: it can capture an adjacent enemy piece directly, like a king in chess.

name: Chroma 4
description:
Goal: to build a 30x30 cm square using rectangular pieces of different colors while avoiding pieces of the same color to touch themselves.

Gameplay: The pieces are evenly distribute between the players. The first player puts one of his pieces over the table. The other players do the same, trying to build a square. Pieces of the same color cannot touch each other(horizontally, vertically or diagonally). The winner is, either the player that puts his last piece or, if there aren´t a possible move, the player that has fewe pieces left.

name: El Juego de las Hormigas
description:
After the latest rains, several colonies of ants are trapped by water. Should cooperate in building a bridge that allow them to leave, but without neglecting their familys. Must go to search of food, materials and to extend their anthill, care for the larvae, feed ants and defend against attacks from other insects. The best Developer colony will take the victory.

The players handled their own colony of workers and warriors, and will have to face all these challenges, carefully choose the most beneficial actions and learn to manage their ants, both the workers who are those will go for food and materials, and the warriors, which will give you protection against insects. You'll get victory points for contributions to the construction of the bridge, the good behaviour of your warriors, as well as at the end of the game for having the best developed colony.


Tras las ultimas lluvias, varias colonias de hormigas se encuentran atrapadas por el agua. Deben colaborar en la construccion de un vado que les permita salir, pero sin descuidar a su familia. Deberan ir en busca de materiales y alimento, ampliar su hormiguero, cuidar de las larvas, alimentar a las hormigas y defenderse de los ataques de otros insectos. La colonia mas trabajadora y mejor desarrollada se llevara la victoria.

Los jugadores manejaran su propia colonia de obreras y guerreras, y tendran que enfrentarse a todos estos desafios, elegir cuidadosamente las acciones mas beneficiosas y saber administrar sus hormigas, tanto las obreras que son las que iran por comida y materiales, como las guerreras, que te daran defensa contra los insectos. Conseguiras puntos de victoria por los aportes a la construccion del puente, por lo bien que se hayan portado tus guerreras, asi como al final del juego por tener la Colonia mejor desarrollada.
mechanics: Area Movement, Auction/Bidding, Pick-up and Deliver, Simulation

name: 長元記 (Chō Gen Ki)
description:
Chō Gen Ki (Record of Chōsokabe Motochika) covers battles in the Shikoku region fought by Chōsokabe Motochika.
Six scenarios are included.

Each players control one or more clans. Each clan regroups combat units.
There are four action segments in each game turn. The number of segments during which each troop can act is decided by commander's activation ability. Action that can be selected are movement, field combat, siege, moral recovery, reorganization and replacement.

The victor of the game is the player who gains the most victory points. Victory point are provided by the control of castlse and the removal of enemy units.


Note: "Chō Gen Ki" (長元記) - "Chō" is Chōsokabe Motochika; "Ki" is a record.

The game was first designed as a self-published expansion kit in 2006 and republished in 2021 as an independent game that includes standard rules (Game Journal 80).

name: Starship Troopers Miniatures Game: Klendathu Invasion
description:
From the back cover,

"The Homeworld of the Arachnid menace has been located and the Mobile Infantry has been moved into position to strike -- are you ready to join the greatest battle Mankind has ever initiated?

Klendathu Invasion is the largest combined fleet and Mobile Infantry operation of the Arachnid War to date.

Within these covers:

Invasion: The story of Starship Troopers continues, from intitial preparations for invasion to the final retreat.

Army Lists: The Mobile Infantry gains the use of the huge invasion companies, while the Arachnids fight back with cunning traps and tunnel systems.

Fighting on Klendathu: Determine the fate of your own Mobile Infantry company during the invasion in a complete campaign."
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: LIGHT BIKES
description:
LIGHT BIKES is a quick set of rules for 2-6 players looking to recreate futuristic duels between light-powered cycles in an arcade arena. Bikers race across the game grid, generating a maze of walls with their cycle to box in and destroy their opponents, while trying to avoid hitting any walls themselves.

Designed to be used with 1/50 and 1/64 scale diecast motorcycles, LIGHT BIKES is a short and sweet set of rules that gives you everything you need to get started, including instructions on how to build your own game grid and light walls.

While a variation of the Speed Rally rules, LIGHT BIKES is a stand-alone game, complete in itself
categories: Maze, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Racing, Science Fiction, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Pattern Building, Point to Point Movement, Tile Placement

name: Atomic Super Humans (Second Edition)
description:
Atomic Super Humans is a turn based combat game for two or more players set in a world where super powered humans must decide if their gifts should be used for the good of mankind or for their own personal gain. Atomic Super Humans gives players complete control over the creation of their character. Players can create an existing character from popular media or one from their own imagination. The possibilities are endless. The object of the game is to stop the opposing player's atomic super humans from succeeding in their plans.

Atomic Super Humans is a standalone game that can also be used as an expansion for any other Toy Battle System game.
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Fighting, Miniatures, Science Fiction

name: Dragon's Lord
description:
Dragon's Lord is a free non-CCG about duels between dragon trainers. With one shared deck the two players will be able to make their dragons grow and fight in the quest for the title "Dragon's Lord". Every turn you can put in play from your hand one dragon, attach one energy card to a dragon, play one tactic card, and/or attack; then the next player draws one card and repeats the process. Once you have in play a basic dragon you can put in play a level one dragon, then a level 2, and so on; or you can level up the basic dragon and get a bonus ability. Game play and style is similar to Pokémon TCG but much simpler, yet very strategic.

Dragon's Lord es un juego gratuito de cartas no coleccionable sobre duelos entre entrenadores de dragones. Con un único mazo compartido los dos jugadores serán capaces de hacer crecer sus dragones y luchar en busca del título de "Señor de los Dragones". Cada turno puedes poner en juego desde tu mano un dragón, adosar una carta de energía a un dragón, jugar una carta de táctica y/o atacar; luego el siguiente jugador roba una carta y repite el proceso. Una vez que tienes en juego un dragón básico puedes poner en juego un dragón de nvl 1, luego uno de nvl 2 y así sucesivamente. O puedes hacer subir de nivel el dragón básico y obtener una habilidad especial adicional. El juego — mecánica y estilo — es similar a Pokémon TCG pero mucho más simple y a la vez estratégico.
categories: Card Game, Fantasy, Fighting, Print & Play

name: BattleTech: The Battle for Twycross
description:
From the back of the book:

"From beyond known space com the Clans... hightech barbarians bring war and destruction to the Inner Sphere. The Jade Falcons were one of the fiercest and most brutal of these Clans. Preying on the Federated Commonwealth, they mercilessly slaughtered its defending forces.

The most successful of the Jade Falcons forces were the Falcon Guards. Led by Star Colonel Adler Malthus, the guards amassed an incredible string of victories.

Their fate was to end up buried under tons of rock, entombed forever by Leftenant Kai Allard, giving the Federated Commonwealth its first victory over the Clans.

This scenario pack recreates the battles for Twycross, with 15 BattleTech scenarios and 1 Battleforce scenario, following the Falcon Guards from their greatest success to their final stand."

User comment:

Unlike other scenario packs like the BattlePack: Fourth Succession War, this scenario pack predates the novel about the Jade Falcon campaign on Twycross, rather than being based on the novel.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Variable Player Powers

name: Bombers at War: The Battle of the Bismarck Sea
description:
Bombers at War: The Battle of the Bismarck Sea is a companion game to Airships at War, 3rd Edition.

The rules allow for the addition of WW2-era aircraft and naval vessels to the Airships at War world.

The game comes with 20 new phase cards, 16 new planes, 14 scenarios, and campaign rules.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Wargame, World War II

name: BattleTech Field Manual:   Warden Clans
description:
From the publisher's website:

Nearly three hundred years ago, the Star League was torn apart when the ambitious House Lords launched the Inner Sphere into endless war. The Great Father Aleksandr Kerensky led our forefathers, the remnants of the noble Star League army, away from that empty conflict. In turn, his son Nicholas forged us into the Clans: a society founded on unity, strength and skill. With each generation we evolved, awaiting the day when we would return to the Inner Sphere to save it from itself.

Now is the time of the Return. Some among the Clans insist that conquest of the Inner Sphere is the only Way, but we know that this path will only lead us into the chaos of the past. Our true mission is far more noble: we must act as the Wardens of the Inner Sphere until the time is right and humanity is truly reunited. Only then will the true Star League have returned to the Inner Sphere.

-- Ulric Kerensky, ilKhan of the Clans

The second of two volumes on the Clans, Field Manual: Warden Clans describes the Defenders of Kerensky's Vision: Clans Cloud Cobra, Coyote, Diamond Shark, Ghost Bear, Goliath Scorpion, Snow Raven and Steel Viper. This book describes the tactics, military doctrines and battle histories of each Clan, plus special rules that reflect the unique capabilities of each Galaxy, new weapons, equipment, exclusive Warden BattleMechs and more.

User comment:

Following up on earlier sourcebooks devoted to the Clans, this gives detail on all of those Clans identified as Warden Clans at the time of printing. Some of the Clans receive more attention than others, depending on how much detail was already in print via previous books. Along with the background detail on the Clans, the expansion also details new Battle Armour variants, a new OmniMech, a new weapon system and new Warships are all introduced in this expansion, although these items have largely been reprinted in later sourcebooks.

This book is a companion volume to the BattleTech Field Manual: Crusader Clans, and is currently out of print. The current license holder hasn't published this book as an electronic download as yet.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Variable Player Powers

name: ¡Uncle Cucuy's Lucha Libre!
description:
From the Front Cover:

¡The Dice Game of Mexican Wrestling!

For 1 or more players!
Play for hours, or just a few minutes!
Customize characters with your own one of a kind Luchador Mask designs!



User Summary:

A match is played between two or more characters who are defined by three attributes:

Strength that starts at two dice
Agility that starts at two dice
Stamina that starts at 12


A character also has an additional die that is placed in either Strength or Agility.

Each round, players choose to roll either their character's Strength or Agility, with the higher score winning, and the loser subtracting the difference from their Stamina. Rolling doubles explodes the dice (roll the doubles again and add to the previous roll). Any rolls of 6 automatically cause 1 point of damage to their opponent's Stamina.


If a round was won using Strength, any character reduced to zero or less Stamina loses and is out; if all characters have no Stamina, the match is a draw.
If a round was won using Agility, the winning character has pinned the losing character. Pinning a character for three consecutive rounds will cause that character to lose.


At the end of each match, players can increase their character's stats using Glory Points (1 GP is gained for each point scored in their rolls, and an additional 100 GP goes to the winner of a match). Buying an additional Strength or Agility die costs the current number of dice x 100 GP (each additional die bought also adds 5 Stamina).

There are additional rules for using teams, weapons, and stunning. The game includes a worked example, pre-made characters, and blank character cards.

name: 22 B.B.Y.
description:
22 B.B.Y. is a print and play game set during the Clone Wars in the Star Wars universe. Players take on the role of Jedis, who lead a crew of Clone Troopers and try to liberate Systems occupied by the Confederation of Independent Systems. Players roll standard six sided dice in attempts to defeat CIS troops, Bounty Hunters or to complete special missions.
The game was inspired by Risk Express by Reiner Knizia

name: 6 Days of War: The Arab-Israeli Conflict, 1967
description:
Six Days of War: The 1967 Arab-Israeli Conflict: May-June, 1967, depicts the conflict between Israel and the United Arab Republic. Players first conduct a series of card plays that determine both sides' war footing and diplomatic standing before the outbreak of hostilities.

Using the same design and scale as Paul Rohrbaugh's earlier game Operation Kadesh: The 1956 Arab-Israeli Conflict. Three maps are used to represent the 1967 Arab-Israeli war in the Golan Heights, the West Bank and the Sinai Peninsula. The events are simulated through Player cards that represent events that occurred or could have occurred prior to the war. Players can win in a number of ways in this challenging conflict simulation by Paul Rohrbaugh.

Game Scale:
Game Turn: 1 day
Hex: 10 miles / 16 kilometers
Units: Battalion to Brigade

Game Inventory:
Two 8.5x11" full color maps
One 11x17" full color map
Two single-side printed un-mounted countersheet (288 1/2" counters)(mounted counters are optional)
One 13-page rulebook
Five Player Aid Charts
Eight pages of 64 Event Cards

Player Provided: One 10-sided die

Solitaire Playability: Medium
Complexity Level: Low
Players: 2 or more
Playing Time: 1.5 to 2 hours

name: Dragons of Kir: Warlords
description:
The Warlords expansion for Dragons of Kir enables three or four players to play what was previously a two-player game. It includes 3-4p instructions, as well as the following wooden pieces:

4 wooden towers (1 for each player, each in a different color of wood) to act as "war tents"
4 wooden blocks with dragons wood-burned into them to act as the player pawns
1 wooden block with a dragon wood-burned into it, which acts as the start player token


The last war tent standing wins!

Additionally, three-player cutthroat rules are included.
publishers: Future Magic Games, One Eye Productions

name: Play the Sign
description:
In Play the Sign, players compete in teams or individually to be the first to rid their hand of cards. Each player starts with a randomly dealt hand of value cards and sign cards. On a turn, a player either discards a value or sign card that matches the card currently face-up on the pile or discards a number of cards for which the arithmetic calculation corresponds to the value of the face-up card.

Play the Sign can be played in single games or as a points tournament, with the player who collects the fewest points after the designated number of rounds winning the tournament.

name: Gensokyo ritual
description:
A set-collecting card game with auctioned turn order, based on characters and situations from Project Shrine Maiden, a series of amateur shooting games for Windows.

Gensokyo ritual comes in independent two-deck packages, which all can be played separately with 2–4 players or together with more players.

Players are dealt a number of "liquor" cards. Each turn, a number of character cards and event cards are drawn and revealed, and the turn order is auctioned out using these liquor cards. Players then gain one character card of their choice from the ones displayed and may also try to complete any of the face up event cards. The Event are the cards that are worth victory points, and in order to gain them, the player must discard the number of character cards mentioned on the event card.

As there never is any hand renewal of the liquor cards, they must be use wisely.

name: Anima Tactics: Aoi Inukai
description:
Publisher Blurb:

Regardless of her young age, Aoi is a formidable sorcerer, well versed in light magic. She loves human beings and desires to be able to live between them without the need to hide her true self. She works for Samael under the Fallen Angel Dinah, striving not only to accomplish her dream, but also to stop the dark schemes of radical Fallen Angels like Ophiel.

Mystic - Samael - Level 40

Spirtual Beam (Magic, Ranged Attack) - Distance (16 inch), +1 Attack / +3 Damage.

Moon Seal (Magic, Effect) - Discard two negative States counters of your choice affecting a single friendly unit inside Aoi's Control Zone.

Coral Ecstasy (Magic, Effect) - A friendly unit inside Aoi's Control Zone gains Lv1 Shield, Lv1 Healing, Lv1 Protection and Lev1 Haste. Aoi may not use Coral Ecstasy on herself.

Winds of Life (Magic, Effect) - Heals 2 Life poins of all friendly units inside Aoi's Control Zone.

This pewter figure is unpainted and unassembled. Requires additional Anima Tactics figures to play.

name: Fastscore Football
description:
From the publisher's website:

A perfect complement to Second Season Football for solo replay projects. FastScore Football allows the Replayer to quickly play out a whole day's schedule of games, including realistic scores, in just minutes!

It's a quick play game that generates the score of a football game with a few rolls of the dice. It incorporates ease of play, a simple ratings system and simple charts. Hundreds of simulated seasons are run, ensuring the accuracy of each Fastscore season while factoring in each team’s strength of schedule.

Although the ratings seem simple, there is a great deal of background information packed into each rating. This game uniquely takes into account the offensive and defensive styles of each team by separating scoring frequency and scoring ability. For example, some teams may score frequently, but fail to execute in the red zone- thus adding points to the board with field goals more frequently than touchdowns. Others may rarely score but efficiently march into the endzone- thus scoring more touchdowns than field goals. Additionally, offensive and defensive strengths in the running and passing game are reflected in the ratings and will influence the score of the game. For example, teams with strong defenses against the run will more effectively shut down teams that rely on the running game. And in close games, give your team a fighting chance by going for a 2-pt conversion!

With Fastscore football, teams will perform similarly to their real-life stats in points for and against, touchdowns for and against, field goals for and against, and most importantly, their win-loss record. These stats are fine-tuned to a 250-season average typically within 10 points of actual, and within 2 TDs and FGs of actual. Strength of schedule is factored into the ratings to ensure the utmost in accuracy.

And the best part: we’ve included the as-played schedule for each season! And we didn’t stop there- we know that your time is valuable, so we’ve calculated the final team ratings for each game on the schedule- taking into account home field advantage and the run/pass ratings- so you don’t have to do the calculations yourself. Just sit back, roll the dice and mark down the score of the game.

Fastscore Football is played using two differently colored 6-sided dice. Each team has seven ratings representing offensive and defensive abilities and a clutch rating. Better ratings are color coded in green while worse ratings are color coded in red. Higher offense ratings represent teams with punishing offenses. Lower defense ratings represent teams that effectively shut down their opponents.

If you play Fastscore as a stand-alone game, you can finish a season replay in a few hours! You can also use Fastscore Football as a complement to detailed, play by play games like Second Season Football. If you are enjoying a single team replay, play your favorite team’s games with your favorite football game while playing out the other games on the schedule with Fastscore, and see how your team is doing in the standings! A week’s worth of games can be completed in less than 15 minutes!

Fastscore offers great value for the gamer. Each Fastscore set includes multiple seasons for one low price! We intend to rate every season from current day to the seasons of yesteryear.

Each season includes:

Rules of the game
Scoring Charts
Team Ratings Chart
As-Played Schedule with pre-calculated game ratings for each team

name: Futab
description:
FUTAB is definitely a chess game. A game that will make you feel on the court, with all occurrences of a real game. You can experience the thrill of putting a scoring pass, connecting a center head, rally the contrary in their own area or win with a goal on the hour. I can define a tactical game and beat your rival.

FUTAB is a simulator of a soccer match. The objective is to defeat the opposing player throws the ball into the arch rival advancing through a series of boxes. To play you only need two dice and a "ball" (tab, coin, button, etc).

The board has represented the movements and plays more common in football and, through the roll of the dice and a good choice for best play, you can move forward on the grid court to reach the arch rival. The game is played to 90 dice throws.

FUTAB es definitivamente el ajedrez del fútbol. Un juego que te hará sentir dentro de la cancha, con todas las incidencias de un auténtico partido. Viví la adrenalina de meter un pase gol, conectar un centro de cabeza, pelotear al contrario en su propia área ó ganar con un gol sobre la hora. Definí una táctica de juego y vencé a tu rival.

FUTAB es un simulador de un partido de fútbol. El objetivo del mismo es vencer al jugador contrario introduciendo la pelota en el arco rival avanzando a través de una serie de casilleros. Para jugarlo solo se necesitan dos dados y una "pelota" (ficha, botón, etc).

El tablero tiene representados los movimientos y las jugadas más comunes en los partidos de fútbol y, a través del lanzamiento del dado y una buena elección de la jugada más conveniente, se puede ir avanzando en la cancha cuadriculada hasta alcanzar el arco rival. La partida se juega a 90 lanzamientos de dado.

name: Totentanz
description:
Just one more dance!
Every year the kindoms most powerful necromancers battle for rulership. So they send their undead minions around the deadly parcours of the central graveyard.
The necromancer, who has sorted all his minions in the right order in his crypt, wins the crown of suprmacy and is ruler of the guild of necromancers for one year.

Remember SORRY! from 1934? We pimped the board, switched the setting to competiting necromancers and set the playing pieces to 6 each (in order of power from 1 to 6: Slime, Skeleton, Zombie, Ghoul, Vampire, Lich). A bunch of magic spell and effect cards - and "Totentanz" (Dance Macabre) was born.

All the undead have a power rank and they can't beat each others like in SORRY!, because you can only hit another undead with the same or lower power rank.

The different power ranks of the undead are giving its necromancer different points for placing (in the right order) in the crypt. For example: the slime, which is the weakest creature (Power:1) has a value of 6 points when placed on its appropriate place in the crypt, while the lich (Power: 6) gives you only 1 point!

Join the clash of bones! Just hop on the "Chariot of Death" and run over your fellow undeads, use your Zombie to attack another necromancers skeleton with the "Flail of Stone" or let your lich cast "Vivisection" across the board to hinder your opponents vampire from entering the crypt. Always a favourite: "Break in the weather - Sunshine" cast on a vampire (got your vacuum cleaner ready?)
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Roll / Spin and Move

name: The Great Museum
description:
In The Great Museum, players take on the roles of the owners of the world's great museums. They vie with each other to build the best museum in the world by collecting artefacts: prehistoric, art, jewellery, statues, sarcophagi, inscriptions, weapons and pottery. These are collected in the Regional exhibition rooms of the museums and organised on the basis of the continent of origin.

In the course of the game you will also host Special Exhibitions such as 'The Relics of Peking Man' or 'the Lost Glory of Carthage' which will require collecting specific sets of exhibits. You also will be on the lookout for clues that will enable you to collect one or two main attractions for your museum – an artefact of global significance such as the Complete Works of Shakespeare or the Sword of Julius Caesar. (Clues can also help with expeditions.)

All of these activities bring your museum value to set it above the rest. In an effort to achieve victory you will fund expeditions around the world, competing with the other players as to which to support and to what extent. You will buy and sell artefacts on the world market, auction them off and you may be tempted to risk the black market. (Just don't get caught or it will look bad for your museum.) You will also invest in action cards which can give you the edge in various aspects of the game.

Four times in the game there is an Exhibition Phase. During this phase you calculate the score of your museum, which is gained from the stars on each tile you own in Regional Halls with bonuses for larger collections. Completed Special exhibitions (active and old) also contribute to your score as do some action cards and the Main Attractions. A museum score is used to calculate how much prestige your Museum gained from that Exhibition Phase as well as how much income it receives for the next turn.

The best managed museum will gain the most Prestige and will win the game. Will yours be the great museum?
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Set Collection, Tile Placement, Trading, Variable Phase Order

name: Pea Ridge: March 7th 1862
description:
(from wargamedownloads.com)
1862 Pea Ridge (American Civil War in 3D)

The fourth battle in our series of the American Civil Wargames in 3D sees the Union army under General Samuel R Curtis is entrenched just south of Pea Ridge, Arkansas. Curtis is unaware that a numerically superior Confederate army lead by General Earl Von Dorn is converging on his position.

The Confederates make a dawn strike from the north around Pea Ridge having spent two days outflanking the entrenchments of the Union army.

Pea Ridge initially has a time limit of 12 bounds in which the Confederates must achieve their objective. The game can be extended into a second day of conflict. Its design allows for a fast, fun and realistic game within a 2-3 hour period of continuous play. The game gives a flavour of the American Civil War period and a simple chain of command solution adds intrigue to the game, keep the chain of command together and everything is fine, lose it and it could cost you the game?

Combat is designed around the three factors that appear on the unit counters, these indicate the Range, Attack and Strength of the represented unit. You don’t even need any dice to play the game since a dice tile system is included with the game, but if you want to roll dice then it’s the simple six sided variety that you will require.

The game board is designed to be used either 2 dimensionally as a straight print and play or 3 dimensionally, this takes a little more time to construct but it is well worth the effort for the impressive game board you get at its completion. The final 3D game board gives you a realistic feel to the terrain and shows the tactical dispositions of all the game counters.
categories: American Civil War, Print & Play, Wargame

name: Glenn Drover's Empires: Ancient Empires
description:
Glenn Drover’s Empires: Ancient Empires utilizes the extremely successful Age of Empires III: The Age of Discovery game engine and takes it in a whole new direction. In Ancient Empires, players control one of the civilizations from the Roman era and vie for supremacy.

Among the elements new to Ancient Empires are agriculture, which determines a player’s number of citizens, and the military garrison, which allows players to re-deploy their troops. To be victorious in Ancient Empires, a player must plan well and yet be able to adapt to changing circumstances. It is time for a leader to emerge and become the supreme ruler of the Roman World.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Set Collection, Worker Placement

name: Anima Tactics: Alius, Holy Soldier
description:
Publisher Blurb:

The Holy Knights Alius, or the thirteen elementary lights, are devoted to fighting evil and darkness wherever they are present. Their vast powers, allowing them to wipe out darkness at will, are rightly feared by their enemies.

Warrior/Mystic - Light Summon - Level 35

Innate Abilities: Flight.

Sacred Charge (Ki, Charge) - +2 damage. Sacred Charge causes Throw.

Winged Hurricane (Ki, Effect) - All enemy units with a small sized base in Hand-to-hand combat with Alius are moved 2 inches. Alius's controller determines the direction of this movement like a Push.

Wall of Shields (Magic, Dodge) - +3 Defense. Alius gets +2 Armor until the end of the turn.

This pewter figure is unpainted and unassembled. Requires additional Anima Tactics figures to play.

name: Rapid Fire!: Campaign guide – D-Day, 6th June 1944
description: For first edition rapid fire! Covers the Allied and German forces that took part in the D Day landings. Also includes equipments stasts for the vehicles and heavy weapons used by both sides. Expands the game to include beach assaults and has special rules for landings and beach defences. This does not give pointed army lists but rather historical organisations.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: King's Crossing
description:
In King's Crossing, players try to navigate their King across the board to get the home space of the enemy king. The battle rages as men pieces jump one another and also freeze and trap lines of pieces that are capture later. Unable to retreat, pieces advance into an onslaught of exchanges and multicaptures.

This game is one in the Games on Half a Checkerboard Series.

Latest updated: Version 1.2 of the rules includes an alternate set up that is similar to that of Crossing Stonehenge, and a change in the win conditions.

Edit: Playable on Tabletopia in this collection:
https://tabletopia.com/games/alquerque-and-friends

name: Louis XVI
description: Louis XVI is a tafl style game in which players must try to help King Louis XVI escape from an angry mob. The king player receives one king piece and an army of 18. The mob player gets 26 pieces. Play is set on a star shape board. Captures are done by jumping adjacent enemy pieces and are compulsory. The mob wins if the king is captured and the king player wins by getting the king piece to any of the points of the star.

name: Chronicles of the Mind
description:
Break the ice and get talking with this outrageous collection of conversation starters. Or find out how well you really know your family and friends. Share your story, slip in a few fibs, and see how many people you can bamboozle!

This handy deck is perfect for parties, road trips, school, camp, or just hanging out with your friends. There are 4 different ways to play: The Chronicler, Kit & Caboodle, the Gamble, or Bamboozle! It's never the same game twice!

The Bamboozle
On your turn, pick up a card from the deck and without telling anyone else, choose to tell a true or false story. You must commit with your Voting Card whether the story is true or false before you tell it. After the story is told, all the other players guess whether the story is true or false with their Voting Card. Players receive a point if they answer correctly with the storyteller. If a player is incorrect, then the storyteller receives their points. First player to reach 20 points wins the game .

Contents:

119 Topic Cards
6 Voting Cards

name: Crazy A's
description:
Whizizzle Phonics is a fast-paced phonics game series that teaches the sounds of the English language. Designed by a dad and perfected by teachers, this series of phonics games keeps kids engaged in learning. Guided by the whimsical, yet brilliant Professor Whizinpiggle, a wise old pig who loves to read, kids learn phonics basics quickly and completely while they have fun.

Easier than memorization and more fun than flashcards, Whizizzle Phonics games help kids learn by using sight, sound and color.

They learn short vowel sounds in consonant-vowel-consonant words and long vowel sounds and silent ‘e’ words.
They combine consonant sounds to learn beginning or ending blends. Players begin with seven cards. To win, players must be first to discard their cards by matching like sounds.
Action cards ‘Change the Vowel’, ‘Leap Frog’, ‘Turn Around’ and ‘Draw One’ are also included in each deck.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Word Game

name: Battle of the River Plate
description:
Three Royal Navy cruisers encounter the German pocket battleship Admiral Graf Spee off the eastern coast of South America, December 13, 1939.

"Battle of the River Plate" is a realistic tactical wargame of WW2 ship vs. ship naval combat for two players. A Minden Games revised zip-lock edition of the Graf Spee wargame which appeared in Panzerschreck magazine #13. Provides new ship ratings, and introduces new rules and modifications congruent with the Battleship Captain standard game system.

Battleship Captain is a "miniatures" game system with scenarios played on the tabletop or floor, using the rules and ship counters provided. The game emphasizes playability, as players maneuver their ships and try and defeat the enemy fleet. Historical scenarios range in size from small (such as River Plate and Denmark Strait), which have only four or five ships to large (such as Tsushima and Jutland), which involve dozens of ships.

The game also requires tape measure or ruler in inches, paper and pencil, and a six-sided die.

--from the published game and the Minden Games web site

name: Pocket Monsters Family Pom Jong
description:
Pokemon Pom Jong the new game with a 5000 year old tradition.

Pom Jong is a game derived from its similarities to Gin Rummy and Mah Jongg.

Pom Jong characters are easier to learn than Mah Jongg characters, and the rules of the game are simpler.

As with Mah Jongg, the game of Pom Jong has its roots in China and is comprised of 81 plastic tiles of different suits and symbols showing your favorite Pokemon characters!

The tiles are collected and discarded by players one by one as they try to build sets, much like Gin Rummy, until one of the players acquires a winning hand.

Players may join or leave at the beginning or end of any hand.

Pom Jong is a fast and exciting game than can be played between 4 players and appeals to all ages.

It can be a family game, a teen game, an adult game, or solitary pastime.

This is a family game to be played by old & young alike!
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Set Collection

name: Road Course Deck
description: Track deck representing stock car racing on a road course. Expands Stock Car Championship Racing Card Game as the 4th track deck available.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Racing, Sports

name: Tri-Oval Track Deck
description: Track deck representing stock car racing on a Superspeedway size Tri=Oval. Expands Stock Car Championship Racing Card Game as the 5th track deck available.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Racing, Sports

name: Road to the Capital
description:
Destroy the Capital to Win
1943, during World War II.
Leading your army, you must capture opponent nation destroying the its Capital city.
Do not let the enemy come on over your city.

Rules
Each player plays with a pack of cards “Nation” (50 cards), made up by Vehicles, Cities, Fortuity etc.
The game consists of rounds in which one player attacks and another one defends. At each turn, the player draws a card (unless otherwise noted) and he can put at stake more cards or none of them.
Each player begins with the pack of cards on deck and only with the Capital card is disclosed and at stake.

There are 7 types of cards: Cities, Vehicles, Aircrafts, Soldiers, Tactics, Fortuity and Equipments:

Cities: They are useful to produce troops and make them attack. Capital is the main town and if it is defeated, the game is lost.
Vehicles: They are battleship troops and they attack other terrestrial troops or, in the case of anti-aircraft, also aircrafts.
Aircrafts: They can attack and defend the terrestrial vehicles without suffering any damage (except for the anti-aircraft) or they can attack other aircrafts or, if there are no aircraft opponents (or antiaircraft), directly the cities.
Soldiers: They are pedestrian troops and they attack other pedestrian troops, or in the case of anti-aircraft, also aircrafts. They can be more powerful thanks to the equipment cards.
Tactics: These are special cards with specific powers and they expire in one round.
Fortuity: This card must be played in the right moment they are drawn and it damages the player himself. They expired in one round.
Equipments: These cards enhance the soldier cards. At most one equipment for each Soldier Card. They expire when its pertinent Soldier dies and they can’t be reallocated.

name: 2+1 Basketball Showtime
description:
2+1: Basketball Showtime is a card game that emulates a basketball game between two teams. Each player, who from now on will be known as coach, has a deck of 35 cards. The objective of the game is clear: to win by scoring more points than the opposite team, during the four periods which the game is divided.

Each player gets 3 cards placing them on their attack or defense side. To each card played the opponent needs try to counter. Two pointers, Out of the Perimeter three point’s shots, Dunks…

Information: Age: 8+ | Playing time: -30’ | Number of players: 2| Languages: Spanish/English | Language dependence: No necessary in-game text

2+1 Basketball showtime became finalist at the 3rd edition of the Feria JugarXJugar of Granollers and 3rd price at the 1st Edition Imprimir y Jugar of Jugando en Pareja.

name: Puppet Wars: Pawns 3
description: Puppet Wars: Pawns 3 is a booster pack for the Puppet Wars base game that consists of eight new Pawns – Austringer, Nurse, Punk Zombie, Ice Golem, December Acolyte, Silurid, Hog Whisperer and Piglet – that can be mixed with the figures from the base game or the Multiplayer Expansion.

name: Trivial Pursuit: Essen & Trinken
description: 100 question cards that expands Trivial Pursuit

name: March Attack: Napoleonic Wargame Rules
description:
From their website:

Napoleonic Wargames Rules.

March Attack are presented as an 80 page A4, full colour, perfect bound book. The rules are designed to allow players to fight large battles with battalion sized units in a reasonable amount of time.

Command and control, orders and morale for large formations are combined with easy to learn tactical game mechanics so that battles of a Corps or more a side
can easily be fought by a few players during an evening. Each unit on the table represents a battalion of infantry, regiment of cavalry or battery of artillery.

A ground scale of 1" to 60 yards, one turn representing 20 minutes and fast paced strategic movement rules mean that battles play out at a realistic rate. Combat is dealt with in a manner that allows large numbers of units to be fielded and the interaction between strategic movement and tactical combat allows for a fast paced game that keeps a good level of detail.

Seven different training and morale levels combined with the historical strength of a unit introduces the concept of ‘Combat Value’. This ties together all of the tactical rules and ensures that troop quality, more than just luck or buckets of dice, plays an important part in every battle.

name: Sea of Dragons: Data Annexes – Ships, Aircraft, & Weapons
description:
Publisher Blurb:

Whenin this volume are the various Harpoon data annexes, containing new data pertinent to the Pacific Rim countries covered in the background & scenario booklet. Annexes C-M provide statistics for weapons and sensors not listed in Harpoon, as well as some systems added to the system since the original rules set was published, and some errata.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Modern Warfare, Nautical, Wargame

name: Gzhatsk 20
description:
Presenting an expansion kit to Borodino 20, Gzhatsk 20 is a hypothetical battle that should have occurred in early September 1812 (in lieu of the Battle of Borodino) during Napoleon’s Russian campaign. One player commands the French army of Napoleon, while the other leads the Anti-French forces consisting of the Russian armies that are making a desperate stand before the Gates of Moscow in an attempt to turn back the invaders.

Note, Gzhatsk 20 is not a ‘stand alone’ game. You must own a copy of Borodino 20 to use this expansion kit.

Game Data:

Complexity: 4 on a 9 scale.
Solitaire Suitability: 5 on a 9 scale.
Scale: Each unit is 1 corps, each hex is about 1000 meters, and each turn is roughly 3.5 day hours (or 10 night hours).

Game Components:

• One 2-page sheet of Exclusive Rules
• 12 Random Event cards
• One 11” x 17” color game map

name: Blitzkrieg Undone: The Battle of Hannut
description:
Blitzkrieg Undone: The Battle of Hannut: May 12-13, 1940, is a low complexity level game of the battle between the Allied Armed forces and Germany's Wehrmacht on May 12th and 13th, 1940 at Hannut, Belgium (near Gembloux). Hannut was the largest tank battle to yet occur during the Second World War. The Germans launched Operation Yellow, the invasion of France and the Low Countries, on May 10, 1940. The Allies anticipated the Germans would strike through neutral Belgium as they had in WWI, and planned on confronting them there on the Belgian plain. The first large scale encounter occurred at Hannut, not far from the famous battlefields of Ramillies and Waterloo. Here the 1st and 2nd French Light Mechanized Divisions, heavily armed with tanks, ran into the 3rd and 4th Panzer Divisions.

The players, taking on the roles of the commander of the 1st French Army and German Army Group B during the Battle for Belgium. The French, thinking that this was the main German effort, committed their most modern divisions to this battle. For the Germans, this was a feint to tie down the French (and destroy their best units) while Army Group A raced through the Ardennes to the English Channel, to encircle the best Allied Armies. Tactically, the French were successful at Hannut. Strategically, the Germans accomplished their goal of "soaking off" the French armor away from the main effort through the Ardennes, however the French 1st Army survived the campaign and was later instrumental in protecting the Dunkirk pocket, allowing hundreds of thousands of English and French troops to evacuate to England.

This is the sixth game in the Blitzkrieg in the West Series from High Flying Dice Games

Game Scale:
Game Turn: 1.5 hours
Hex: 1 miles / 1.61 kilometer
Units: Company

Game Inventory:
One 11x17" full color map (in 2 parts)
One single-side printed un-mounted countersheet (200 1/2" counters)(mounted counters are optional)
One 8-page rulebook
One Player aid Charts (TEC/CRT)

Solitaire Playability: Medium
Complexity Level: Low
Players: 2 or more
Playing Time: 1.5 to 2 hours

name: Deathmatch
description:
Deathmatch is a fast and tactical wargame for 1-4 players, which is based on different video game shooters. Each player takes the role of a group of soldiers who are fighting in a arena for victory.

Deathmatch uses only cards and some markers for the characters. The different card types are:

- Character Cards:
Every character in the game is represented by a Character Card, which contains all necessary information (e.g. Attack-, Defense-Value, Action Points, Portage Capacity and their Special Abilities). Each Character Card has a normal and a wounded side.

- Equipment Cards:
Equipment Cards represented the different equipment in the game, like a M16, a PSG-1 or a Bulletproof Vest. Characters can be equipped with Equipment Cards, to increase their fight or defense ability. The equipment cards also serve as dice rolls. Each card has a Fate Number printed on it, which is between 0 and 5. In Combat you can play an Equipment Card from your hand to boost your Attack- or Defense-Value and then you always adds the Fate Number from top card of your Equipment Deck to determine the outcome of this action. Equipped Cards are no longer in your Equipment Deck and so their Fate Numbers are no longer in the dice pool. If your characters have good equipment, than the player will have fewer good Fate Numbers in his Deck. So each player has to find the right balance between right equipment and the remaining Fate Numbers in his deck.

- Terrain Cards:
A Terrain Card represents a part of the arena, where the characters compete against each other. Every card is divided in 6 (3x2) squares and has a different setup of covers and obstacles, like Metal Walls and Mud Pits.

- Scenario Cards:
Each Scenario Card represents a game mode, like Deathmatch, Capture the Flag or Domination. All necessary information is given on these cards. This includes information such as the special rules, the way to lay out the Terrain Cards to create the arena or the Winning Conditions.

- Marker Cards:
The Marker Cards represent the characters, special markers or items for the different scenarios. Before the first play, the players have to cut out the markers to use them.
categories: Card Game, Fighting, Mature / Adult, Modern Warfare, Print & Play, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Modular Board, Open Drafting, Point to Point Movement

name: Fire & Water
description:
Fire and Water, the raging elements, play the main roles in this clever tactical game for 2 to 4 players. Who will get the upper hand? With the unrestrained strength of the elements on one hand, and with the help of the tender elementals on the other, a clever player will direct the outcome of the struggle of the elements and become the Master of the Elements...

Each turn, players have to decide whether to increase their influence by placing an appropriate marker or to secure their square by placing a possession token. But then, there are the elementals who can't be conquered with pure strength...

The player who can place all his possession tokens wins the game.

This game was released as a PnP game on October 26th 2011, the author's 38th birthday.

This game came in the final round (i.e. Top 12) of the Hippodice contest 2012.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Chit-Pull System, Enclosure, Tile Placement

name: Meine ersten Spiele: Würfelwichtel
description:
There are six elements in the center of the table - 2 caps, 2 bodies and 2 pair of feet. The eight cards are placed in a pile on one side, face down. The nine chips are placed another side: they form the reserve.

The first player to win three rounds wins.

Cards are shuffled and dealt out one to three players, who do not watch them. Players turn them face-up together and try to find which element of elf must catch to win the race.
Two cases may arise:
- If the three elves have one thing in common is that element that must be caught.
- If no element is common to all three elfs appear, then there are three common each in two elves. Two of these elements are present on the same two cards. Then this is the third element that must be caught.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Pattern Recognition, Set Collection, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Dezign Pak 6
description:
A scenario pack of 12 scenarios. From the publisher:
