Man's Best Friend: Canine Remains can mass companion under a couple of circumstances but you will have to judge for yourself whether or not it is worthwhile to do so. Will it leave you in a bad position for counter attack? Will a mass companion allow you to grab an objective or tie up important models from the other crew? As it stands at the moment either Mortimer or Sebastian activate and either use (0) Zombie Companion or (0) Here Boy!. Where this gets fun is that each dog then activates in sequence and only has to be within 6" of the Canine that activated before it, so it is possible to setup a whole lot of different approach angles and not have to be clustered all in one place.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Horror, Miniatures

name: The Reliquary Collection
description:
The Reliquary Collection is a boxed set of 12 ancient games from all over the world with origins date between 5000 BCE to 1200 CE.

From website:
"Each one features a classic play style that is original and doesn't rely on marketing images to be fun. The collection is varied enough to provide a favorite for everyone and each game is conveniently packaged in a truly unique way.

All of the games in the Reliquary Collection are family friendly, non-violent, and suitable for all ages (there is a choking hazard for very young children). While there is a suggested age for each game, anyone can enjoy them so long as they understand the rules. Most of the Reliquary Collection games involve new ways to stretch your mind and challenge your strategic prowess, making them great educational tools as well as being extremely fun for everyone!"

An anthology of gaming from early civilization to the middle ages.

name: Zombies at the door
description:
ZOMBIES AT THE DOOR

“Zombies at the door” is a zombie apocalypse card/table-top game for one to two players.
ZATD is a CARD ONLY GAME with no dice yet you will use your cards as playing elements on the game table for movement, searching, and attacks.

Players take turns searching throughout their neighborhood for survivors, supplies, and weapons then try to make it back to their safe house alive; all the while zombies are everywhere trying to eat them.

Goal: Search [4] houses in the neighborhood and find as many survivors as possible. Along the way you will fight or flee from zombies at every corner; they will be scattered throughout the neighborhood, inside homes and they’re constantly multiplying. You will search for supplies and weapons to help you along the way and rescue survivors who need your help to stay alive.

Once a house is reached, it must be search room-by-room but watch out a zombie could be lurking behind any door! After all rooms have been searched gather any survivors and head outside but be careful; zombies could be waiting for you.
Always remember that your opponent is out there ready to sabotage your progress, draw zombies to your location, pick up supplies that you’ve dropped, and rescue survivors you’ve left behind.

Winning conditions: The first player to search and clear [4] houses and return back to his own Safe House with the most survivors alive wins OR if both players have turned into zombies the one with the most survivors inside his Safe House wins.

Losing conditions: Unfortunately there is no hope for anyone who dies in Zombies at the door. With unknown virus spreading throughout the world everyone has been infected and once you die you turn into the living dead. So, lose your life points and it’s off to the zombie brotherhood for you! Once you become a zombie, you now control a special zombie player card and try to attack and eat your fellow player! You are also in control of all the zombie movements and attacks until the other player wins or is turned into a zombie, which ends the game.

ALL FILES CAN BE FOUND IN THE WEBLINKS SECTION!!!!
mechanics: Area Movement, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Open Drafting

name: Dungeon Realms
description:
Dungeon Realms is nothing that is a card game for 2 players using deck-building mechanics in conjunction with the placement of workers, among others.

In Dungeon Realms, you play the role of an adventurer, inexperienced and novice of his hometown, eager challenges and adventures. Gradually, as the protagonist of the story, you have to explore (and plunder) with courage and bravery the region, facing many dangers and unimaginable adventures, thus gaining experience, reputation and social status and progress level.

Revive with courage, vigor and courage all the excitement of the adventures of an adventurer, palace intrigue and danger firsthand, and first-person protagonist of the adventures of an adventurer, bizarre, drunken and quarrelsome, in an exciting fantasy medieval district where they meet and are home to a multitude of stories, legends and fantastic tales.

Defy fate reaching for his sword, looking great treasures, and thieves' loot evil creatures, make the most powerful collection of magic items, descended into hell, look ultratumbas in ancient underground cities, check city distant dwarf king Aquilón , conspires palace, enjoyed in the company of your own Stag Tavern in between quarrels, hookahs and spicy wine bottles, performs missions for the king or for the thieves guild, save princesses and kill dragons. Only fame or death awaits.

You are a adventurer who tries to gather enough money and experience to become the next champion of the mark. Of course, you depend on the work of others to get the needed experience. You start with a set of 9 cards (6 of them are money, which give you 1 gold coin each and 3 cards to get 1 experience points (PXs)). Each round you draw 5 cards from your deck and use one card for the turn order to place your workers (adventurers marks). The workers go to the different building places in the Village to buy new cards for you (go and solve adventure), get experience or different other actions. Each turn there is one more space, where you can place your workers.

Also there is a Line of Events with 6 cards (quest and events representing), which you can choose to buy and each round the empty places in this row are filled from a deck of cards divided into 3 different "Ages" (the last two ages cost more gold coins).

The game ends in different ways: when a player reaches 100 px, or one player kills two dragons, or when no cards sufficient to fill the Line of Events.
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Phase Order, Worker Placement

name: Multiplodingo
description:
Multiplodingo is a set of 7 educational games focusing on multiplication and similar mathematical concepts, using a single set of cards comprised of numbers and mathematical symbols.

Games are simple and include a combination of new games and derivations of well-known existing card games (such as Rummy and Poker), each with a focus on teaching and reinforcing multiplication skills. Each game is short and simple, with a single page of rules dedicated to each. Additional variants are provided for several games as well.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Math
mechanics: Hand Management, Memory, Variable Player Powers

name: RODAC
description:
A game of matching cards and dice for up to 4 Players. RODAC has three different styles of play: RODAC Standard Game, RODAC Baby Dac (for beginners), and solitaire game rules.

From the main deck players draw cards, on players turn they roll dice and try matching them to the cards in hand. If they make a match the other players are allowed to react by playing Cards from their hands that can: Gain points, Lose points, Roll Dice over, or even have the player end their turn without scoring.

The goal of the game is to reach 150 points on your turn while keeping your opponents from reaching the same goal.

Posting by game publisher Penned Dragon Games and Publishing

name: Zen Garden
description:
Zen Garden is a handmade, limited edition boardgame using 10mm miniatures to simulate a battle between two squads of Samurai in a snow-covered garden.

The board is a small zen garden upon which miniatures are moved with the help of movement sticks (to determine ranges and movement) and dice.

An activation system similar to the one found in other games by Ganesha Games (such as Song of Blades and Heroes) makes sure that the turn length and the number of actions performed by every model varies.

Each differently armed samurai has a card detailing the warrior's combat skill with various weapons and the amount of protection offered by his armor. The card is flipped when the samurai is wounded, showing reduced values on the back.

The game was designed by Massimo Moscarelli and sold exclusively online and at conventions. The rulebook is in Italian but an English translation is available as a free download on the ganesha games website.
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Phase Order

name: G.I. Joe: Battle for DC
description:
The date is December 8, 1987. Ronald Reagan and Mikhail Gorbachev are set to sign the Intermediate-Range Nuclear Forces Treaty. The Cold War is fast thawing and only one organization can prevent it: COBRA. These terrorists have launched a massed attack aimed at crippling both the USA and USSR and making sure the Cold War continues. To achieve this, they have attacked Washington D.C. and captured Reagan. Gobachev would have been captured, but G. I. Joe, having received a last minute warning, has deployed. Now in the streets of America’s capital the Joes must save the day.

G.I. Joe: Battle for DC combines aspects of Battle Line and Batman: Poker gegen Joker. Players battle over locations in Washington DC by laying down cards representing various characters from the G.I. Joe universe. Each has a numerical rating from one to 12 and a color suit, allowing for card combinations that will aid you in the battle for DC. In addition, the Joes must protect Gorbachev and rescue Reagan. There are also special cards which can alter the battle and a naval control aspect that allows players to draw an extra card if they control the Potomac River.

name: Stop-Over Kiel
description:
The game consists of two sub-games.
In the first game players take the role of journalists and try to get to the sat-van as quick as possible in order to upload the three pictures they have to capture in this game. The pictures are all Kiel-buildings or sites and have a UFO sighting on them.
This is a Malefiz kind of adaptation.

In the second part the game (backside of the board) journalists try to get the cover-story (word-guessing approach) before other players can beat them by running up the stairs of the publisher's office first.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Le Docte Rat Junior
description:
The race is open to graduate. Go the way of the wise Apprentices and try to get the points that will allow you to enter the University Bright Young. To get points, you must answer the questions correctly.

Be the first player (or first team) to finish university and get the enviable title of Junior Docte Rat.

There are four question categories: Petite Colle (Little Poser) the easy one where the questions are worth 5 points, Bon Mot (Good Word) the vocabulary category that can give you 5 or 10 points, Érudition contains harder questions worth 10 points and, finally, Mini-Test where questions are usually divided into three sub-questions totalling 15 points.

The object of the game is to be the first to finish the two board stages. You have to collect 40 points to finish the first part. Starting again from scratch, you need 80 points to complete the second level and win the game.

Players take turn rolling die to move their pawn and see what question category they will get.

name: Donald Featherstone's Wargamer's Handbook Of The American War Of Independence Wargaming 1775-1783
description:
From the back cover:

"A guide to the men, the weapons, the battles, and campaigns and how to re-fight them in miniature. The American War of Revolution 1775-1783 is a war of battles bearing colourful names, most of them ideally suited for re-fighting on table-top battlefields. The skilful general can triumphantly turn historical defeats into victories. This book tells the wargamer how to don the mantle of Washington and lead American Armies against British regulars to display greater tactical genius than Burgoyne and Cornwallis. After outlining the historical course of the war, the soldiers of both sides and their styles of fighting are described and commanders evaluated. This means re-fighting the major battles as wargames are explained, with maps of the battlefields transformed into table-top terrains. Hints on formulating rules include two complete sets that authentically simulate warfare of the period. A new chapter, with a previously unpublished set of rules by Donald Featherstone, is included in this edition."
categories: American Revolutionary War, Book, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Cholopoly
description:
Cholopoly is a game based on our funny experiences in Peru. Each player will be a car driver. And will be driving through many dangerous streets of Peru in Lima.

You can buy business, escape from thieves, and bribing corrupt police. Face events like inflation, terrorism, mining company strikes, and supports corruption and become the richest one among all players.

There is no place for fair play. Destroy the other businesses, hire thieves and corrupt cops, to steal and bribe the other players. Appropriate business and foreign characters, accumulate dirty money and become a millionaire, and lose it all from one turn to another.

Do not misunderstand; this is only taken with mockery, you just have a good time with your friends

Cholopoly wishes you a fun and unproductive game.

Cholopoly: Rie, Jode..., Juega


(Spanish version)Cholopoly es un juego basado en nuestra criollada peruana. Cada jugador será un conductor, manejando por las peligrosas calles de lima en Peru. Comprando negocios, escapando de ladrones, y sobornando policias corruptos. Afronta eventos como inflación, terrorismo, huelgas mineras, y soporta casos de corrupción, e intenta volverte el más rico entre todos los jugadores.

No hay lugar para el juego limpio. Destruye los negocios de otros, contrata ladrones y policías corruptos, para que roben y sobornen a los otros jugadores.

Aprópiate de los negocios y personajes ajenos, acumula dinero corrupto. Conviértete en millonario, y piérdelo todo de un turno a otro.

No malinterpreten, esto es solo tomar con burla algunas situaciones. Y pasar un buen tiempo con tus amigos

Cholopoly les desea un entretenido e improductivo juego.

Cholopoly

Rie, Jode..., Juega
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Trading, Trick-taking

name: Shattered Throne
description:
Shattered Throne is the first expansion to the Planet Masters dicegame. This optional set of rules explains how to use the new dice.

Three new alien races with special abilities are available to the players. A new central planet is added to the dice pool and players can now invest in technology advances.

Background story:
The central government on Solium Sphaera has fallen. The planet is in turmoil. Social unrest divides the galaxy. The all consuming technology race between the empires has shattered the symbolic throne. Rivalry between the empires has never been this tense. Fleet sizes are rising. The amount of weapons is growing. The empire with the most advanced technological knowledge will seize control of the central megaplanet Solium Sphaera. He who controls Solium Sphaera reigns the universe.

name: Bywater's War: The United States Battles Japan for Control of the Pacific 1926-1940
description:
From the publisher's website:

In the late 1920s, naval analyst and former spy Hector C. Bywater wrote what today would be called a "techno-thriller." His novel described a hypothetical conflict between Japan and the USA, set in his near future, 1931. His background in naval tactics, ship design, and history made him the perfect choice to write the story, and it proved to be wildly popular. In addition to being well-written and exciting, he described many advances in naval technology, such as the rise of naval aviation. But his story was also rooted in the past (including the use of poison gas), and concluded with a Jutland-style clash between the two great fleets.

Designer Bob Eldridge has transformed Bywater's novel into a gaming supplement of 30 scenarios for Command at Sea. Ship statistics include not only real-world units like the pre-war US and Japanese battleships, but also the ships that Mr. Bywater created for his story - the Alaska-class aircraft carriers and the Nagasaki-class supersubmarine. In addition he has included scenarios for another three campaigns, each determined by different historical events in 1926, 1932, and 1939. These also feature a mix of real-world and hypothetical units, like the US Lexington class, which were planned as battlecruisers until the Washington Naval Treaty.

Contents:

- 128-page booklet including 30 scenarios and stats, grouped in four separate campaigns.
- Two counter sheets of historical, hypothetical, and fictional units.


Not included but needed for play: Command at Sea 4th Edition Rules.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Nautical, Wargame, World War II
publishers: Admiralty Trilogy Group, Clash of Arms Games

name: Optimum
description: Optimum is a board game published by the christin youth organisation Svenska Kyrkans Unga in the Evangelical Lutheran Church of Sweden. The game is about sustainable development and environmental impact. The game is card driven, and by certain cards the players can produce, investing in human rights, reduce the greenhouse effect or acquire political influence. In the game you have to design your in-game society as optimally as possible so that you can win the game.

name: Ultimate Warriorz: Cris de Guerre
description:
Mini expansion given with Plato magazine 41 (november 2011)

This mini expansion consists of of a folded rule sheet introducing a variant: each character has a war cry he must scream it for a stronger attack.
categories: Card Game, Dice, Fantasy, Fighting, Humor
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: Labyrinth Life: The Maze of Being You
description:
"Life is a maze—an infinite maze—that shifts with the will of its inhabitants. You are an explorer of this labyrinthine realm, trying on roles and pioneering foreign terrain, aiding friends and outsmarting rivals. To shape the world and find your place in it means drawing on powers you never knew you had in the hopes of one day reaching your goal, the one prize that can't be found around any of the labyrinth's dizzying twists and bends: the real you."


An Awesome Game


Labyrinth Life is a tabletop strategy card game for 2-6 players, ages 12 and up. It's fast to learn, and fun to master.

In Labyrinth Life, you play an explorer who braves an ever-changing maze in search of your future self. Will you be the first to reach bliss as perhaps the Richest Woman in New Mazonia or perhaps the Hallball Team Captain? It's all up to you!

Over the course of the game, players build a maze of hexagonal cards and they move their maze explorers through it.

Every round, you move more maze explorer forward 5 spaces, draw a card, and play a card. You play a card by placing it in the maze and using one of the two powers listed on it.

The sixteen powers allow you to affect the maze and the explorers within it. It's possible to chain multiple powers and plan elaborate strategies over multiple turns.

Strategies center around moving your explorer into cards related to your goal card, and keeping other players from moving their explorers into cards related to theirs. You gain two points for moving your explorer into cards that share a power with your goal card and you lose one point for every card you move into that isn't related. Goals can change.

You win the game by reaching the target point total.


A Work of Art


Each deck of Labyrinth Life is different. The cast of characters, constellations of maze paths, and the solitaire maze that spans the back of your 120-card deck are absolutely unique, and offer an entirely different play experience from every other deck out there.


The Ultimate Collaboration


Early supporters of Labyrinth Life suggest and vote on the characters that will populate the maze. Each deck is a unique culture built from the the pool the fans create.
categories: Card Game, Exploration, Humor, Maze, Print & Play
mechanics: Modular Board, Network and Route Building, Team-Based Game, Tile Placement, Variable Player Powers

name: Macht
description:
Macht is a Trivia game for 2-4 players. It can also be played in teams. The game best suits adults who are interested in knowledge and reflection.

Players build their own power pyramid from trianular bricks by correctly answering themed questions. Not until you have the competance to answer correctly do your bricks come into play. Use your insight or blind power; you can co-oporate, develop or duel in battles of posistion as you develop your pyramid.

name: Heavy Gear Blitz! Perfect Storm: NuCoal Field Guide
description:
From the publisher:
The Perfect Storm NuCoal Field Guide contains complete army lists for the NuCoal Self Defense Force and the Port Arthur Korps. It also continues the story of the the War for Terra Nova and is the first in a series of Field Guides for the factions in the Heavy Gear Universe.


Blitz Army Lists for NuCoal and Port Arthur
Background on NuCoal and Port Arthur
Details on the Military Organization
Vehicle Compendium
Duelist and Ace Pilot Support
The Siege of Temple Heights
Painting Guide & Gallery
Datacards


This Full Color, 136-page book is a Field Guide (Faction Army List) for the Heavy Gear Blitz! miniature game. In addition to the core rulebook, some six sided dice, and Dream Pod 9 Heavy Gear miniatures are required for play. For two or more players, ages 8 and up.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: 召喚師戰爭: 沙地哥布林派系套牌
description:
[English]
This is the Summoner Wars: Sand Goblins Faction Deck, in Chinese version. The content is the same as the Sand Goblins starter faction in the English Master Set. It expands the Summon Wars with more a new choice of faction. Remark: Faction decks in the Chinese version are published as separate products.

召喚師戰爭中你扮演一個召喚師的角色。你被召喚之石賦
予呼喚強大勇士和施展強力法術的能力，以在你與一個敵對
的召喚師的戰鬥中幫助你。遊戲的目的是摧毀你對手的召喚師
卡。當你是遊戲中唯一擁有召喚師卡在場中的玩家時，你就勝
出了。

沙地哥布林派系套牌
1 庫魯斯克- 召喚師
1 噬咬者- 捍衛者
1 淤泥- 捍衛者
1 客里普- 捍衛者
7 食腐者- 普通兵
6 擲矛兵- 普通兵
5 薩滿- 普通兵
3 蹲下掩護- 事件
3 嘲諷- 事件
2 閃亮- 事件
1 海市蜃樓- 事件
3 牆壁卡
1 召喚師參考卡
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Ameritrash
description:
In the far distant future, the world is recovering from global devastation brought on by both nuclear and biological warfare. The area occupied by the former United States of America is one of the first land areas to experience a rebirth of civilization. Old technology is salvaged and relearned. Eight distinct regions emerge, each with its own ideals, but all predicated on peace. No one wants to repeat the mistakes of the past. Almost no one…

Over time, four Overlords emerge. Vying for wealth and power, each establishes his own ragtag army. Slowly, their minions spread throughout the eight habitable regions. Death and destruction follow in their wake as each faction battles the other for land, fuel, wealth, and power. Which will triumph over the others, bringing a final, lasting peace to the land? Only time and Thompson machine guns will tell.

The boardgame Ameritrash, like its namesake gaming genre, is an exciting, tension-filled game, rich in theme, filled with player conflict, and possessing a large amount of dice! Two to four players assume the role of an Overlord of a military faction intent on securing as much plunder and power as possible. During the span of five turns, players move their ramshackle units across the gameboard, attempting to capture objectives, pillage wealth, and weaken enemy factions.

Quick to learn and fun to play, Ameritrash is game of low to moderate complexity, and heavy firepower.
mechanics: Area Movement, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling

name: Polar Base Goodies
description:
A set of 9 character cards to spice up gameplay by adding 9 more characters to pick from. Key members of the French-speaking board games industry posed for the artwork.

The addition opens up game-play as they are new characters with new personalities, and this will alter potential role-play and storytelling.

These promo cards were available for pre-orders or at Essen 2012 fair.

name: ApocalypZe Card Game: Surge Promo
description:
Surge is a promotional card and can be used with the ApocalypZe Card Game base set.
This card was given out at PAX East - Boston, March 22-24, 2013
(Boston Convention & Exhibition Center)

Text on card:
Surge
"I got one!" "Good! Now get the other fifty"

If you have a horde in play, draw 4 cards.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Horror, Zombies
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Player Elimination

name: ApocalypZe Card Game: Biker/Zombie Promo
description:
Biker/Zombie is a promotional card and can be used with the ApocalypZe Card Game.
This card was given out at PAX East - Boston, March 22-24, 2013
(Boston Convention & Exhibition Center)

Text on card:
Biker
Attack 2
Defense 2
Value 1

Zombie
Attack 1
Defense 1
Value 1
When removed recycle.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Horror, Zombies
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Player Elimination

name: ApocalypZe Card Game: Patsy McNally Promo
description:
Patsy McNally is a promotional card and can be used with the ApocalypZe Card Game base set.
This card was given out at PAX East - Boston, March 22-24, 2013
(Boston Convention & Exhibition Center)

Text on card:
Patsy McNally
Guilty over the fate of her family, Patsy takes on het apocalypZe with a singular taste for vengeance.
Attack 1
Defense 3
Value 5

When played, may attach Patsy's Pistols from deck.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Horror, Zombies
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Player Elimination

name: ApocalypZe Card Game: Church Promo
description:
Church is a promotional card and can be used with the ApocalypZe Card Game base set.
This card was given out at PAX East - Boston, March 22-24, 2013
(Boston Convention & Exhibition Center)

Text on card:
Church
Some feel that prayer is enough protection most like a bit more insurance.
Access 4
Capacity 8
Damage 3

Once per game, may play 1 human here from your deck. While there are human here, consume 1 less resource during your consumption phase.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Horror, Zombies
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Player Elimination

name: Allegrando
description:
A set of flash cards containing music theory elements ( notes in different clefs, key signatures, notes of different values , etc. etc.) published in the late 19th century whose instructions contain 10 different games of different types.

Four of the more distinctive games in the instructions are :

-- A simple drawing/drafting game where a player keeps drawing cards from the stock until they match the time value ( eighth rest, 16th rest, half note, etc.) of an initial top card. After an initial go-round players match the initial value with a card from their hand if possible, if not they resume the drawing process. First player out of cards wins.

-- A variant of this game where after all the cards are drawn, players form " melds' of a whole note's value ( 4 beats) and these are ( two variants) then scored Rummy-style or game is played until someone has eight melds.

--A forerunner of climbing-to-X-number sorts of games ( O No 99, Zeus on the Loose, et al.) where players play cards of rests and notes to get up to a whole note's value of 4 beats.

--A children's game with a pre-Knizia type of interesting scoring.. all cards are given out to all players-- them the players with the most of each value get to score the amount they have. ( E.G. Person with 5 16th-note/rest values has more than everyone else, therefore they get 25 points, each of the cards counting for as many points as cards held.)

name: Mage Clash
description:
Long ago in Seven Cities of Gray, two adepts began a journey to learn forbidden majicks. Over three ages they created magical objects and potions, translated arcane cantrips, and discovered lost artifacts of four ancient mages: Arden, Balor, Canna and Dynin. In time their powers grew to the point where they, and their allies, fought each other with spells and wards across the Seven Cities for the title of Master Mage!

Mage Clash is a game for 2 players, lasting about 30 to 45 minutes.

Players will need the tiles and cards for the game, 5 six-sided dice, a set of traditional D&D dice and 80 eurocubes in 2 colors.

The game is played in two phases.

During the first phase - Learning Majick - players will play tiles (Magic Items, Mystic Objects, Magic Spells, Casting Wards, Potions and Cantrips) from their hands by paying Elemental Resource costs. Each type of tile has a different power associated with it and the collection of sets allows a player to gain victory points or have the choice of Special Artifacts to be used in the second phase. Discard tiles boost a players army and mana abilities.

The first phase lasts eight rounds and mid-game victory points scored

In the second phase of the game - Combat in the Cities - players use their Magic Spells, Casting Wards and Special Artifacts to combat each other in seven cities. Some cities have special powers of their own that affect the combat; each city is also worth victory points.

Each Magic Spell has a certain number of dice associated with it. Players roll five dice, taking a subset of these, augmented by their Casting Wards. Armies act as hit points in each of the cities and players combat each other until one player wins 4 of the 7 cities.

Phase Two victory points are added to those of Phase One to determine a winner.

Best Fantasy-Themed Game category in the 2013 Two-Player Print-and-Play Design Contest!

3rd Place - Best Art/Graphic Design category in the 2013 Two-Player Print-and-Play Design Contest!

3rd Place - Most Colorblind-Friendly Game category in the 2013 Two-Player Print-and-Play Design Contest!
categories: Fantasy, Fighting, Print & Play, Territory Building
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Set Collection, Variable Player Powers

name: A Call To Arms: Star Fleet – Kzinti Fleet Box
description:
Publisher Blurb:

The Fleet Boxes are designed for use with any game set in the Star Fleet Universe, including A Call to Arms: Star Fleet, Star Fleet Battles, Federation Commander, and Starmada. Each contains enough ships for a complete fleet in these games and will allow players to quickly expand their forces.

This box set contains 16 ships for the Kzinti Hegemony, along with 6 shuttles and a pocket rulebook – all you need to start playing!

- Dreadnought
- Heavy Battlecruiser
- Fast Cruiser
- Light Cruiser x4
- Medium Cruiser x4
- War Destroyer x2
- New Heavy Cruiser
- Battlecruiser
- Frigate
- Shuttles x6
- Pocket Rulebook

This product is being done as a joint venture with Amarillo Design Bureau, Inc., under the strict terms of their contract with Paramount Pictures Corporation.
categories: Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Tiny Grumpy Armies
description:
In this card game for 2 to 4, players assume the role of a video game mini boss vying for control of the kingdom. Each player must deftly manage their personal army of minions to kidnap the most princesses before the game ends!

This game has three different rule-sets, and while the initial setup is the same, the different gameplay rules provide vastly different experiences.
SURLY SKIRMISH is the recommended game for new players. It keeps things fast and light and theres a lot of immediate chances spite your opponents.

FOGGY FRONT-LINES is a simultaneous action blind bidding game, with the added bonus of an embarrassing hat.

CRANKY CAMPAIGN is a slightly heavier worker placement type game about careful timing and waiting to see the whites of their beady little eyes.

All game modes involve deploying squads of minions to claim MAP cards, which in turn have various effects, such us kidnapping princesses or messing with your opponent's army.
Also recruiting more troops into your army can give you a big advantage later.

Once the timer pile is depleted and the FINALE card is captured, players add up their final score (determined by the princesses they've captured) and find out who deserves to be crowned the next BIG BOSS.
categories: Card Game, Fantasy, Humor, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management

name: AT-43 Hero Box: Atis Astarte
description: Atis-Astarte is an unusual rank alpha overseer, a commander for the Therian army and its first hero. She enjoys battle so much that she specialized in close combat. Leading her grim golems, she attacks anything within her reach with celebrated fury. Her secret move: a unique routine allowing her to teleport her unit in contact with the enemy!
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: AT-43 Unit Box: Grim Golems
description:
Grim golems are assassins and hunters. With their optical jamming devices, they can step out on the frontline without fear. There is no point establishing any complex strategy: they run straight for the enemy, drowning him in waves of fire before finally engaging him to give him a taste of their reaper blades.
• Box of 6 miniatures.
4 Grim golems. Armament: reaper blades/reaper blades.
1 Grim golem. Armament: flamer.
1 Grim golem leader. Armament: reaper blades/reaper blades.
• 3 cards : Grim golem.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Autumn Ash
description:
This is a strategic game of color change for Looney Pyramids that uncommonly incorporates all ten standard Xeno and Rainbow colors. The pyramids are meant to represent a vast array of differently colored autumnal leaves. The goal is to bag "leaves" (aka pyramids) worth twenty points before your opponent does.

The game is either played on a 5X6 board or on a full chess board (in the “Advanced” rules variant).

With each turn, players enter a new piece and move that or another one of their pieces on the board. At the end of their movement phase, the piece moved progresses to a pyramid of the next color in a sequence and is optionally changed to a different sized piece, each of which have a distinct strategic value. Identically colored pieces that are made into rows of three or more are removed from the board and scored.

name: AT-43 Unit Box: Nakovalny Sierp
description: The Sierp is a light anti-infantry artillery armored fighting vehicle. Its high Movement allows it to remain in movement and to pick the best shooting point to harass enemy forces. Light mortars have devastating effects, but the Sierp has another major asset: this strider comes with a communication disruptor that cancels the opponent’s LP. Short, but tough, it is a nasty sting in your opponent’s side!
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: AT-43 Unit Box: Dotch Yaga
description: The Dotch Yaga is here to win. It can potentially destroy two soldier units at a time, and there is nothing they can do about it. Even the heavy weapons mounted on armored fighting vehicles have difficulties causing the Dotch Yaga any serious damage. With a few shots, the Dotch Yaga must deny the enemy’s ability to control a target. All it has left to do then is deal with the remaining armored fighting vehicles, which its heavy Gauss will take care of with great efficiency.

name: AT-43 Attachment Box: Assault Golem
description:
This Attachement Box includes an assault golem overseer with a nucleus rifle and reaper blades, two assault golems with nucleus rifle and three assault golems with flamer.
Thanks to these extra choices, your Therian soldiers will benefit from true leadership and a larger range of special weapons. Flamer or nucleus gun, firestorm or surgical strikes, adapt your methods to the enemy.

name: ATS TT: Bandenkrieg – Hell Behind the Eastern Front
description:
From the publisher's webpage:

North of BORISOV, RUSSIA, 4 April 1943: Operation Lenz Sud had commenced in hopes of finally reducing or eliminating the growing Partisan force near Borisov. As the German forces began the push the partisans were ready and awaiting for an ambush. The Partisans were not trained soldiers and the tactics of the partisans were simple and the challenges put on them by their leaders were less than would be expected from a military unit. Surprise and ambush were their best tactic. Their spot chosen lay on both sides of the Narotch stream. Having capturing a German field gun earlier and using their long hidden anti tank gun—a leftover from the retreating Russians in 1941—the ambush was prepared. Mines were placed, demolition charges were planted by explosive teams smuggled behind German lines and now the wait began. One Partisan survivor remembered: “We would ambush the Germans on the Narotch stream bank. We knew the Germans planned to come to the aid of the guard from the other side of the stream. Our commander, Sagalchik, was also a guide, as he had lived in Miadel for many years and was familiar with the area. When we arrived everything was quiet. Suddenly shots were heard. We lay down and awaited the Germans. When we received the sign to attack we ran to the houses where the Germans and Lithuanian sharpshooters were. The battle lasted a few hours and the Germans dispersed.” Within an hour the fight was over leaving the battlefield in partisans hands. The Germans suffered 40 dead and over 50 wounded. “Lenz-Sud’ was off to a bloody start.

Here at CH we're into firsts. We like to delve into esoteric fronts and combatants. We don't base our creative decisions on the bottom line. We live to provide our fellow gamers opportunities to explore their labors of love, pet topics, to read-up, research ... literally 'disappear into the stacks' of their private libraries and public archives. In Bandenkrieg: HELL BEHIND THE EASTERN FRONT each and every one of those touch-points are struck like a chord. A map by Larry Winslow ... a design that has been augmented, added to ... since inception. Actions that have never seen the light of day on a historical map. It's all 'in there' and then some.

If you love new color die-cut counters with a purpose ... i.e., scenarios that use them ... you'll get Polizei infantry. You'll also get Schuma soldiers, new AFVs in black with German designations including the LKW ZIS (with Russian LMG), PzKw T26B 738(r), PSW 42 ADGZ, PSW BAF 203(r), Pzkw T-70 743(r) ... and more! And this motley crew of polyglot squads with their under-powered AFV collection has to take on the OOB of Russian Partisan counters ... all new, color die-cut beauties ... on their home turf. Besides home field advantage, the Partisans are armed with captured weapons, guile, and livestock. Yes, counters for all of the above (including Battlefield Gleaning counters via a variant rule .... for guile) are provided.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, World War II

name: White Lotus Masters
description:
In White Lotus Masters, players use Focus to play cards, called Techniques, to attack opponents and to defend from incoming attacks. Players gain and lose Position in a struggle to see who will be victorious before either player runs out of cards.

Players use the same seven cards to attack and defend, which leads to interesting decisions about how much to attack or if incoming attacks should be blocked at all.

You can play as an Air Master, a Water Master, a Fire Master, an Earth Master, or a Master Warrior. There are many ways to play, including a team game and random play. The game includes over 200 cards, making variety of play vast.

Available exclusively on thegamecrafter.com!

name: Mayday!Mayday!: Expansion set for a 9th/10th player
description: This is the expansion to play *Mayday!Mayday!* with 9 or 10 players.

name: The Defence of Calais: An Early War Scenario & Campaign Booklet for I Ain't Been Shot, Mum!
description: In May 1940, with British troops being evacuated from the beaches at Dunkirk, the ancient port of Calais stood on the critical western flank of the Anglo-French lines. In a desperate bid to shore up the flank Chruchill committed the British 30th Infantry Brigade to defend Calais to the last. What ensued was an heroic struggle that is writ large in the annals of British military History. Here Robert Avery presents fourteen historical scenarios for I Ain't Been Shot Mum that bring to light those events in that "last ditch" over sixty years ago.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II

name: Slow Motion
description:
"Slow Motion" is a filler board game about snail racing. Players must bet on snails in a race, and help their snails to get good positions, in order to make more money and win the game. The game takes about 30 minutes.

During the game, players have three possible actions: play a action card (basically moving the snails); buy action cards; and buy betting tickets. Each player runs one action per turn.

When the first snail reachs the finish line, the game ends immediately. Then, each player adds up his betting tickets and his remaining money. The player with the most money is the winner.

name: Burgermeister!: Pie – Promo
description: Pie - A 5 point Extra card to mix into your set of Burgermeister!

name: Smooth & Rifled
description:
Smooth & Rifled is a Tactical level miniatures wargame system designed to recreate skirmish games with 28, 20 or 15mm miniatures. This very first edition covers the period from approximately 1700 to approximately 1900. The French and Indian War, the American Revolutionary War, the Napoleonic Wars, the American Civil War and the wars of the Colonial era are just some of the periods you can play with Smooth & Rifled.

The Smooth & Rifled rulebook contains the "nuts & bolts" of play. Each conflict covered by the game is available from the publisher as separate free pdf's.
categories: Age of Reason, Book, Miniatures, Napoleonic, Post-Napoleonic, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Simulation, Variable Player Powers

name: Viking
description:
The game is about attacking the settlements of other vikings, sink their viking ships and plunder their gold. To win, one must collect 2 golden treasures on one's own settlement or sink all competing viking ships. [translation of box cover blurb]

Each turn, a player rolls two dice and moves either one of initially 7 ships a number of squares equal to the sum of the dice or two ships each according to one of the dice. While moving, ships must avoid squares with obtacles or islands and other ships, except on the final square where it can sink another player's ship or enter an island. When sinking a ship with a gold treasure or entering an island with one, a ship captures the treasure.

Game contents:

1 board
7 plastic viking ships in each of the 4 colours
4 golden plastic disks to represent treasures
2 normal 6-sided dice
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Pick-up and Deliver

name: Warhammer 40,000: Crusade of Fire
description:
Publisher Blurb

Crusade of Fire is a campaign system for Warhammer 40,000 that enables you to join the campaign to control the Corvus Sub-sector. Whether you choose to join the Crusade of Fire itself, the foul Servants of Ruin or the bloodthirsty Prophets of War, the fate of the sub-sector lies in your hands.

This 96-page, full-colour hardcover book features fantastic artwork and a host of dynamic new rules. As well as the campaign system itself, the book contains rules that can be used in any Warhammer 40,000 game, from massive multi-player scenarios fought in low-gravity environments or in bunkers deep below the ground, to expanded rules for Flyers. It also features rules for playing games in the gladiatorial arenas of Commorragh as well as for fighting battles on the surface of a Daemon World.

Crusade of Fire also features the story of nine hobbyists as they play through the campaign, including detailed battle reports, fantastic army showcases and turn-by-turn accounts of their conquest
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Bulwark: Jakab Startouched
description:
From publisher description:

Heroic Co-operative Deck-Building!

Eschewing the narrow study and academic focus of the Council of Mages, Jakab learned from the example of the elves and mastered something resembling their traditional magic. Having travelled all over the world in the process, he is a seasoned adventurer and mighty opponent on the field of battle. He was named Startouched by his tutors for his celestial inspiration, and not for having a head full of sky. He says.

Welcome to Hard Mode

Jakab Startouched is a new Hero deck, fully compatible with the base game. It introduces a little randomness to the Hero supply piles, making for a less predictable start to the game. He is recommended for experienced Bulwark players.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Variable Player Powers

name: Bulwark: Magister Kelemen
description:
From publisher description:

Heroic Co-operative Deck-Building!

Magister Kelemen is a peaceful water mage, consumed with furthering his knowledge of magic. Unfortunately, his attempts to conduct research always seem to be interrupted by monsters, bandits and invading armies. Consequently, he is one of the most powerful battle mages in the world. One day he hopes to set up a laboratory that isn't swarming with demons, on fire or both by the end of the first week.

Welcome to Hard Mode

Magister Kelemen is a new Hero deck, fully compatible with the base game. It introduces a new mechanic, mana, that makes forcing combinations of cards more critical than ever. He also takes time to develop his deck, making him hard to manage for short Start Phases. He is recommended for experienced Bulwark players.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Variable Player Powers

name: Geo Chess
description:
This is a circular 3 person variant of chess with all three players having starting pieces on the outside of the board as well as on a central inner circle.

This 3-player chess variant is played on a board that is a torus. It has an interesting set-up in that each player's King starts in an "isolated" board square, which makes them both not immediately accessible nor able to escape quickly. It also has "walls" between various board areas that can't be crossed.

name: Monopoly: Power Rangers 20th Anniversary Edition Game
description: Go, Go, Power Rangers. The Power Rangers 20th Anniversary Edition of MONOPOLY allows players to buy, sell and trade iconic locations spanning the entire history including Gosei’s Command Center, The Power Chamber, Rita Repulsa’s Palace and more.
categories: Economic, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Negotiation
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: The Upside
description:
A party game of Silver Linings.
Laugh with friends as you discover hope in the bleakest situations your twisted minds can invent. Inspired by research into how positive thinking (and a sense of humor) promotes mental health, The Upside is a lighthearted and uplifting way to spend 30 minutes realizing that you might not have it so bad after all.

Every round starts with a little chaos and mayhem. Players roll the disaster dice to provide the who, what and how of each round's terrible situation. The dice produce combinations like "Global medical disaster" or "Personal Financial Adversity"

Then players flip over an inspiration card where Mr. Upside suggests how to make the situation even worse. All of a sudden the story could become "Global Medical Disaster caused by Diabolical Mermaids" which is so much more awesome.

Then players race to find the silver lining by coming up with the most creative positive spin to life's little disasters before time runs out. Responses get one point for being unique and one point for being the best of the round. Play continues until a player has 13 positivity points- whereupon he or she is dubbed the quintessential Mr. Upside.

name: Obelisk
description:
Obelisk is a 2 player game that is played on the spaces of a 7x7 board.

48 Reversi/Othello pieces and a single white piece, known as the Obelisk is all that is needed.

Objective
Last player to make a valid move on his turn wins.

Definitions
Adjacent from now on means, orthogonally and diagonally adjacent.

Play
The Obelisk is placed at the center of the board at start.

Decide who goes first.

Players have 2 moves per turn, but may do one of two actions per move.

1.Place a reversi piece white side up on an empty adjacent space to the Obelisk and then move the Obelisk away from the placed reversi piece a queens move any distance across the board, so long as the move also ends on an empty space or

2.Place a reversi piece white side up on an empty space that is in line of sight with the Obelisk and then moving the Obelisk like a queens move, adjacent to that placed reversi piece, so long as the move also ends on an empty space.

Note and restrictions

•The Obelisk when moving, may travel over any number of white faced reversi pieces, but in doing so must flip over all those pieces to their black sides.

•The Obelisk may not travel over any black pieces.

The game ends when a player on her turn is unable to place a reversi piece and move the Obelisk, making her opponent the winner.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Grid Movement, Point to Point Movement, Tile Placement

name: AFL the Board Game
description:
Choose your favourite team then line up against your rival for the opening bounce. The electronic scoreboard will sound the siren, just like a real game, and you’re away. Position your defenders to thwart your opposition’s attacking moves and then try to gain possession of the footy and successfully negotiate your way down the ground, positioning yourself for a shot at goal.

Listen out for the umpire’s whistle along the way and avoid giving away free kicks. Once in position for a shot at goal the fun begins. Place your ball on the Super kicker, go back and line up. Will the pressure get to you, will the crowd boos put you off or will you hold your nerve like a champion forward and put it through the middle of the big sticks for a 6 pointer to hear the crowd go wild?

name: CardCraft: Base Set
description:
From The Game Crafter, LLC:

Cool Factors
-Short setup time. Ready to play in minutes
-High variety between games. Great replay value
-Awesome RPG style pixel art

Retro RPG-styled deck building card game

Welcome to CardCraft! The deck building game set in the world of classic RPG’s! Delve through dungeons, gather party members, find new equipment, slay monsters and eventually claim the Magic Crystal that sits guarded by its vicious keeper!

This is the Base Game, needed for all additional expansion content and ready to play in minutes for up to 2 players.

New expansions will be released regularly, with the first scheduled shortly after launch!
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Exploration, Fantasy, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management

name: AT-43 Attachment Box: Wing Troopers
description:
“Imagine yourself overlooking a battlefield from thirty five thousand kilometers above. Death from on high.”
– Wing troopers’ advertisement campaign, AT-42.

The Attachment Box: Wing Troopers contains all the miniatures necessary to strengthen a standard wing trooper unit: officers (ranking from sergeant to colonel), a medic and special weapon bearers (a laser gun, a missile launcher and two sniper guns).

The wing troopers form extremely fast and deadly units. They are the spearhead of the offensive. Their favorite strategy is to strike behind enemy lines, catching the enemy in a pincer movement, and fall back on a defensive position once it is done.

With an extended choice of special weapons and the addition of officers to their ranks, your wing troopers can now face any kind of threat. There are literally going fall upon the enemy!

Contents:
• Box of 6 miniatures + 6 alternative heads, 1 officer with assault rifle, combat knife, grenades. 1 missile launcher bearer. 1 Volcano MG bearer. 1 flamer bearer. 1 medic with assault rifle, combat knife & grenades. 1 field engineer with assault rifle, combat knife & grenades.
• 8 cards : Wing trooper officer x5, Wing trooper x3
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: AT-43 Hero Box: Lieutenant Dragomira O-3
description:
"Right away, Sir!" "But...I haven't given you any orders yet?!?" "No need. I know." - Lieutenant Dragomira O-3, before her first engagement.

Dragomira O-3 is an officer and a hero for the Red Blok army. She can become the officer of any Dragomirov kolossus unit. Lieutenant Dragomira O-3 is a monster of endurance that not only allows to increase the maximum number of fighters in her unit, but she also provides it with an excellent officer. Her "Gestalt" ability increases the leadership point pool of her company. The special rules for Dragomira O-3 are detailed in AT-43 Campaign: Frostbite. T

Contains:
1 miniature
1 card
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: AT-43 Attachment Box: RPG Soldaty
description:
“In the absence of orders, seek something worth shooting and destroy it.”
- Popular RPG soldaty instruction.

Here come the officers available to lead the RPG soldaty to victory. They lead their men with an iron hand and obtain such obedience from them that these officers are respected for their leadership skills throughout the universe.

To make sure nothing will ever stop your RPG soldat units, here are some extra special weapons and specialists. There will never be too many soldiers to defend the Revolution!

The box contains 6 miniatures plus the appropriate cards.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Spiders!
description:
A simultaneous strategy game for 2-4 players.

You are a spider competing with other spiders to build webs and catch flies around a house, but watch out for the humans!

The bigger your web the more likely you are to catch a fly, and the more likely you are to be spotted by the terrible humans.

Each player plays cards that causes humans, flies and spiders to act at the same time. Plot your own plans while attempting to interrupt others.

The winner is the first to catch three flies, or the last spider standing, depending on the difficulty setting.

name: Barbarossa's Climax:  Moscow 1941
description:
My proposed successor to a Moscow-Campaign-scale/-type game, Barbarossa's Climax: Moscow 1941, available as a free print (off, assemble,) and play game at www.CoatneyHistory.com/BarbClim.htm .

As relatively simple as it is, it is still a 4-player afternoon-and-evening - weekend - game. There *is* a system-introducing Battle for Tula subgame with it (like 1st Alamein is the subgame for my larger Battles for Alamein, and I have also just completed a smaller scaled Battle for Moscow game, Moscow vs. Barbarossa 1941 - at www.CoatneyHistory.com/MvB41.htm - which incorporates and demonstrates (in its smaller and more simple format) many of BC's basic design concepts).

6-day turns, 10mis/16kms per hex, brigade-division level, Blitzkrieg breakthrough phase (in addition to higher odds BReakthrough combat results enabling a unit to attack twice), Combat Odds Round Off (including UP) and *Expansion* Rule, Russian Katyusha Rocket Regiments (8, eventually), the obligatory Siberian Reserve Gamble, and more.

Over 300 units, most of them infantry having Entrenched/(Artillery-)Emplaced backside.
categories: Print & Play, Wargame, World War II

name: RRR: Seiji Kanai Promo Tile
description: This promo tile for RRR allows a player to discard this tile on their turn if it is currently their ally.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy

name: Shingeki no Ohama: Jinshin War
description:
Issue game of Wargame Japanese History #19.

Strategic level wargame for the civil war in ancient Japan.
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jinshin_War

"Shingeki no Ohama" means Advance of Prince Ohama. Prince Ohama was the winner of the Jinshin War, and then he became Emperor Tenmu.

Players control a faction of either Prince Ohama or Prince Ohtomo. On each turn, players secretly select three of five action chits. Each chit allows movement, mobilization, or an event.

The battle is resolved by the strength of the Army and leader, and does not use a die or other randomizer. Army strength is undefined before they engage their first battle.

Winner is determined by control of an important place or the elimination of the opponent Prince.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Mentis: The Wolf
description:
The Wolf adds a new tile to your starting hand but is not considered part of the core game. The Wolf introduces an imbalance to the game (and its core strategies) which is why it is not considered part of the base game. The Wolf is intended as an extra tile to add just a little bit of lighthearted fun and a small token of appreciation to those who backed the game.

Deployment Rules

The Wolf obeys the regular deployment rules except that, unlike regular tiles, the Wolf can be deployed onto a tile adjacent to an enemy tile.
The Wolf cannot be deployed as part of a stack.

Movement Rules

The Wolf tile can move only 1 square per turn and can move diagonally.
The Wolf tile can never form part of a stack, either during or at the conclusion of its move, nor during the movement or at the conclusion of the movement of any other tile.

Capture Rules

The Wolf tile can only capture an enemy tile which is one tile away, orthogonally or diagonally.

The Wolf cannot block any attacks, and the Wolf can capture and be captured by all the other tiles.

name: 元亀争乱: ソリティア信長包囲網 (Genki Sōran)
description:
Solitaire wargame of the 1570-1582 Oda Nobunaga campaign.

Genki was a Japanese era part of the Sengoku period.

The player manages resources and vassals of the Oda clan, and allocates them to various hostile clans. Hostile clans are driven by the event cards.
The player wins when he defeats all hostile clans.


1st edition: issue game of Wargame Japanese History #18.
2nd edition: Command Japan "The Best" 17.

2nd edition components:
◇ 1 manual (16 pages of rules and tutorials)
◇ 1 B3 size map
◇ 1 counter sheet (20 mm square)
◇ 2 card sheets (30 cards)


元亀争乱 Genki era war

ソリティア信長包囲網 Solitaire Nobunaga's Siege
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Asakura_Yoshikage
mechanics: Action Points, Point to Point Movement

name: Giftzwerge Erweiterung
description:
This expansion for Giftzwerge contains 4 new symbols (toadstool, golden sun, silver moon, grey glove) on 30 transparent stickers.
They are put on empty lawn tiles of each player and the compost heap.

Toadstool: Remove one purple toadstool chip in the compost heap from the game. If there are none left, you are eliminated from the game.

Golden sun: Protects you from all actions of other players, as long as your lawnmower rests on the golden sun.

Silver moon: Secretly look under as many lawn tiles of your garden or the compost heap as your dice throw shows. You may tell one or more neighbours.

Grey glove: Swap the positions of any two tiles in one garden (including start and poison tiles).

Contents:
30 transparent stickers
7 purple toadstool chips
1 streamlined rules sheet (including new rules)
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Tile Placement

name: Bulwark: Miksa's Redoubt
description:
From publisher description:

Heroic Co-operative Deck-Building!

Someone once called Baron Miksa a 'slimy, double-crossing swineherd'. That man disappeared in mysterious circumstances, at around the same time as the foundations were laid for the Baron's new castle. The Redoubt is a stronghold built to be secure on a budget. Alas, the Baron seems to have underestimated the forces it needs to hold against.

More Options

Miksa's Redoubt is a location with plenty of fortification cards, requiring forward-planning to defend effectively. With little on offer to get rid of unwanted cards, you have to take every potential wound seriously.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Variable Player Powers

name: Bulwark: Traitor's Crossing
description:
From publisher description:

Heroic Co-operative Deck-Building!

What better location to defend than a muddy mess of a riverbank near a strategically-important bridge? After all, without the inconvenience of stout walls, gates and so forth, you can see all of the enemy arrows on their way to you. Unless, for some reason, you think that might be a bad thing...

More Options

Traitor's Crossing is a location with plenty of defender cards, meaning you can build a successful deck with relatively few hero cards.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Variable Player Powers

name: Subterfuge
description:
Subterfuge is a 2-player, luck-free, abstract strategy game played on a standard chess /checkers board using 12 standard dice (6 each in 2 separate colours).

The game has many similarities to chess but uses d6 dice as the pieces. Each player starts with their 6 dice in their home territory and they advance into the field to play. Players alternate moving one of their pieces with the winner being the first player to capture 4 of their opponent’s pieces.

The value of each die face determines the movement and capability of the piece – smaller values move lesser distances but can Capture larger dice – higher value dice move greater distances but Expose smaller dice - equal value dice Influence the value of neighbouring dice, including your own. Pieces may move forward or backward according to the movement rules defined for each die facing.

Stuterfuge includes many layers of strategic play and brain-burning tactical play, as the dice values change throughout the game. Game length can vary between 15 to 60 mins, depending on the time permitted for each move. Multiple variants are also included in the rules, allowing wildly different tactics and play for each game.

name: Jelly Bean Farmers
description:
Jelly Bean Farmers is a light-hearted game in which you build your farm in a tableau in front of you. You gain food by growing it on your farm or by plundering your opponents as a warlord. Struggle through drought, pestilence, and aggressive neighbors to become the greatest farmer of all time!

The game can be played with 2 to 4 players, but is best with 4. The game content is appropriate for any age, but the complexity would be a reasonable challenge for a bright seven year old. Game play is about 45 minutes to an hour, and you will have eaten (usually) 16 of the edible counters when you are done. (... so don't use large cookies or shots of tequila, but animal crackers or small, disposable cups of beer work fine).

The game lasts for 8 'years,' where each year is split into two seasons. Each year the players draw cards and choose (in advance) one to play each in the spring and summer seasons. The players choose whether or not to plant their fields for the spring season, then the spring weather is revealed and players resolve their actions. There is some flexibility in how a player chooses to resolve the action, especially if he did not plant, but he must use the card that he previously selected for the season. Crops are calculated and each player must eat one 'food.' Hopefully he is not eating the last of his seed crop! Then the planting, weather, action resolution, and crop resolution are repeated for the summer season. Finally, any warlord tribute is paid before the next year starts.

The game is about 60% luck and 40% skill -- the best players tend to win more often but not every game. It is silly and fun, with unexpected turnarounds due to odd weather or unexpected cards. There is also a mechanic where a player who has been wiped out can cash in 'food stamps' and keep playing.

name: Conflicted: The Survival Card Game
description:
Can you handle the decisions you'll face after Doomsday? When civilization and infrastructure are gone, where will you draw the line between your morals and your will to live another day? Most importantly, where will your friends and loved ones who you'll be spending this difficult time with draw the line for themselves?

Conflicted: The Survival Card Game, designed to help you think about life in a post apocalyptic world, lets you explore your own survival philosophy and that of others. On a turn, a player reads the scenario on a card to his neighboring player — for example, Russia, China, North Korea and Venezuela declare war on the United States following the collapse of the dollar — then this player has three minutes to explain how he's respond to this scenario. Everyone else then awards the answering player 0-3 points, either in secret or openly as decided by the group beforehand. Whoever has the most points after an agreed upon number of rounds wins and is deemed best prepper for the end of times.

name: Normandy Firefight: Detailed Skirmish Combat Rules for WWII
description:
A set of fast-play tabletop wargames rules for small infantry skirmishes, set during WWII.

From the introduction:

This is Normandy Firefight, a set of fast-play skirmish wargame rules for recreating infantry vs. infantry firefights during World War II. It pits between two and six characters per side against each other in perhaps a minute of frantic, close-quarters combat action. Do not be distracted by the name. The game is set in Normandy (during the close-quarters hedgerow fighting between American and German soldiers), but these rules can be used and played anywhere during WWII.

The main rules deal with the Normandy fighting and the equipment used there, but the Appendices include profiles for other weapons, including those used in other theaters (such as Russia) and at other times during the war.

The game is d100-based, and uses 54mm figures, with conversion rules for 28mm and 20mm scales.

name: The Bitcoin Harvest
description:
"The Bitcoin Harvest" is a paper-and-pencil game for 2 or more players that was published on issue 16 of Bitcoin Magazine. It is a derivative of Hippos & Crocodiles by the same designer.

It uses a type of puzzle piece that has been around for more than a century: the pentomino, and also the concept of harvesting (picking items already placed on the board).

RULES

Start by drawing a rectangular grid of any size. 10x10 is recommended for beginners, but for more than 2 players you might need a bigger grid.

Secondly, and by turn, each player chooses a different pentomino shape. This pentomino will be his ‘harvester’, and the only piece he will use during the game.

The player that chose a shape in first place draws two coins in any empty cells of the grid.

Then, starting with the second player, players take turns doing the following:

1. Draw your harvester on the board, so it doesn’t overlap other previously drawn pentominos and no parts of it land outside the board. You can (and should) draw it so it overlaps some coins. Notice that you can draw it rotated or symmetrized, as long as it fits with the grid.
2. Score as many coins as the pentomino has covered
3. Draw another 2 coins in any two empty spaces (not occupied by coins or pentominoes).
4. Pass your turn to the next player.

If you’re not capable of legally drawing a pentomino (no room for it) you must pass your turn. If all players pass in succesion the game ends. The player with the highest score wins.

As a variant, before the game starts players can agree on the number of coins drawn each turn.

name: AT-43 Unit Box: Molot
description:
Among the Red Block striders, the Molot is undoubtedly the most threatening. With two light flamers it can destroy almost any infantry unit with one volley. As part of division they make a real firestorm, which can turn any opponent into smoldering debris.

The downside of the Molot is the limited range of his weapons.

Equipped with two speakers, it doesn't only strike fear into the hearts of his enemies but it can also broadcast messages to the officers, hereby eliminating any risk of misunderstood or manipulated orders.

Contains:
1 Molot with 2 light flamers
1 supply container
2 cards
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: K-Blort
description: K-Blort is a nod to classic arcade games of the past where quick thinking and strategic game play are the keys to victory. Move your K-Blort around the pyramid capturing cubes while your opponents do the same. Think 5 steps ahead, use special tokens to block enemy progress, and access warps to secure the most cubes.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection
publishers: Enigma Nexus, The Game Crafter, LLC

name: Los Cthuluchadores: Elder Things in the Wrestling Ring
description:
As a Cthuluchador, you choose from wrestling actions and signature moves to outwit your opponents. These actions, like grapple, shamble and counter, result in ooze, damage and the domination of the crowd.

The first player to squeeze the ooze from his opponents or coerce the crowd to his evil cult wins.

During the game, players simultaneously decide what card (action) they want to play. Depending on the interaction of the cards, players get to perform their actions and taunt the other player for bonus cultists. Within the wrestling ring the focus is on the Cthuluchadores outwitting each other and trying to squeeze the other Cthuluchador dry. In the spectator arena a different game is being played. The Cthuluchadores try to coerce the crowd into their loyal cult following to be able to take the arena by storm.

- Fast-paced and frenetic mashup of two popular themes
- Easy to learn, but deep and oozy strategies
- Gameplay revolves around out-thinking opponents
- Taunting Mechanics: Bonuses for funny gestures and sounds
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Rock-Paper-Scissors, Role Playing
